Reviews.Title: “Next time I prefer to stay at the D. Inn”
Reviews.Author: Reviews103
Reviews.Content: Good service, but prices too high for the value. They are renovating the hotel (no pool, no bar) and they don't advise the guests. Bad investment...

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy”
Reviews.Author: Anon Y
Reviews.Content: Wouldn't recommend staying here unless you want to party all night. The place is super noisy. Like most W hotels, after hours the place turns into a lounge/club. When you check in, they give you some club passes that will get you into the "secure" areas. The biggest problem I had with this hotel was the noise that filtered into the rooms from the club. It's one thing to have a happening club; but when you go back to your room, you want an oasis of peacefulness. This is not to place to find that.

Reviews.Title: “Fail”
Reviews.Author: Bob G
Reviews.Content: My wife and i booked via Hotwire so i really didnt have a choice on which hotel i stayed at. Overall, it seems like they have tried to be hip and trendy but have failed miserably on all counts. The room was like a college dorm with ikea furniture. Not trendy and chic, but cheap looking. The bed was comfortable. Parking is way over priced! $35 per day. They are in the middle of a remodel so some amenities are closed. The pool is small and not inviting. While many hotels now offer free wifi, this place still charges $15 per day. The worst thing was that there is a labour dispute with workers involved in the renovation so there are people picketing outside the hotel all day. "Shame on the W" and "improper treatment of immigrant labor" read some of the signs. i dont know the reasons for the labour dispute but the hotel staff told me it was because they hired non union workers to do the renos. The W advertises that it is in the Gaslamp district - it certainly is not. It is a 10 min walk to the gaslap district. Bottom line - way over priced for what hotwire calls a 4 star. I would say this is more like a 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property...”
Reviews.Author: jimsammons
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel like most W's I've been to are, but not in gaslamp district as advertised. Still a short walk away. Karl Strauss Brewery has a restaurant located within hotel which was very good. Staff did a great job welcoming us and let us check into our room at 10 AM which is always nice.

Reviews.Title: “wow wonderful”
Reviews.Author: denise B
Reviews.Content: Great place! So unique. The whole vibe was young and hip. We felt like we were checking into a night club. Our room was fun yet luxerious. The staff was very attentive. The roof top patio unlike anywhere we had been before. Definetly a place to return to. No negatives to speak of. Enjoy yourself at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Still Wow, Wonderful and the Best the W has to offer”
Reviews.Author: Webpuccino
Reviews.Content: Since the W first started on Lexington Avenue in NYC, I have visited the W and have found the W in San Diego to be one of the best and also one of the first to open West of the Mason-Dixon Line. This W is in a rectangle building on B Street, a short walk to the Trolley and to Harbor Drive as well as a short walk to Horton Plaza and Little Italy. This property continues to amaze me and each time Is tay here, I like it more and more and look forward to visiting the W in places like Milan and Istanbul as a result of my visit here. This W has an awesome reputation among myslef and my fellow SPG Platinum travelers in that we often are upgraded and given either the Cool Corner or the WOW Suite. If you are traveling with a family, the WoW Suite is better and if traveling with your spouse, the Cool corner is recommended because it has a sunken tub and is more romantic. The W is known for its' fen shui and the design and layout of the rooms are modern and the windowseat divan is always good to sit up and work on your laptop while enjoying the view of downtown San Diego. Each room has a lapdesk to allow you to sit at the window and do work, The touches of coral and ambience upon entering the rooms are relaxing and put you in a restful state. I cannot tell you that you will find a better place to stay in San Diego. The Grant is good because of its' historic features and plaster work but the W is more modern and caters to the "in" crowd. The key is do you want modern amenities and comfort or a room that is historic and has character. Both are great but overall, the W has alot more going for it that other starwood properties do not have. The Living Room is always busy and the bar is always packed. The Restaurant here is good. Parking has gone up to $35.00/night now and they only offer Valet parking. It is about normal for downtown San Diego hotels so get over the sticker shock.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2Calgarians
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel rooms, staff and ammenities, but too noisy at night!

Reviews.Title: “stayed here for a night - perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Jennyp622
Reviews.Content: spent a lovely night in San D at the W. only complaint was that the pool/ rooftop was closed for renovations. it seemed a bit smaller than most of the W hotels ive stayed at. Great location close to Little Italy and Gas-lamp, Acura service is extremely helpful especially to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Typical W - Some nice touches but will NOT stay here again”
Reviews.Author: emnolan4
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W San Diego last weekend with my boyfriend and we were neither especially impressed or especially disappointed in our visit. In short, this hotel feels very outdated, like a hotel that was trendy a few years ago and is now past its prime. The hotel is currently under renovation in the pool bar area so hopefully they will address the rest of the hotel in due course as it is in dire need of a makeover (both visually and structurally)! Nice touches included: rice krispie treats and fruit-flavored water in the lobby during the day, complimentary bottles of water upon departure, complimentary taxi service with the "Acura Experience", unique room decoration (think chalkboards and window seats), very friendly staff (every time we entered the hotel, we were greeted by at least one employee; every time we left the hotel, we were offered directions and well wishes by at least one employee) Areas for improvement include: overpriced valet parking (at $35 a day, this was more than twice the cost of our rental car!), rooms are small and noisy (you can hear everything in the hallway and in adjacent rooms), pool area is cramped and does not allow much sun (note: this might be because of renovation that the full pool area is not open?). In addition, if you are walking from the hotel to the Gaslamp district, be careful as I did not find the area between the two to be very safe. As I mentioned, we didn't have a bad experience at this hotel, but we didn't have a great experience either. When we come back to San Diego, we will try another SPG property instead.

Reviews.Title: “good, trendy choice if you have to stay in downtown”
Reviews.Author: markusinmiami
Reviews.Content: Overall a nice-trendy hotel, if you have to stay in downtown and don't pay premium $$$. The lobby is a great spot to hang out, and the rooms are nice and beds are supercomfy (plus the Bliss soaps & gels), but I gave it 4 stars because of the dysfunctional shower & the surrounding area.

Reviews.Title: “Overall? Less than impressed”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Guy_76
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W Hotel in San Diego last week and was less than impressed. Yes, the lobby is beautiful (albeit far from original, fresh, etc. at this point), the one-word names for everything ('SLEEP' / 'SWEAT' / 'SNOOZE') somewhat clever - although a bit of a stretch in some cases - and the staff attractive (it counts, trust me), but given the cost, it's not someplace I'd stay again. Yes, it looks like a super bargain if you go by big number you see on travel sites or the W site (I got rates for $100/night), but once you add in the "extras" - parking, internet, one meal or a drink (also known as necessities for most people) - the actual rate is twice that. Something about that just seems sneaky, gross, and cheap. And when I filled out the post-stay questionnaire (make that "tried to fill out" - their site crashed 3 times and I gave up), I told them that. If the W style - modern, clean, white, a bit on the "I'm-a-d-bag-who-pays-$1,000-for-a-bottle-of-Kettle-One" side - was new, hot or original, I could almost overlook the shady pricing. Unfortunately, the brand itself, while nice/fine/trendy/well-designed, has been around - and done by many, many other hotels, both big and small. Adding to that, the W San Diego is a bit rough-around-the-edges, and even after their current upgrade of the restaurant and "Beach," will still be a little dusty. On the positive side, the staff is excellent (save for a few young d*cks parking cars), especially the maids, who are super friendly, do an amazing job, and are always smiling. Half of the valets were great; a few were grumpy (consistently) and two were outright rude. I loved that they sent a TV tech up w/in minutes when my remote wasn't working (fixed in less than 5-minutes), but got absolutely no help when I asked about an iPhone charge because mine was stolen during travel. (They'd sold out of their stock the week before and had none on hand... umm, they're $2 on Amazon- order a dozen!) The food menu is limited; granted they're remodeling the resto, but it could have been much better without a lot of trouble. Definitely not worth $200/night (after add-ons, fees, etc. - NOT including taxes) when I can get other 4-star (or even 5-star) for the same total price, and not have to walk through what feels like a club from Jersey Shores to get to my room at night. My direct feedback to them (attempted): Paying $35/night for parking (especially in downtown San Diego, which is not short on space, parking, etc.) and $15/day for internet makes me feel cheated, nickel-and-dimed, and like the hotel is being sneaky with pricing and not treating guests fairly or with respect. If you're actually going to charge that much, include it (or part of it) in the room. I realize not everyone uses/needs these services and that it raises the room rate - which isn't good for searches - but it's the W; people expect to pay more, and should get a higher level of service without having the final bill be more than double the original nightly cost after parking, internet, and one meal (w/o drinks). It's tacky and makes me think poorly of the brand.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: TerryHWashington_DC
Reviews.Content: Great location... an easy walk to good restaurants in the Gaslamp district. I stayed here for two nights for business, and I found the staff to be very helpful, proactive, and fun! Wheels had my car ready and waiting.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cslockbo
Reviews.Content: Near downtown within walking distance of Gaslamp and Petco Park.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: RoxleyAustralia
Reviews.Content: This hotel wasn´t cheap, so expected better. Room was okay but noise from swimming pool at 1.30 am was annoying. Reception and concierge not very well informed. Instead of concierge and reception, they use what they obviously think are cute names like ¨Wherever-whenever¨ for concierge, which means absolutely nothing to the guest trying to contact them via the room phone. Staff seemed inexperienced. I´m sure there´s better options in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: basvince
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the w on our first 3 nights in san diego. We arrived quite late on the first night and were welcomed very cheerfull and warm. We got a room on the 9th floor. The rooms are ok size. The decor is great! The beds are really comfy and the bathroom we had was huge. One downside is that the waterpressure of the shower is really low. So no nice hot shower. Wifi is good, fast and free in the lobby. Location is good. Just around the corner of little italy, the trolleystop and the ferry to coronado. Forcpartying you should find a hotel more to the gaslamp quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Nice W Hotel - Quiet Part of Town”
Reviews.Author: TravelinLeather
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in April after attending a business function at another hotel. It's in a quiet part of town (I was there Sat-Mon) but you are close enough to walk to Horton Plaza and some of the restaurants. Upon check in I was given a Cool Corner room which was large and very nice. The hotel was sold out Sat night and the lobby was very busy as it seemed to be one of the "it" places to be. The front desk staff was pleasant enough but didn't talk much. I don't know if this hotel had a club lounge and it was mentioned that my SPG number was on file.

Reviews.Title: “Good times”
Reviews.Author: Jfine48
Reviews.Content: Hotel room more than adequate and trendy. Can't wait to have a great time here during our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location/Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Guernseyguy
Reviews.Content: The W San Diego is handily close to Amtrak and a short walk from the Gas Lamp quarter. The hotel restaurant pool and rooftop bar were being refurbished when I was there - it would have been good to be told about this when as I was booking (as I was at another hotel undergoing refurbishment). Hotel rooms are contemporary and comfortably furnished - enjoyed a great night's sleep. The hotel is offering a complimentary Accura transfer service - which saved on a couple of taxis. Front of House staff were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “OVERPRICED not worth it”
Reviews.Author: babyboo69
Reviews.Content: As someone who stays in several hotels, I was really looking forward to staying at the W since it prides it's self on taking care of the customer, well it certainly did not!!! Firstly if you have a family then i really don't recommend it, this hotel is for young people. Secondly and most importantly is the air conditioner, it kept breaking down, and they tried fixing it 3 times!!!!! Thirdly there food is overpriced along with the hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay !”
Reviews.Author: dffey
Reviews.Content: i highly recommend the w san diego, they are currently undergoing refurbishment of their restaurant but apart from that my stay was perfect. the staff were very courteous and particularly william on the front desk. i would stay there again without a doubt !

Reviews.Title: “Stay at W Hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: chris c
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the W San Diego last weekend and we really enjoyed the experience. The room was clean, organized and well appointed. Had room service both Friday night and Saturday morning and both experieces were great! Try the Ceasar Salad with chicken... very good. Anyway, I would stay again. Great hotel stay!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It! Great Menu for a hotel :)”
Reviews.Author: sr4cr9
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last fall and really had a great stay ... but the one thing that really stood out was their menu ... I've stayed at many W Hotels (I stay at many SPG Hotels in general) and have never seen such a great menu and tasted such good food and I am talking about the room service ... even the W Hotel in Union Square (NYC) where I stay often (I actually live in NYC) doesn't come close! The churros con chocolate is one of the best I've ever tasted in my life - I haven't been able to find them at any other W :( ... definitely hope I need to go back again in the future! (I was there on a business trip.) Kudos, you guys really passed the test with flying colors, not only on food but the decor is great, service A+++ ... definitely one of the best stays at a W Hotel in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You”
Reviews.Author: Malanamy
Reviews.Content: The service from door-person to cleaning-crew to room-service was excellent and extremely friendly. I would also like to single out Vinney Valentino - who without his assistance my trip would not have been possible. An extremely unusual set of circumstances nearly prevented my attendance at an important national meeting being held in San Diego; the only reason that I was able to attend as scheduled was that Vinney took the time to listen, research and fully understand my predicament. Vinney then ensured that my stay at the W in San Diego went flawlessly. Once again, THANK YOU Vinney. I am pretty certain that without Vinney's direct intervention I can confidently say that I would not have stayed at a W in the future.

Reviews.Title: “W San Diego”
Reviews.Author: 3Alwyngton
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W in San Diego in early March 2012. The staff was uniformly fantastic, particularly the front desk (ashley shepherd was wonderful), but also The Living Room and housekeeping. Unfortunately, the hotel is undergoing renovations and the restaurant was closed. Looking around, it appears that the renovations are overdue. The hotel is a bit shabby and the rooms could stand a little bit of perking up. Good value, though

Reviews.Title: “Our Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Landon T
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the privilege to spend our Honeymoon in the beautiful San Diego, and the HONOR to stay at the W hotel in the downtown area. When we first arrived we were greeted by smiling front desk agents dressed very sharp and professional. They seemed so pleased to see us and our check-in was smooth and seamless. I was exhausted so it was a relief to see that our check-in was done in a matter of 5 minutes! The lobby was an amazing ambiance and had some huge TV's playing music videos and created such a club-like atmosphere. Once we got to our room (a Cool Corner room) we were delighted to see we were treated to a cheese plate, some chocolates, a bottle of wine, and a note congratulating us on our wedding. We loved the size of the room, and even the bathroom! The staff were so helpful too! We needed some help with working our DVD player and i assumed it was going to be a long difficult conversation, but the lady on the phone knew exactly what i was talking about and helped me so quickly. The next morning we needed some advice on a delicious breakfast spot, and the Valet person directed us to this amazing pancake house that had the BEST food! My wife and I felt like celebrities staying at the W. Any time we come back to San Diego we will ONLY be staying at the W Hotel! Do yourself a favor as well, If your in the downtown SD area for a weekend, stay at the W.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't what I expected”
Reviews.Author: sbjamie
Reviews.Content: From what I saw and read on the website I thought we would be staying at a swanky hotel with lots of perks. What they didn't say was that the time that I made my reservation, everything that was nice about the hotel was under renovation and my experience would be significantly different. The restaurant was closed, the beach/pool area was closed, no coffee in the hotel rooms, and the worst thing was that the fitness center had no doors so you felt like you were outside. That would have been fine if it was a bright sunny day, but when I was there it was cold, overcast and raining. When I went to the fitness center in the morning it was so cold, not to mention the machines were old, that I didn't feel comfortable to work out. I was staying there for 5 days and wanted to work out every morning, and didn't. Very frustrating, to not have the option to shut out the cold. To their credit, the customer service was outstanding so it was hard to complain, but I feel mislead when I made the reservation.

Reviews.Title: “W hotels are better...than this one”
Reviews.Author: rcorrao
Reviews.Content: This is my second, and probably last trip to the W San Diego. I love W hotels. I'm a Platinum SPG (100+ nights a year) and for W prices, have high expectations. My last visit was good enough to come back, but this visit will have me stay at another SPG property on my next visit to SD. The rooms are small - very (although the W on Lexington in NYC is technically smaller) - and the service is "okay". At $35 per night the valet (especially in the area of town the hotel is located is ridiculous. No self-park options and street parking is not only limited...but only feet from the local jail, probably not wise either. The do have the signature Acura service, but this time I had my infant with me...they have infant seats....which is great, except, they won't pick you up (even before the 8:30 cut-off) so you can get your infant to the restaurant...just not back. As a platinum spg, one of the perks is a complimentary continental breakfast. At the Westin I stayed at two days ago in DC, I had a full breakfast buffet, including oatmeal, salmon, fruit, etc. The option here was a single bagel a banana and coffee (one of each). The WOW factor of the W is fading for this frequent traveler...especially at this location.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, dirty, dirty!”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca B
Reviews.Content: I've been here for a week to support a conference and am less than satisfied. For a W Hotel this property is sorely lacking in basic cleanliness and maintenance. 1. Large Grease spot on the wall above my headboard from someone's previous romantic interlude. 2. Filthy carpets. Only the middle area of the carpets are vacuumed, there's a crease of dirt around the furniture...bluch! 3. Whoever designed the shower was obviously only thinking of design and not practicality, every shower ends up with a soaking wet bathroom. 4. Mildew all over the bathroom that has been caulked over. 5. Take your life in your hands when sitting in the lobby. Looks great at night with the parties going on and the dim lighting; the daylight hours show what a dirty property this is. Ewww...filthy carpets, past spilled drinks, worn upholstery. 6. This hotel is great for the young crowd that just looks at labels and lives to party. The more seasoned traveler sees through the smoke and mirrors. The good: 1. The Acura car service is great and definitely comes in handy although it only runs from 12:30 - 7:30pm 2. The valet team is so helpful and service oriented 3. The service overall is great, but really doesn't make up for the aesthetics. Bottom line: for the price paid (and I'm a Starwoods Gold Member), I'd pass and head elsewhere...

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: EarthGopher
Reviews.Content: Super modern but not pretentious. Staff genuinely friendly and professional. Beds are very comfortable and ammenities are modern and plentiful. What's with the carpet in the rooms though? It was super soiled. Do some wood flooring for aesthetics and cleanliness! Wi-fi isn't free - big negative!!

Reviews.Title: “W-level service, but lacked in other areas”
Reviews.Author: cslovick
Reviews.Content: We booked our hotel stay at the W because we wanted to experience the "beach" bar they advertised, otherwise we would have stayed elsewhere. We got there and the room was super small and the interior of the room looked very "Ikea-ish"....cheap looking furniture, the smallest/worst hairdryer, and the bathroom had very little privacy in relation to the rest of the room. We were also dissapointed to hear that the "beach" bar area was closed for renovations...our main reason for choosing that hotel! We have stayed at other W Hotels and expected a lot more in terms of look, decor and overall ambience. HOWEVER, the service at the hotel was excellent!! The valet guys are so nice and fast and friendly, along with the welcome desk and bartenders/waiters downstairs. The concierge desk (and everyone actually) had great reccomedations for local restaurants and bars and they were spot on every time. They also provide an Acura car serive that will take you wherever you want to go within 5 miles for free, it was so convenient and a great amenity to provide the guests. The reason for the 4 out of 5 stars is because of the wonderful service...we would even consider staing there again....but in a bigger room and when the beach bar is open.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended, but a few tweaks would make it perfect”
Reviews.Author: Michele L
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W San Diego for three nights in February 2012. From the minute I pulled up to the valet, until I left, the staff and service was nothing but outstanding. I cannot complement them enough. Before arriving I called to ask a couple of questions, and upon arrival there was a personal note from the person I had spoken with along with a lovely fruit tray - outstanding! I needed a late check out, no problem. I needed my luggage in my car a little early, no problem. Room service was great and delivered with a smile and offer of additional help if needed. The rooms themselves were very well appointed. The design was modern and sophisticated, the bed was very comfortable, and the bathroom was very nice. The location is very nice for accessing downtown and the waterfront of San Diego. Many different restaurant options were within walking distance, and I was able to get great recommendations and help from the team working there. The only small tweaks I would recommend to make the W a perfect location are: 1. The carpet and baseboards of the room did show a little wear, perhaps a coat of paint and carpet would take the hotel over the top. 2. The coffee provided with room service was not very good. The food was great, but the coffee tasted like it had been boiled and burned. Overall, I highly recommend the W if you need to stay in downtown San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Too Short of a Stay”
Reviews.Author: CMG1984
Reviews.Content: If I only I had stayed at this hotel more than one night. I loved it! The staff were very friendly – especially Jason. The room was immaculate, and, as usual for W hotels, the bathroom was a nice little slice of heaven. The decor was very contemporary, which I love. For a W hotel, the room was big. My room did not automatically come with a coffee machine, but once I asked for one, it was delivered to me in minutes. And, they also provided me with real cream. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Was expecting a little more...”
Reviews.Author: DavideKelley
Reviews.Content: I decided to “escape” to San Diego and splurge on a 4 Star hotel for two days and one night. I chose The W because of the branding and it looked like a great hotel with the pictures and reviews. From the moment I pulled up to the valet, the customer service was First Class. Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. The HR coordinator and hotel manager should be proud of the staff. I was impressed with the lobby, very Chic. The front desk was able to get me into my room about 3 hours early and gave me a great room (for my price range). That is where they fall short. When it was originally done, I could tell the room was very fresh. However, after a couple of years, it has taken its toll. The carpet had stains, the baseboards were coming away from the wall, the walls were scuffed and needed repainting, the blinds had torn cords and the built-in furniture and bed were basically white painted plywood that needed a fresh coat of paint. The location is a little off the beaten path, but if you don’t have a car, they have a free service (nice touch). Also, if you are just up in your room for an hour, the valet will just leave your car out front so it’s extremely convenient to get to when you go in and out. So, the only reason the W does not get a 5 star rating is for the price that I paid, I just expected the room to be almost perfect. I came to hotel to basically stay in the room and enjoy my time at the hotel, but found that I did go out more than I planned since I was a little disappointed. The nice thing is that my only critique is something that can be easily fixed with just some of the money that is brought in by the nightly charges. Oh, and make sure you bring your own snacks unless you want to pay $7 for Gummy Bears…Just sayin’. I was thinking about bringing my partner back for a weekend stay, but might wait till they freshen up…

Reviews.Title: “Mod and hip in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Live2traveldaworld
Reviews.Content: It is a W hotel so of course it is cool and hip. Location is nice, rooms are clean and comfortable. I have stayed atany places in San Diego and this is one of the nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: gretchstars
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the summer after a Padres game and concert. I paid for the room with SPG points, which was nice. We got 2 beds and had 2 couples in the room. The room is small but nice, and very hip. We liked the ambiance. The pool is ridiculously tiny, but the rooftop bar was cool at night. I would stay here again. We also got a free ride to downtown with the Lexus people, so that was nice. Oh, dont talk at 3am though, or security will bang on your door. Walls must be thin, because we are not crazy partiers. I would say that there is a lack of service, but its a comfy and nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love the modern rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: kmrza
Reviews.Content: We stayed at some nice hotels before but I really like the modern look and feel of the hotel and our room. The service was great from the minute we pulled up. Felt like they were waiting for us. Steven was really friendly and put us in a room with a great view. The room was nice and clean. I was stoked about the iPhone charger/radio hookup. Dont need to bring ipod/iphone charget next time. Forgot my razor and concierge brought up a shaving kit quickly. Overall was a good stay. Would recommend and stay again at another W Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: mee21
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W last year but wanted to post about it since it was such a great hotel. The service was amazing and the hotel was fantastic. It's located in a great spot and there is plenty to do at the hotel to keep you busy. We really enjoyed the roof top beach style patio with real sand and a big fire pit. The stay wasn't cheap but if your gonna splurge this is a great hotel to do it with.

Reviews.Title: “W for WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: Comeonflywithme
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the W hotel a few weeks ago for my birthday. I had only been there one time before for the W's NYE party. Upon my arrival I was greeted by friendly staff who took care of my car and bags. The hotel entrance was stunning and our room had a cool modern feel. This was my first time actually staying overnight at the W. It felt like the luxury of Las Vegas but in the middle of San Diego! My birthday weekend was amazing! Im glad I took the advice of an employee named Michelle who recommended I come back for my birthday. She took very good care of our table at the NYE party. Thank you Michelle, and to all the wonderful employees at the W hotel. My birthday was everything I could have hoped for and more!

Reviews.Title: “Quirky”
Reviews.Author: lizpani
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the W Hotel was pleasant. The fact that Taco Express is less than 2 blocks away is a real plus. AND Extraordinary Desserts RESTAURANT (not just bakery) was awesome! (It is only a three block walk). AND the USS Midway is close as well. Because of jet lag I kept waking up VERY early and went down to the lobby to read so as not to bother my husband. The nightclub music + music videos is really irritating and main reason I give the hotel 4 instead of 5. I even asked if they would just turn it down and they didn't. At 4:30AM - believe me - there were no young nightclubbers to enjoy the atmosphere, in fact, there was NO ONE else in the lobby except employees. But the rooms were good and the bed was very comfortable. All clean.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful San Diego”
Reviews.Author: rob s
Reviews.Content: We visit San Diego twice each year to visit our son and this was our first stay at the W. The location is walkable to most of the spots within the City that we like to hit; the Embarcadero, Gas Lamp, Little Italy and CBD. The hotel was undergoing some heavy renovations during our stay, but we were never disturbed by noise or inconvenienced in any way. Staff is courteous and pleasant and the doormen and valet staff were super, don't think I touched the handle of the front door the entire stay. Our room was nice and the bed very comfortable, but I can't say I get the open shower thing with water spilling out onto the floor every time.

Reviews.Title: “Dawn Evans rocks!”
Reviews.Author: ddunleavy
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I stayed at the W last week and had a great stay. Beyond the hotel being trendy and centrally located, the service was great - especially Dawn Evans. She was so warm and friendly. Both mornings at breakfast she checked in on me to ensure I had everything I needed. Her fun and welcoming demeanor made my stay that much more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “A let down”
Reviews.Author: RandRH
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our summer holiday in June 2010 and were very excited... What a let down it became. We arrived at around 10 in the evening after almost a day of travelling from the UK (Transfered in NY) to be told that they didn't have a room for us as they had overbooked for the San Diego Marathon that was taking place the next day! We were offered a room a few blocks away at the West In which we declined as we had made our 7 night reservation months in advance and just wanted to get settled in the room we had paid for! After 10mins of faffing on his computer he eventually decided that a room had suddenly become available and gave us our key - no apology and no help with bags. Although the room was very nice we were disappointed with its location. It's a walk to the seafront and The Seaport Village even though it's advertised as being in the heart of the action! The Karl Strauss brewery next door is a must though! Great food and friendly atmosphere! The world cup was on at the time and we exchanged friendly banter with the young batman! Take your ID though if you want to taste the beer - they ask everyone! The overall experience was ok. Small swimming pool - looks bigger on pictures! We had a lovely room service meal one evening but that's about it! The impression of this hotel is that it's trying to be something it is not with it's trendy decor and night club appearance which is ruined by its awful service and pretentious attitude. On checkout we waited at reception for 30 minutes - no one came! My partner went back up to the room and called down to reception and like magic a man appeared out of the back and answered whilst also managing to finish his conversation on his blackberry! When we asked for a taxi to the airport he just told us to go and wait round the side and one would appear - eventually! We shall return to sunny San Diego but will not be staying here!!

Reviews.Title: “Lacking the Wow Factor”
Reviews.Author: melbtraveller09
Reviews.Content: This is quite a nice comfortable hotel, but it lacks the Wow factor that you usually expect from a W. Apart from the lobby music and quirky W collateral in the rooms, you could be staying at any hotel chain really. The rooms are nice but not spectacular, the bath towels are awful for a hotel of this standard. Most staff were pleasant and friendly, although you got the feeling there weren’t enough reception staff so the service was a little hit and miss. The location is close to downtown, the gas lamp quarter etc, but it’s a bit of a no man’s land surrounded by vacant blocks and office buildings. Definitely not up to the W standard I’ve experienced before.

Reviews.Title: “W = Winning”
Reviews.Author: Jason S
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference about a month ago and was very impressed with the hotel and its service. This was my first time at the W downtown San Diego and never thought to stay there. I ended up talking to one of the banquet servers, Michelle, who recommended that I bring my girlfriend to stay at the hotel because of the great environment for couples. I ended up booking a room and loved every aspect of the hotel, service, and comfy beds! The hotel was clean and contemporary. The service was five star quality and the rooms with the extremely comfy beds will keep me coming back. Michelle’s recommendation was greatly appreciated for the experience my girlfriend and I had. I will definitely put the W hotel at the top of my list next time I need to book a room for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “W San Diego”
Reviews.Author: athensugadawg
Reviews.Content: Downtown in a rather isolated pocket with bailbond companies and buildings that close up at night. Facility itself is nice, there are charges for all services, so be prepared. Property was quite clean, techno in AM in lobby can be annoying. All in all, decent deal and works well for business traveler at a fair cost. Probably would repeat given the price that we got from Hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Just loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: LTaylorSr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to the W for a wedding and weekend get away and WOW! Upon arrival the Valet staff was really cool. Front desk greeted us with warmth like they were waiting for us. When we got to our room we we sooo pleasantly surprised at the space the feel and the energy. When it was time to head out to the wedding we were attending in the Gas Lamp area, the hotel has a complimentary car service sponsored by Acura that gave us a ride in style. How cool is that? After the wedding, we went us stairs to the roof top sand bar. Awesome drinks, vibing music and good loooking people. Truly W style. Finally, breakfast in the morning was perfect. Egg whites, turkey sausage and oatmeal... they had all my favorites. Will certainly make the W San Diego a frequent spot for us.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent escape from reality”
Reviews.Author: Jacob Y
Reviews.Content: Flying in from Minneapolis, MN I had no idea what to expect as I usually find accommodations with Hilton or Marriott. I had never previously stayed with a Starwood property & thanks to the W San Diego, I have a preference change. I'm a very picky guest in my mind...the type who doesn't let go of errors easily and would rather just try another venue...however this property caught me off guard. From the "Good Morning" "Good Afternoon" "Good Evening" elevator mats to the modern elegance of the lobby to the staff and cleanliness of my room...I was impressed. There was no dust, hair, garbage, damages or anything else of the sort to be found in my room. Every time I was faced with a housekeeper, they smiled and asked if there was anything they could get for me and whether my room was satisfactory. The housekeeper which I saw most regularly was "Diana" and she is an excellent example of quality hospitality within the industry. Also must also extend a special thanks to Stephen at the Front Desk (Apologies should spelling be incorrect) who found me a cell charger, helped me with dinner recommendations and directions, and was courteous in our every other encounter. I also ordered room service which was delicious and arrived very quickly after I had placed my order. Lastly, when I couldn’t find the gym, one of the ladies behind the Front Desk walked out and said it would be her pleasure to escort me as it may be a little confusing to explain…talk about going above and beyond. I was working 12 hour days and when I got back to the hotel, all I wanted was to shower and relax. Maybe take a nap without being disturbed and perhaps check my emails in the lobby while I had a drink. Thank you to everyone at the property who made my stay so pleasant. Next time I visit San Diego this property will be the first one I call.

Reviews.Title: “A great getaway!”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarriorGirl75
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W San Diego in May. The weather was still a bit chilly but it didn't effect our weekend at all! The W had fantastic service, a cool atmosphere and gorgeous rooms. We loved the rooftop beach bar and at night enjoyed drinks and a dj under the stars. We also enjoyed a dj inside with salsa dancing. During the day, we used the Acura service to go to the ocean and had some great food, drinks and shopping. I'd highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a fun getaway at a trendy fun hotel. Seems like the kind of place that even if you never left the hotel, you'd still have great food and fun. I'd definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: Naguah
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W during a recent business trip so San Diego. I found the hotel to be great value, and a good overall experience. The hotel is located within walking distance from the gas lamp district, with lots of shops and restaurants. There are several public parking options in the area, which is good, as the hotel only offers expensive valet parking. The rooms are great with a very clean and modern design. There’s not much in terms of sound proofing, though, as I could hear everything that was going on out in the hall. And even on the 17th floor, it felt like trying to sleep in a fire station at times, with all the fire trucks going by day and night. Better quality windows would have helped a lot. I understand that the hotel has some cost associated with offering “broadband” internet in the guest rooms, but 15 dollars per day is just silly. Yes, they do have free wireless in the lobby area, but that doesn’t really help when your room is on the 17th floor. I did not expect or ask for anything in particular from the staff, but I got the impression that the service level was high. All the staff members that I talked to were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Chic place to stay near the harbor and downtown”
Reviews.Author: canative101
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at night for a 1 night business trip. The staff was very friendly and the room was comfortable, and fun in the typical W fashion.

Reviews.Title: “Hip and Fun”
Reviews.Author: wes74
Reviews.Content: I spent a full week at the W San Diego and had a great stay. I've stayed here a few times now and have always had great service. The W San Diego has a modern and hip atmosphere and the staff is great. The rooms are standard size and the beds are incredibly comfortable. The W caters towards a younger crowd which fits my taste perfectly. There are certain perks from being a Starwood Platinum member that include a room upgrade, free internet, free bottled water, etc. Without status you may feel nickel and dimed to death as this is a full service hotel. Valet parking is the only option at $35 per day unless you want to risk parking on the street. The hotel is located right in between the Gaslamp District and the Little Italy District of downtown San Diego. Both areas are walkable from the hotel, but just beware of the large homeless population that seem to hang near the government buildings a couple blocks away. I'm sure they are harmless, but their presence is noticeable. The fitness center is great and they also have a fun little rooftop pool on the 2nd level. I will be happy to return in the future if priced reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “W San Diego -- typically great service”
Reviews.Author: wadebloggs
Reviews.Content: I won't lie: I'm a Starwood lifer, and I enjoy most stays at W's, Westins, etc. But I am moved to write about the W San Diego because the people who work there are exceptionally nice and helpful. On my last trip, I wanted to download some podcasts for the traffic-heavy drive to LA. The free wifi in the lobby is fine for normal websurfing, but too busy/slow to download biggish files quickly. I asked the Whatever/Whenever desk for help, and they could have shrugged and said "sorry" -- which would have been the easy thing to do. Instead, they let me into a conference room to use the Meeting room wifi and I was on the road in 5 minutes instead of 35 minutes. Is that a huge deal? No, not in the grand scheme, but it saved me a lot of time and agony -- and I really appreciated it.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it.”
Reviews.Author: 20pence
Reviews.Content: Liked the foyer, rooms are good, nice size and comfy beds. Reception staff were good, concierge desk was hit and miss. There were renovations going on but I didn't notice that too much. I think my only gripe was A. The fact you had to pay for Internet and B. It was $15 per day!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: SpinyNorman
Reviews.Content: I think this is what's known as a boutique hotel. To me it means it's not full service but still quite expensive. I've stayed there 3 or 4 times. It's a small hotel, downtown San Diego. It's not in the Gas Lamp district but the hotel has very smart SUV shuttle services. Rooms are clean, funkily decorated, with bright colors and what looks like 70's formica furniture. That's not meant to be unkind, it's clean and comfortable but not my taste. Service was always good. There's no parking but you can valet and they take your car somewhere I'd rather not enquire but I've had no issues, other than the extra charge of course. There's a bar and it seems to be a bit of a hangout for the young and trendy - both the rooftop beach bar and the downstairs lounge bar. There's a small gym and a small pool, some meeting rooms. If you're in town for the nightlife it's a good spot but not for families or business I don't think.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Comfy”
Reviews.Author: TerpyTraveler
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed a place quite like this (this is my first stay at a W). The place is modern and chic while still being very comfortable, especially for couples. The staff were exceptionally pleasant and the service was top notch. The room was the highlight for me. The bed was very comfortable, the amenities were superb, the window sofa made it feel homey, and the chalkboard was fun. I would highly recommend for couples. One important note, they don't offer airport shuttles early in the morning (before 7am) but they called a taxi (already waiting for me when I stepped out the door) and it only took about 5 minutes to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Tal99
Reviews.Content: Attending a conference in SD, I skipped the conference hotel to stay at the W -- I'm glad I did! It was a typical W experience: hip lobby, wonderful rooms, great restaurant, and free Acura rides when going out.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible staff, noisy room, and a restless night at the W”
Reviews.Author: l3r0wnEyedGurL
Reviews.Content: Similar to the reviewer below, I was unhappy with my recent stay at the W. I was invited to e-mail the General Manager, Suzie Yang, with any comments or issues experienced on my stay, and have since waited 15 days without a response. The following is the email that I sent her on Jan. 5th regarding my stay on Jan 1st and the issues that I experienced: "Hello Suzie, I just received your email regarding our recent stay at your hotel. Although we were only there for one night, we had a few unfortunate incidents while there. We were staying in room 1812. The shower was dripping all night long, and the room door was loose and would rattle loudly on it's hinges any time someone else in the hall opened or closed their door. Then in the morning, your housekeeping staff, disregarding the Do Not Disturb sign on our door, continued to knock several times at 9am. After a late night, this was the last thing that we wanted to deal with. When I opened the door, she said, "Oh, sorry. When are you checking out?" We replied that we would check out by the check out time. She persisted, asking, "When?". After she left our room, I then heard her do the same thing to a neighboring room, who also, incidentally, had their do not disturb sign posted. From what I heard, this man was also very displeased, and rightfully so. Is it normal practice for your staff to badger your guests out of the hotel? After paying $160 for a night, I would expect a much better experience than the one that I received. I will not be staying with W the next time I am in town from LA, but I felt that you should be aware of these issues. Regards"

Reviews.Title: “Hip style hotel but a walk from Gaslamp”
Reviews.Author: tallsocal
Reviews.Content: A friend was having his 40th birthday celebration in the Gaslamp Quarter. So I decided to book a room down there rather than try to drive home really late at night. I parked off property as the valet seemed a bit expensive. Reception was fast and very helpful. The room was clean and neat. It is styled towards a young hip type crowd not really business travellers. The bathroom was neat and clean. One of the towels had a huge tear in it but everything else was great. At the rate I paid I would stay again but not for much more. The A/C shut itself off a couple of times which woke me up.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible noise, Unresponsive GM”
Reviews.Author: xchillaxinx
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on 1/15/12 for 1 night. I arrived at the hotel late at night, and was exhausted from my long drive from LA. I was looking forward to washing up and getting some rest so that I could have a good day at work the following day. Unfortunately, that didn't happen. I washed up, changed clothes, and got into bed around midnight, hoping to get a good 6 hours of sleep. As soon as I was in bed and everything was quiet, I noticed this loud and annoying intermittent noise. The noise sounded like what you would hear when you are watching a tennis match and the ball is being hit by a tennis racket. This noise would start, go on at random intervals for a few minutes, then stop for a while, and then start up again. Unbelievably annoying when you're trying to sleep. Plus, being that it was midnight, I didn't want to deal with the hassle of packing up my stuff, going downstairs to complain, getting a different room, and having to acclimate myself to a new room. I got emails from the hotel asking me to email the General Manager if I had any concerns. I emailed her on Monday, but still haven't had any sort of response and it's now Thursday. What's the point of asking me to send my comments if there's no acknowledgement? An offer to refund me part of the cost of my room would've been nice, but not even an acknowledgement that my email was received? Horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Nice dog friendly hotel, NOT so nice (& not so dog friendly) location”
Reviews.Author: babygoldfish
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here one weekend recently with our 2 dogs. It's not the nicest of the W hotels out there, but definitely worth staying...if you get a good deal. We don't always travel with our dogs, but when we do it's nice to stay at a 4 star hotel that really caters to the canines. They brought dogs beds, bowls, treats, etc. to our room right after we checked in. And all the hotel staff were very nice to us and our dogs. The surrounding neighborhood is really not desirable though. Yes, it's close enough to walk to everything (downtown, gaslamp, convention center area, Petco), but only if you're wearing sneakers not heels...meaning it's not the most convenient location. ALSO, maybe you would not want to hike it at night either since it's right next to the courthouse, JAIL & various other attractive businesses such as bail bonds places. For the dog owners out there: One major issue was the lack of ANY grassy areas nearby. It was a bit scary to run the dogs out for a late night/early morning potty break and have to circle around the deserted block to find a nasty patch of dirt for the dogs to go potty.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for Business Travelers”
Reviews.Author: Maureen L
Reviews.Content: Guests rooms do not have coffee pots or guest chairs. If you want coffee, you have to go to the lobby. There is a defect in the design of the showers; the opening to the walk in shower has a stationary piece of glass that covers only half of the opening - it may have been possible to use the shower without getting water all over the floor with a different shower head, but the low flow shower head was flat and sprayed water in all directions, guaranteeing a wet bathroom floor with every shower. The work desk was comfortable, but had only one outlet. There is a chalk board to use, but no chalk. There is a window seat, but no pillows if you want to use the window seat. Paid for a room with a "fabulous bay view" only the view was largely obstructed by another tall building. Internet service was expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chevy1806
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. All of the staff we encountered were great and helpful. The hotel conveniently located near the San Diego Zoo; it was about a fifteen minute drive. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: rileymacdonald
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two days after a trip to Las Vegas. check in was easy. the staff were great. They printed off my boarding passes, gave me band aids and safety pins when needed. they had a shower cap brought to my room when I called down. The bed was a little piece of heaven. The rooms are really fun and funky. I love hopw even the elevator carpet is changed throughout the day!! They offer valet parking at 35 dollars per day. We parked half a block over for 3 dollars. We had breakfast at the bar, it was fine and not to expensive. I thought the staf was great and would love to stay here again! The only downfall was the water that sprayed all over the floor from the shower - not really my problem - I was on holidays! Quality bath products given.

Reviews.Title: “a nice W in the middle of nowhere”
Reviews.Author: jg325
Reviews.Content: This was a standard W that I would recommend with nice rooms, but the location is not too great. Like all W's, I have to comment on the lobby. When I walked in, the first thing I thought was, "the building was here before the hotel was." I said that because this W did not feel like a nightclub like other W's do, though there was trance music playing (of course!). The lobby is filled with surfing boards, and has a bar right there. The rooms themselves are pretty standard for a W, that is to say, a bit upscale. They like that modern look, and it was well-executed. Our standard room had a bay window to look out, which was nice. The location of this W is downtown, ostensibly within walking distance to the Gaslamp District (although though we drove). I don’t really see the location as a positive, because I think staying in Gaslamp itself or closer to Balboa or Mission Beach would be nicer. The area around this W is kind of bare, with parking lots and places bail bonds. I did not feel “unsafe” walking around or anything, but you can’t just walk outside and feel like you’re in San Diego. The staff was friendly, and attentive when we asked for help with finding gift-wrapping paper when the stores around the hotel were closed. The concierge was helpful, and they could recommend places around the area to see. Competent and professional. The hotel has valet parking, but it’s something like $20 or $30 a day, whereas street parking is abundant and relatively inexpensive. We had a rental car and found parking right in front of the hotel most nights (except on weekend nights when the bar/club at the W was popping). Overall, I enjoyed my stay at the W and felt that for the cheap rate we got, I felt satisfied!

Reviews.Title: “A bit dated for a "W"”
Reviews.Author: Jake Z
Reviews.Content: After experiencing a couple other W's, the one in San Diego was so-so in my book - mind you, it is a Category 4 hotel in Starwood's book. You can tell most of the furnishings in the lobby, rooms, pool and beach area needed a complete renovation to uphold the W status. The beach bar (3rd floor, open to the sky, views of downtown) was casual and relaxing. Prices at the bar were to be expected...though the $13 mojito wasn't all that impressive in size! The studio room was quaint and cozy. No issues with noise. Overall, this hotel would be a good one-nighter for you business folk or those wanting to explore the gaslamp district, seaport village, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: OCviaggiatore
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the W San Diego. This was my first time staying at a W, and I chose this hotel mainly on what I had heard about W and also having seen this hotel right next to the San Diego train station. The location really was great – I was able to walk there in what seemed like less than 2 minutes from the train station and it was a very short walk from the Gaslamp Quarter. Check-in was very smooth and all staff I encountered were very friendly. The room was awesome and had a chalkboard, now that’s unique! The décor and atmosphere may not be for everybody, but I enjoyed it. I noticed that the hallways and especially the elevator areas are very dark. This seems to be intentional and part of the ambiance. I actually liked this, but again it may not be for everybody. The only negative I can think of was that the pool was very small and unimpressive. Since I wasn’t planning on using it anyway, this didn’t affect my stay. The “beach” area and part of the “living room” were under renovation, but they look like they’ll be great when finished. I would recommend this hotel to anybody looking for a cool and convenient place to stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Wow is for Woah”
Reviews.Author: AARDVARKKILLER
Reviews.Content: Traveling through San Diego on our way home decided to stop and book the W in San Diego. We had recently had a great experience at the W in Austin TX. Well here goes. Try and get help with your bags Nope, Try to get a bucket with ice for a bottle of champagn ? You must make 3 calls and a personal request wait 5 hours and if your lucky it will eventually come. It did. Robe for your room, call and ask, reply you want two more, answer no there are none here we would just like 2 . have them upgrade you, we got an upgrade right next to the associate floor closet. Banging all the time night and early Sunday Morning, forget sleeping in. Worst attempt to sleep that night in my last 50 hotel stays The worst, Find somewhere else it has to be better. Check out look for a bellman, take your own cart and get your own things. I hate to say it, W this time is for Worst.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and attractive rooms, but uncomfortable surrounding area”
Reviews.Author: abcMass
Reviews.Content: This was a funny hotel. Very pretentious and "beautiful people" in the lobby bar...we felt underdressed and uncomfortable. The rooms were very nice, although they were unable to give us a room with two beds for our teenagers. We only ate at the restaurant for breakfast and service was so-so. One server took our orders without writing them down and I smiled and asked if she got all that...she said yes, then messed up my order! The Wheels car service provided by Acura was very helpful, and the valet staff was pleasant and welcoming. The desk staff seemed cold and not very welcoming. The location was convenient when driving, but not for walking. The courthouse was not far and the hotel is surrounded by the Sheriff's intake location and bail bondsmen. My daughter and I walked back to the hotel from the Gaslamp District and did not feel very comfortable. I would try somewhere else the next time we go to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Oddly average”
Reviews.Author: Mvated
Reviews.Content: We checked in Friday night to a big party in the lobby. I like to party, however it was funny to scream back and forth with the front desk agent over house music. Room was REAL tight for 4 people (defiantly should have got 2 rooms) and I didn't feel like complaining as we were told room holds 4 comfortably. However, that's my fault and I can't knock the room at all as it was Magnificat. Clean, decent view, modern, and great bath n body products. A 5 in my eye. Outdoor bar was real cool with friendly staff, pool was tiny, and gym was ok. Restaurant looked odd and expensive so we headed a block down to Karl Strauss brewery chich was fantastic and a welcome retreat every afternoon. The location sucks for downtown San Diego it's inconveniently surrounded by bums and shady characters. Little Italy and the bay are close but walking at night made me uncomfortable. Cabs are super cheap so save your walk for later.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Shesmilesalways
Reviews.Content: To sum it all up, this hotel is above average. I loved the roof top pool area where I order a few Golden Bears thanks to some friends we so happened to meet :), I also enjoyed the timely manner in which room service can overall we enjoyed our stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “A couple caveats, but still added to my short list of SD hotels”
Reviews.Author: AlikaAlex
Reviews.Content: Overall a pretty good stay at this W which is located an extremely walkable two blocks from San Diego's main train station. There seems to bit of construction in progress on their second floor and their spa was either difficult for me to locate or temporarily out of service due to that construction (though I never got around to asking the front desk staff). Since my last visit to the area, it appears The Restaurant has slightly relocated and/or scaled down in size, leaving its former dining room as an odd open area with no clear use (and no direct connection to the outdoor patio). Hopefully that area of the hotel is in line for a future refurb/remodel, as it appeared to be a sort of dead space with no obvious function, other than possibly functioning as an overflow room of some sort. The family and I enjoyed our "Fantastic Suite" on the top floor of the hotel. Though the room did have a few problems, most were remedied quickly by staff: • The shower drain did not work. The front desk was notified and it was fixed promptly. • The bathtub's drain switch was stuck in the "drain" position and we were unable to switch it into the "closed" position. Again, staff addressed the issue very promptly. :-) • As this was the top floor of the hotel, I'm not sure what was directly above us, but the bedroom portion of the suite (Room 1905) suffered from the frequent sound of pipes banging overhead. The issue was reported to the front desk but was not remedied, though I did not ask to be relocated and in all fairness, it sounded to my untrained ear like a problem that could not be easily fixed. The sleep sounds programmed into the bedside iHome radio helped mask some of the noise, however. The suite itself appeared to be comprised of two standard rooms connected with a sliding door (though two never-removed doorstops imply that it used to be a swinging door or was simply two adjoining rooms) with one room converted into a parlor / living room. The 1 3/4 bath setup was great for our needs as my daughter bathed in the tub located off the living room while my wife and I liked the simplicity of the bedroom's glass-walled shower. (The pass-through hole in the glass was a convenient way to turn on the shower from the outside without getting wet in the process, and surprisingly let very little water out.) It's been a while since my last stay at a W, so I don't know if the guest information book that most hotels have in each room was missing in our room or the lack of such a book is part of their Whatever/Whenever service. Staff was very accommodating during our three-night stay, from addressing our repair requests, to answering questions about their complimentary car service, to simply holding open the front door. For a W property, I would have liked to see a little more polish on facility upkeep as the banging pipes issue could easily be a major concern for anyone who is not used to background noise when sleeping, and my family and I did notice little bits of litter (the errant gum wrapper, straw, etc.) in the various hallways of the hotel. Despite its little deficiencies, the W's very rail-friendly location and off-the-beaten-path vibe keep this hotel on my short list of places to stay next time I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “Best staff EVER!”
Reviews.Author: heathersuzanne
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Cool lobby, cool rooms, delicious room service, exceptional staff! Everyone that worked there was SO nice. Good job, W!

Reviews.Title: “Here I come again”
Reviews.Author: Brett H
Reviews.Content: The W has become my favorite hotel in San Diego. I am in SPG guy when I travel for business but otherwise I will stay anywhere. Many time when i travel for pleasure i will find a boutique spot as I feel that si the way to tap into culture. The W in San Diego is my spot no matter business or pleasure whenever I can. Hard Rock is great, Se is fantastic, but the location of the W just outside of the gaslamp madness and conveniently located next to Karl Strauss brewery it does not get much better. The bar is never too crowded, "the beach" is an amazing place to grab a healthy (or not so healthy) snack. and most importantly the rooms feel so comfortable. The quiet nights sleep with a large window for an easy wakeup is perfect. I am headed tomorrow and as long as the service remains the same I will keep coming back. Check it out when you come through So Cal. Also take advantage of the car service they have if you need a ride anywhere just put in a request early.

Reviews.Title: “nice average business hotel”
Reviews.Author: nikolai69
Reviews.Content: Good location within walking distance of gaslamp quarter and convention center, but not right in the middle of everything. in fact placed right across from 2 large parking lots and the SD courthouse so not the most interesting views. I guess it really is a 4 star property but at 500$a night for a very ordinary regular king room it should be something more than that. I guess they take serious advantage of the major conventions in the city and hike their prices during these events so you might want to ensure a non-convention period for your reservation. The room is is nice with the standard (very soft) W bed, a bathroom with shower but no bathtub, and good Bliss amenities. AC works adequately but is very noisy and windows dont open, so that can be slightly claustrophobic if you are thus inclined. Service in the hotel is again adequate but nothing special, and certainly not personal. Well-equipped but small cardio-gym on site (no weights machines), and tiny swimming pool, don't even think of exercising in this pool, it is way too small. Breakfast is charged at 36$ for a buffet with fresh fruit, youghurt ,scambled eggs , toast and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “W hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ronald D
Reviews.Content: Rooms were average size,didnt change sheets when we told them to please change everyday! Very loud at night had bar basically in hotel lobby. Overall the W in san diego was average unlike other W hotels i stay in like in new york city were i feel the W in the city is outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Room with a View!”
Reviews.Author: 619Chris
Reviews.Content: Another great experience at this destination hotel. I needed a little "Honey Lets get away for the night" stay in the city vacation. My husband and I hopped on the trolley and began our relaxing adventure to the city. A quick 1 1/2 block walk to the W Hotel and we were officially on vacation. The lobby was "Living Room" was great with cool artwork and then to the room. 1408 - This urban view room was fun.... Chalk board to play with, large window seating to enjoy a view I wasn't familiar with, and the most comfortable bed. We got dressed and headed to the bar. Their signature drinks sounded great so we asked them to line them up and sampled. My thoughts below. *House Sangria w/cinnamon - Nice, juicy & refreshing. Tastes like Christmas. *Grand Marnier Cooler (grand marnier, canton ginger liqueur, fresh orange) - Very refreshing and dangerous. You forget it has alcohol. *Pink Ryno (bulleit rye, sweet tea vodka, fresh orange, fresh strawberry, stirrings blood orange bitters) - Sweet & carmely. Almost like an Arnold Palmer. *Stargazer (Svedka cherry vodka,, stirrings peach liqueur, fresh limes, cranberry juice, soda water) - Tart wake up drink. *Cucumber Mojito (Effen cucumber vanilla vodka, elderflower liqueur, fresh muddled cucumbers & lemons, mint, soda, spirits) - Refreshing and aromatic. I would say this is a salad in a glass. lol *Ginger Mojito (Bacardi limon, ginger beer, mint, lime, simple syrup) - A more traditional Majito with ginger spice. *Starburst (Svedka vanilla, watermelon pucker, sweet & sour) - This drink takes me back. Tastes exactly like a pink starburst candy. Amazing! *Berry Delicious (Svedka raspberry, muddled fresh blackberries, soda, sprite) - Similar to a flat cherry rum & coke. *Nobletini (Smirnoff strawberry, orange liqueur, raspberry liqueur, lemonade) - Tart and ritzy! *Hibiscus Royale (Chandon rose champagne, sweet Australian hibiscus flower, syrup essence) - Lovely if you LOVE champagne! Which I do! The edible hibiscus flower is amazing!! We hung out at the beach. This is a rooftop beach in the city. Fun to take your shoes off and walk in the sand while enjoying an amazing San Diego sunset. For dinner we ate early and enjoyed a romantic meal. Risotto was perfect, deconstructed Potato Soup, a delicious Filet, and a beautiful chocolate cake called Chocolate Delight. YUM! Relaxing with a touch of High-end was our goal and we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: jdellheim31
Reviews.Content: This review is a coule months tardy but warranted for the excellent time thatwe had there at the W San Diego. Located minutes away from the heralded "Gas Lamp Quarter" the W San Diego is an asset to the Downtown San Diego area. The W hotel brand "refreshes" itself every 5-7 years to keep its progression as a brand, and the W San Diego appears to be on the beginning stages of the "refresh", so an improvement on a great property should be expected in the near future hopefully. The staff here was attentive and hospitable at all hours [we used their gym at 6:00am before our flight, and the Welcome Desk Agent was pleasantly attentive given the hour] and thier refreshment station had rice crispy squares for the season in the afternoon. The W Bar is busy at night, be prepared to show your key on busier nights so security knows that you are a guest. Their outdoor patio Beach is a great spot for before dinner drinks or a outdoor night cap, the bartender Todd was excellent and busy given it was just after 6:00pm. Major kudos to the W San Diego's concierge Joseph. We had emailed back and forth before our arrival and he had set up our dinner and activites prior to make things seamless. He gave us a great reccomendation at Candella's on Coronado Island [try their Pollo al Chipolte and the Tres Leche Cake for dessert] and he had also set us up for a solid day in La Jolla too. He was a true professional and an asset to the W San Diego. Overall expereince was great and it didnt hurt that San Diego's annual beer festival was happening the first night we arrived!

Reviews.Title: “The Westin is a way better choice!”
Reviews.Author: BforBoy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 days as part of a business trip. I had stayed at the Westin for 2 days prior to checking in to this one. The moment I checked in, I knew I made a mistake by switching hotels. The front desk staff was unfriendly and although the hotel seemed very quiet, I did not get a room upgrade despite my platinum membership. The room was ok but not as good as the one I had at the Westin. This hotel is not horrible but if I had a choice, I would definitely stay at the Westin for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing fun hotel”
Reviews.Author: arough
Reviews.Content: Have to say this was quite a cool hotel. The W was in a central location and easy to walk to most downtown attractions. Rooms were really comfortable and decorated to a high standard with interesting additions i.e. chalkboard. Unique additions to the hotel include a pool and beach bar on the roof. Will def stay at the hotel again on my next visit to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Cool”
Reviews.Author: Kaylab1
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at a few W Hotels and are never disappointed with the quality and service. This hotel was in a good location, easily walkable to most of the tourist destinations and in a quiet area. The rooms were comfortable, with the W's signature modern furnishings and touches. The only disappointment at this hotel was the pool. It's very small and shoved in the middle of this mirrored courtyard, which was a little weird. However the staff was very friendly, and gave some good recommendations. We'd stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Fun and enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Matthew K
Reviews.Content: Todd from the bar at the Beach was awesome. Def reccomend going and hanging out at the bar with him. We pointed us in the right direction of where we wanted to eat and hang out. It was my girlfriends birthday and you made it special for her. You had champagne and cake sent up to our room and it was amazing. It gave her a smile on her face. The room was nice and needed a little updating and fixing the bathroom. Paint and shower handle. The whenever whereever service needs to be updated too. Lady was rude. Would stay again if in the area. Def would go back to the bar and visit Todd.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, hip downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: visual
Reviews.Content: Good place for a short visit to San Diego. Downtown location, with a free Acura shuttle to local attractions - easy walk to Horton plaza (mall) and Gaslamp Quarter - lots of bars and restaurants. Room was tight with two double beds, but thats typical in downtown hotels. Service was good at the terrace bar, though the prices are more New York City than San Diego. Real sand on the floor was a cool touch. No coffee maker in the room, though they had free coffee setup in the lobby. Valet parking is $35/night. During the day you can hear both trains and planes (its very close to the airport - you can see the planes come in from the terrace bar), but we slept well.

Reviews.Title: “Very Hip & Stylish”
Reviews.Author: ittybittyboo
Reviews.Content: Downtown you will enjoy the room and the view. Great comfy bed and fine toiletries. Friendly service. You enter from sidewalk small area to park and unload, not expecting that. Good restaurant and room service.

Reviews.Title: “OMG!!!”
Reviews.Author: Amie O
Reviews.Content: Well worth the money. Very nice, very clean, amazing bathrooms! Awesome pool area, super friendly, attentive service! Beds were comfy, rooms big enough. When we checked in, they brought my children little kid backpacks full of goodies, and at night when we returned, the kids had "turn-down" service where chocolate chip cookies and milk were waiting in the room for them. No charge for this, just a considerate, fun extra for my children! Great location! Great view. Prepare to pay for valet parking, and definitely take the trolley around town - fun! BUT...ask for a room facing the water. The rest of my family was facing the Gas Lamp district and could hear noise all night - even from 11 floors up! My room was water side, and silent!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, shame about the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: NjyD
Reviews.Content: Nice room, comfy bed, loved the walk in shower and great location. On the down side - the air conditioning was very noisy and you can hear the trains running through the night. The roof top bar was great and the service at both bars was fine. Unfortunately - the service in the restaurant, for both dinner and breakfast was awful! Both mornings we went down for breakfast we were asked to wait outside the restaurant whilst a table was prepared for us, despite the fact that there were only 3 or 4 other tables occupied. I saw another couple seat themselves in the half empty restaurant, only to be asked to leave and wait in the foyer until the server was ready for them! One morning I ordered the granola with a side order of mixed berries. When they arrived, half the raspberries were mouldy! We ate in the restaurant for Thanksgiving dinner, and made the mistake of ordering from the a la carte menu, rather than special set menu. It was the worst dinner we had during our trip to San Diego, it took ages for our plates to be cleared, we had to wait a long time between courses, we had to ask to hear the dessert options and the food was average at best. I probably wouldn't stay in this hotel again, despite the great location, because I hate starting my holiday mornings grumpy due to the rubbish breakfast service! I really hope the hotel takes this feedback on board and sorts out their restaurant staffing levels.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth_Ja
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my husband for a convention. It was recommended to me by the organization as one of the best in the area. At first glance it was a very nice place. The lobby was trendy with a lot of seating. We ate at the restaurant for our first meal. For the amount we paid, the food was underwhelming. Not bad, but we've had better. The room was OK, but for the price we paid, even at a discount rate, we were expecting a suite. The bathroom was odd and the shower soaked the entire room. To top it off, it was a mini-vacation for the both of us and it didn't even have a hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I was hoping for.”
Reviews.Author: vacation_mom_7
Reviews.Content: It's not that this hotel is bad. It is not. It's just not what we were hoping for in our San Diego anniversary get away. We were disappointed at the small pool area with no jacuzzi. The room was pleasant, with a large window seat. Because of the downtown location, the view is not exciting, mostly parking lots and other large buildings. The room, bed and bathroom were all excellent. Parking was very expensive if using valet (there is no free self parking onsite). It seemed like this hotel was aiming at a younger audience than a 40 something couple, with the modern art, large projected videos in the lobby and the rooftop sand floor bar.

Reviews.Title: “Not near convention center”
Reviews.Author: BordeauxBaby
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice; not really near anything, but not too far either. If you are going to a conference at the convention center it is at least 1 1/2 miles away! Never ate at the restaurant because NO ONE was ever there and I was afraid the food would be bad. All in all, if I went back to San Diego, I would probably stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: gwen c
Reviews.Content: Went for buisness so happy i didnt pay out of pocket. Relatively clean and food is good. However all rooms have paper thin walls and and plumbing is quite noisy. Reception/bar is often busy with people making it noisy as well. Really annoying, the way to the restaurant through hotel is blockef off so hotel guests are forced to go outside in the cold and take street entrance to have breakfast... Not cool. Internet is 14.00 dollars for 24hrs which i personally find to be a ripoff.. The SPA was closed down, the so-called pool is more like a tub, and the "beach" bar on roof was maybe cool a long time ago, but now resembles an adult sandbox.... Anyway, think there are enough choice of hotels in San Diego to avoid this one.....

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: T J
Reviews.Content: The front desk was great and Upgraded us to a corner room.Love the car service

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay at W San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Silvioflies
Reviews.Content: It was my very first stay at any W hotel, but staying in at least three different hotels a month because of my job, I think I have enough material to compare.
