I can truly say that the W San Diego is a wonderful place to stay, either on business or just for pleasure as this was the case for me this time. The rooms have a perfect mix of modern style and coziness, lots of amenities and humor. All the toiletries in the bathroom were from Bliss, and just as an example: you don't only get a body wash but also a face wash. One of the best beds I ever slept on! The friendliness and helpfulness of the staff is impeccable, thumbs up. The only things that could have been better are 1. the seize of the pool (rather small, but at least there is one) and 2. plenty of cardio equipment in the gym, but little for weight lifting. But back to the plusses. Did you ever stay in a hotel where they change the rugs in the elevator into good morning, good afternoon and good evening? They do here! One more word about the location: there's almost nothing in the direct environment of the hotel, but just a few blocks away, you'll find everything you need.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: consuela j
Reviews.Content: We had a quick check in and got straight up to the room. The bed is the first thing I jump on to see how it feels......these beds did not dissapoint. We got ready and went downstairs to the bar where the staff was great. The food was great as was the service. The bartenders were always attentive and knew when I was ready for another drink. I never left the hotel that night due to the fun I was having both downstairs in the main bar and upstairs at the beach bar.

Reviews.Title: “Room 1014, room with a view and a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CoronaFallsChurchVA
Reviews.Content: Everyone was so accommodating and friendly. The Acura desk whisks you anywhere for free (within a certain radius but remember to tip). The lobby was packed with Green Bay Packers fans this weekend and everyone was in a great mood, drinking, eating some killer apps and hanging out like the living room atmosphere the W is so well known for. I LOVED my room - great corner room, big, fabulous cool blue/grey colors and you can't beat the Bliss products. Special treat: The Restaurant at the W. Ate here for 2 of my 3 dinners. The Ahi Tuna Tartare was everything i wanted. one of the fish specials was halibut with Yukon gold potatoes in a lemon thyme au jus...beet salad, churros, tomato soup...kim is a fantastic bartender AND person. Make sure you eat there. The Beach on 3 wasn't open but I want to come back and drink up there! Sand and all that matters - they have it there. This W is what I have come to expect from this hotel group; however, this W is easily one of my top hotels - not too large and not too trendy. Still need a good night's sleep and was pleased the soundproofing is strong, so even though this was a busy weekend with some crazy Packers fans (even crazier since they beat the Chargers) i was quitely ensconced in my fabulous room!

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel for Halloween!”
Reviews.Author: Chris C
Reviews.Content: Well . . . don't have anything but great things to say. First, I screwed up the reservation and booked the wrong prepaid room package. The manager (Gabrielle) was totally understanding and fixed everything (and saved me a beating from my GF). The hotel decor was cool, modern, sexy. We stayed in a suite which was super nice. Plenty of room for a pre-party party with ~10 friends. We've been to a bunch of "event" parties at various hotels all over the country (SF, Vegas, LA, NY, Chicago, etc.), this was our most pleasant experience ever! The staff was super friendly all night, the hotel didn't get trashed, service never suffered even though it was crazy busy!! They did a great job! EVERYTHING about this stay was excellent. We are soooo going back next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “World Class Service”
Reviews.Author: Delvin123
Reviews.Content: The service and accommodations at the W are top notch - I have stayed at this hotel since June and every visit has been an incredible experience - kudos goes out to Spiro, Susie, and the rest of their staff - in particular These are just a few of the great people that work there - Patrick, Mia, Adriana, and Goleta - that's just to mention a few - they know what it takes to go the extra mile - again, excellent people excellent customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Funky, convenient & sexy”
Reviews.Author: MrsSmarts
Reviews.Content: I'm probably the last person on earth who would ever call a hotel "sexy", but the W San Diego is just that. The high-ceiling lobby is filled with beautiful artwork, chic furniture, a full size bar, and an alarmingly attractive staff. Checking in and out was effortless and the valet's attentiveness was unbelievable. At any given time they had at least 3 valet workers running to your car to open doors and help you with your stuff. On the way out they offered directions and free bottles of water for our trip. I really felt like I was living the high life for a modest nightly price, though the parking fee ($35 a night I believe) is a little steep. The actual room was clean and aesthetically pleasing -- nice bedding, modern design, novelty clocks and other doodads, a long bay window with cushioning for people who like to curl up with a book, great Bliss toiletries, a large flat screen and, my personal favorite, a full size chalk board for the kid in all of us. The location was pretty good, although very close to the prison which was a bit unsettling. I think this hotel is perfect for anyone interested in nightlife because the lobby is hot spot at night for partygoers. My only gripes were the fact that you had to pay a pricey daily fee for wireless (free in the lobby, but the lobby gets busy at times as I mentioned above, and also that I could hear a lot of the street noise at night (created by the partiers from the lobby) even though I was on the 5th floor. Overall, a great place that I would stay at again...preferably with a room on a higher floor. OH, and how could I forget the FREE citrus water and RICE KRISPIE TREATS (!!) in the lobby?! I would probably stay in a slum for free Rice Krispie treats, but a great hotel and free treats? Winning.

Reviews.Title: “Just like home”
Reviews.Author: Kathy A
Reviews.Content: My first impression was that this was a funky place... but it grows on you. We were here for a convention in the area. It is centrally located and has great access to public transportation. But you may not need it if you use the courtesy Accura for rides. The room is comfortable and the spa products were refreshed each day. The pool and sand beach combination is certainly not typical for an urban hotel stay. BUT it was the personal attention of the staff that blew me away. They were knowledgeable about the area and what to do and how to get there. Ashley S. at the front desk was esp. helpful when we had friends that left items behind and we required extra attention because we were waiting for a package that wasn't delivered on time. She tracked the item and made us comfortable while we waited. Starwood should be pleased to have her on board. All the staff were pleasant but she went above expectations. We'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The W never disappoints!”
Reviews.Author: vickpham
Reviews.Content: My coworker and I stayed here for a work event in August. It was gorgeous and the decor was unique as every W hotel is. During the small amount of downtime that we had, we relaxed at the Sandbar where we met Chris, the bartender! Chris was very friendly and turns out he was from Sacramento too which is where we were from! Excellent experience, friendly staff, luxurious hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel San Diego, New fave for my friends and I”
Reviews.Author: SiSand
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at The W Hotel was a wonderful experience. We checked in to celebrate two birthdays and enjoy San Diego, we came in from the East County. We were searching for a happy hour that would not be too loud or rowdy. The Concierge, a gentleman by the name of Joseph informed us about the W's own happy hour, we enjoyed a great time in the Living Room and did not even venture from there. The Living Room does need a bit of a face lift, don't get me wrong, it's still a pleasant place for Happy Hour and Joseph informed us that there are renovations planned for the hotel. Our rooms were nice although a bit smaller than I expected yet much larger then the W Hotel's in New York. Another wonderful experience was breakfast in The Restaurant. As we planned to venture out for a late breakfast, we checked in with Joseph the Concierge. He recommended The Restaurant and described the "Benny", we tried The Restaurant and enjoyed delicious meals, I also must recommend the "Benny", it's an amazing presentation of the standard Eggs Benedict. All in all I must rate the W Hotel as one of the best in San Diego. From the Front Desk Staff at check-in, to the informative and friendly Concierge Joseph, to the cleaning staff and Restaurant. This will be our new "ladies" getaway and I will certainly also bring my husband into this hotel to spend a few days away from the East County.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated and overcharged”
Reviews.Content: This W hotel does not deserve a four-star hotel. Small room, smell not good, noisy lobby..It is a three-star hotel, and weird decoration ..And, it charged my wife's credit card for 16.48 dollars for cashews we did not eat, how ridiculous mistake. I called them and they said they would rebate. We stayed there in October 9th and they charged us on October 12th.... Will never stay in W any more.

Reviews.Title: “Short but Sweet!”
Reviews.Author: IrishShe
Reviews.Content: In October 2011, my husband and I visited The W San Diego for a short, romantic evening away from home. Our room was perfect, the bar/lounge was cozy and welcoming, the restaurant was fantastic (my husband had Lamb Chops and I, New York steak. Both meals were absolutely delcious!) but it really was the staff that made our experience so enjoyable. We had the wonderful pleasure of meeting Robert Carney, a Manager of the W Hotels. Not only was he very kind and personable with us, we noticed the same interaction amoung the other guests...effortless kindness to every single person. The entire staff made it clear that no matter what you needed, they were there to make your stay perfect. We really couldn't have had a more fabulous time! We look forward to our next visit to the W San Diego, and hope to visti many more W Hotels in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service - particularly by the Night Auditor”
Reviews.Author: Phillip S
Reviews.Content: I was in San Diego for a week on business, but had quite a bit of free time on my hand. Being jet-lagged I typically woke up around 4am so started planning for my days fairly early. Bernhard, the night auditor, proved to be an invaluable source of information and a great guy to talk to as well. I will DEFINITELY return to the W - and I do hope he will still be around. Staff make all the difference!

Reviews.Title: “Westin Bartender Patrick”
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey L
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to drop a quick line and rate the experience. I was on a business trip and stopped into the Westin (W San Diego) for a quick cocktail. The space was clean and modern...as are most Westins. The bartenders name was Patrick Howard and he facilitated a very relaxing break from the grind of the day. A couple from out of town and myself enjoyed a couple of drinks and chatted while Patrick was every bit a professional bartender as I would expect. His attention to detail, casual conversation, and attitude was exactly what I was looking for. Thank you Patrick and Westin W San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: SeaWorld17
Reviews.Content: W San Diego was so nice! The staff are polite like unbelievable polite!! There rooms were so nice and clean! I loved it! Down Side it's expensive! $35 each day for PARKING! But hey it's california! Right? I recommend staying there! ONLY if you have money! Final Word: it's super nice GO! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Service - - average quality”
Reviews.Author: nmd76
Reviews.Content: The W San Diego is a Chic Style hotel with a great location but you can tell that it's a little worn down in the quality. This is the second W I've stayed at and it's very obvious that this hotel attracts people who like to party in the room. The service is excellent so I'm giving it a 4 for my review and I got a pretty decent deal with a travel package.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel sketchy employees”
Reviews.Author: jon j
Reviews.Content: gone from room for 3 hours and had 400 dollars stolen from a wallet that was inside another bag that was left in the room. so much for those fancy elevators that dont let u up without a roomkey when your employees are thiefs.

Reviews.Title: “What a hip and chic place to relax and socialize.”
Reviews.Author: Peggy W
Reviews.Content: If you want to relax or have drinks at the beach bar this is the hotel to be.This place is hip and chic all in one. It's soo close to everything in downtown San Diego including the zoo and museums. We met the Food and Beverage Director, Robert the first night we were there. He made our first trip to San Diego so memorable. He told us about all the hot places to hit from eateries to Coronado island. At check-in everything was taken care of and even requests were already in place. Our room was plush and the beds are so comfy. The Beach Bar on the second floor is soo awesome with sand, fire pits and comfortable lounge chairs. You can see the skyline and it's soo wonderful. They turn the resturant at night into a great dance club with a couple bars you can hit and relax in the lobby. We love this place and definately will be back. We also joined the SPG rewards program so we can stay at other "W" hotels in other major cities. This place features a nice heated pool outside as well.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice W”
Reviews.Author: Easy_Going_SF
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at several W's throughout the US and this one wasn't the worst but wasn't the best either. Positives - The rooms are the top notch quality you'd expect from a W, with an added bonus of a sofa like area built into wall next to the window. Nice touch. - The Beach. The pseudo rooftop bar is a cute, unique take on something that is highly sought in downtown San Diego, where the outdoors and nearby club surroundings almost demand a relaxed bar that keeps up the chi chi atmosphere. The sand and driftwood stool were a good choice. - Price. Very affordable, especially for a W. Neutral - Location. It's good for a business location as it's near the commercial part of downtown. It's only okay for vacationers being a little too far from the heart of the gas lamp district. - Staff. Some of the staff was excellent, namely the front desk, bar staff and cleaning/maintenance crew. Some of the other staff was rude and not very useful. The valet's were impolite, a friend of the valet verbally attacked my friend to the point where I was hoping to see him elsewhere on our travels so I could request that he back up his threats and finally, I question the security given the fact that two fights apparently occurred in the hotel during our stay. Maybe it was an off week but I can only go on my personal experience. Negatives - Concierge. The "Whatever" desk was aptly named as they consistently gave us whatever instead of what we asked for. They were unhelpful helping us secure a rental car for our Mexico excursion. One woman sent us to the wrong location (14 blocks from where we wanted to be). All other requests were equally useless. - Pool area was pretty tiny and with obstructed access to the sun. That would be fine in Seattle but in San Diego, I expected a little more. I think this W could be 5 stars if it focuses on restaffing its problem areas.

Reviews.Title: “Staff needs training”
Reviews.Author: Wilson L
Reviews.Content: --At check-in I wasn't recognized as a Platinum member (not a big deal, but acknowledgement was the simplest way of recognizing loyalty, no?) --First room given (room# 1720); sliding door was off-tracked. So we called front desk who sent an engineer to the room. He saw that it was broken and said that he would come back to fix it. Then we received a call from front desk (Vinny, I believe) that they'd rather move us to a new room since it would take time for the engineer to amend the problem. The Engineer showed up and gave us new keys to the new room (#1718, next door), without offering to help with bags. We ere perplexed as to how we were expected to be moved to a new room (due to problems with our original room) without help from the hotel since we had a few pieces of luggage. Eventually we moved them ourselves. Then my wife called the front desk to ask for Vinny. She was promptly told by a woman that she could handle any matter since Vinny was occupied. My wife complained to her about the chain of events and how the hotel did not even offer to send anyone to help us move...she responded by saying we should have called to ask for assistance. We were going to stay in the room to order room service for dinner...then we heard large banging noises next door. We realized the engineer was probably working on the door. The noise persisted for a while so we left the hotel and went out to dinner. Question: shouldn't the work be done at a time where it wouldn't disturb the nearby guests? (it was 8:45 pm) --Next morning (Oct 3) we went to the health club around 9:20 am. I noticed that all there was no fresh towels, so I went down to the front desk and ask for replenishment. The lady at the front desk assured me she would ask someone to bring new towels to the health club immediately. Both my wife and I stayed and worked out for about 50 minutes. When we left, no one had shown up yet with fresh towels.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Christina C
Reviews.Content: Great customer service and comfy beds. Concierge was able to get us a table at Hash House immediately, we didn't have to wait in a two hour long line! I will be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Impressed Once Again!!”
Reviews.Author: Peter H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I did a "Staycation" for my birthday in downtown San Diego. We are from coastal North county SD but like to have a night out on the town and not have to worry about driving. When we first pulled up we asked the valet to keep our car close because we were just going to check in and then head out for an early happy hour dinner. They were very polite and had no issues with that request at all. When we checked in we Steve at the front desk know that we were celebrating my Birthday. He said happy birthday and upgraded our room free of charge, which we were very excited about. I tipped him for that and we went up to our room. After settling in we headed back down to find our car right out front waiting for us! So off we went on our date. We came back a few hours later to check in our car and get ready for hitting the clubs for some fun. When we arrived in our room we were greeted with a bottle of champagne, strawberries and chocolate!!! We were already happy with the room upgrade, never mind the champagne to boot! So we cracked it open and enjoyed it while getting ready for our night out! Overall everyone was very polite and willing to do whatever we needed. We felt very well taken care of and can't wait to celebrate another birthday at the W San Diego!! Thanks W!!

Reviews.Title: “W - Winning”
Reviews.Author: kalen f
Reviews.Content: Last week I took my date downtown for drinks, dinner, and a night out in the Gaslamp. I hadn’t been to the W Hotel in quite some time so we stopped in for a drink. The decor in Lobby was completely different from the last time I had been there, filled with beautiful modern art that had SoCal theme. We stopped in for a few drinks. To my surprise, the W hotel has a great happy hour Monday through Fridays with $3 beers and $5 well drinks. WOW! Usually I pay double that. We had a great time to say the least, the service was excellent and vibe was what you would expect from a W hotel. I would like to thank Todd and Patrick for their outstanding service. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Customer service at it's best”
Reviews.Author: Josee L
Reviews.Content: I was recently at the W during a medical convention taking place in San Diego. I was there working as meeting & logistics coordinator for doctors from 10 different countries. The turn out could not have been so successful had it not been for the wonderful W hotel staff I was working with. Nicole Flores the CSM made sure that was a pure delight to work with and made everything happen. Others that stand out were Chris McGee, Glen (banquet staff) who was able to serve my clients in English, French and Spanish and Christian Nasby, Dir. of Welcome Office. Of-coarse EVERYONE at the W was wonderful and I can not name them all. I was happy to learn that the hotel will get a make-over in the next months as it REALLY needs it. I can't wait to return next year and see it.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with hotel but staff is excellent”
Reviews.Author: riblue
Reviews.Content: Rooms are run down and could use paint, freshening up. The beds were comfortable but again linens and comforter were worn. Bathroom design is bizarre with super low profile shower that floods the whole bathroom and no bathtub. On the plus side the staff is excellent and extremely attentive! They could not have been more accommodating. Rice crispy treats in the lobby are a nice touch. Location is a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “The W is not for WOW”
Reviews.Author: Rachel O
Reviews.Content: I expected more having had better experiences in the past at the W Hotels elsewhere. The bathrooms were poorly designed. The rooms with just the showers are dangerous because the water splashes all over the place and you just about slip and kill yourself. very dangerous and obnoxious. The water pressure was very low. The drinks were over priced and I just wasn't impressed overall at all. The staff was very nice though.

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressed with this W hotel”
Reviews.Author: StarwoodPlat7
Reviews.Content: "W"ater pressure? Terrible. "W"alls in rooms need repainting? Yes. "W"ould've stayed at Westin 1 block over had I known this hotel lost its' crispness? Absolutely. In all fairness, the hotel staff members were top notch. However, I expected much better accommodations at a premium brand Starwood hotel. The water pressure was terrible. The walls in the room need painting, they are dirty and stained. I stayed at the Westin about a block away the week before and chose to stay at the W for a change of pace. Overall, I expected much better based upon my experiences at other W's.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: loveinlife30
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W a few weeks ago. The hotel was wonderful. Service was always on point. Ashley at the front desk was helpful, and the young lady who cleaned my room did a great job. So sweet. I can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “W stands for Where else would you want to stay?”
Reviews.Author: stephen z
Reviews.Content: I never understand the 'W' concept until I stayed at the "Wow" suite and my gosh this company is out of control! I would love to quote a Walt Disney motivation piece here because there is just something special about this concept that nobody else does. Wake-up call was personal, friendly, and inspiring. Customer service was phenomenal and the room was just extremely modern and amazing. Very pleased with my stay, the room service, and I forgot to mention how cool their "beach" is upstairs as well. I am happy to have experienced a visit at 'W' and will book all my future reservations in San Diego there for the rest of my life! Nicely done.

Reviews.Title: “Great Venue for a Charity Event!”
Reviews.Author: Kay N
Reviews.Content: This week our children's literacy threw a small gala event (140+) in the W Hotel. It was a calendar release party with a fashion show, bar, DJ / Live Music, appetizers and photo booth for around 200 people. The event went off without a hitch, and all the guests loved the classy, modern feel of the venue. From the first walk through of the space, to choosing the appetizer menu, to helping with the clean-up: they were amazing. Even the small touches, like showing our charity promotional video on their lobby screens we knew we were so glad we chose the W! Best of all, we couldn't be MORE pleased with how accommodating and friendly the staff was! We were especially grateful for our event coordinator, Dawn for being amazing with moving furniture & accommodating the models as well as the bartender, Patrick for serving with a huge smile and friendly patience! We'll definitely recommend this venue in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Losing its lustre”
Reviews.Author: polaraubie
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay at this W hotel in the last few years and was a disappointment - the location is good and the lounges are fun -especially the rooftop bar - but the service was inconsistent and the rooms have become a bit shabby. We stayed before and after a cruise (again) but seriously considered not returning to the hotel after our return. We had asked about an upgrade and had thought we were to get one, but found that it was only the same room at a higher floor. They were apparently undergoing a change in ownership at the time - and we probably won't return until we hear they've worked things out.

Reviews.Title: “Another nice W hotel”
Reviews.Author: loveeatingineurope
Reviews.Content: This is another hip starwood hotel. Very modern and the restaurant downstairs was great. This is not a family place in my opinion. The lobby turns into a club at night and they have a great beach bar on the 4th floor roof. Prices match other W hotels and the drinks are expensive as you would expect. W hotels are always a cool expirience.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect getaway!”
Reviews.Author: tawdsf
Reviews.Content: It has been about 6 years since I stayed at the W San Diego. It's hard to believe that they could improve on my first visit, but they did! The hotel has the right amount of comfort and fun and the staff is amazing! From the valleys who parked and retrieved and parked my car all weekend to the accommodating front desk staff it was all smooth sailing. The "Whatever Whenever" folks were on it with some great recommendations of where to go in SD and the housekeeper with her magic bag of chocolates was like a dream! But it was the final moment at the hotel that really put the icing on the cake. I checked out and had some extra time so I sat at the lobby bar for a glass of wine and I'm so glad I did! Patrick the bartender was great! Not only de he take great care of me and the others at the bar, he was a wealth of information about W hotels and the inside scoop about some of the exciting changes coming to the property. I can't wait to see! Thank you Patrick for personifying the W brand; hip fresh, fun and entertaining. I will be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff, hip enviornment, but pool sucks :(”
Reviews.Author: kthomes72
Reviews.Content: stayed at the W San Diego for the weekend, from San Francisco. I must say, the W was pretty great to stay at because of all the little details, from the rugs in the elevator that say "good morning" to "good afternoon" to the little refreshments in the lobby. Had myself a tasty little rice krispie treat, while waiting to be checked in. The staff was super accommodating and friendly, they even have something called a W Insider, forgot the girl's name but she was over the top friendly, sat down with me and a couple of my girlfriend's and gave us the low down on some amazing neighborhoods in san diego. We also loved Patrick our bartender, had great vibe with him. Overall great experience with W san diego, except for the pool. Definitely need to step it up with the amenities there. i will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and comfortable. What a fun trip!”
Reviews.Author: dandelion_hds
Reviews.Content: I want to start with the good things. The W is a beautiful hotel. I was pleased with my room. I got the "Wonderful room" and had a view of the ocean. It was a partial oceanview because there was a building right in front of the hotel, but it was far and the view was still something that I enjoyed. The gym isn't big at all. In fact, it is a tiny room, but I had a nice workout. Next to the gym, there's the pool. A tiny one with a few lounge chairs. There were two people when I went there and the weather was nice, so I enjoyed a little time there as well. I also went to the Beach bar, but not at night. I went when there just to check it out. I bet it can be fun at night, but didn't bother to go. I traveled by myself to go to a concert and watch one of my favorite bands play. The venue was 4th and B, so the hotel was close and convenient. Now, I was a little disappointed by the concierge service. The lady there was a bit rude when I asked her about their car service to see if they can get me to the concert venue. She said I had to make a reservation or wait for the next car available. I was fine with it, but the way she responded sounded like she was annoyed, and to be honest, I didn't want to deal with a person like that, so I took a cab. It was great because the cab was available when I needed it, the driver was courteous and he picked me up after the concert. About the noise outside, well... it is downtown and when the sun goes down, its nightlife becomes alive! The first night I could hear a live band performing somewhere outside. It ended at around midnight, I think. I fell asleep. The second night, the night I went to the concert, I came back to my hotel room at around 12:30am. There was a party going on next to my room! The people were too loud. I dialed once the front desk, but they didn't answered. The party finally ended at 4:30am. I know so because that's when I finally could sleep. I guess I could have call the front desk more times until someone responded and ask them if they could tell this people to lower the volume or something, but I didn't do it, and honestly, even though I couldn't sleep, I wasn't surprised it happened. I read the reviews and took my chances, so if you are reading this and you want a good night sleep, then beware this could happen to you. It is a matter of how important it is to you to get a good night sleep with no noise. Another thing I noticed, is that at first my room looked clean, but then I noticed food crumbs on the bench next to the window (yikes,) and the next morning the housekeeper didn't take all the trash from the bathroom. That might not be a big deal, but still, it is nice to walk into a clean bathroom after the housekeeping service. I didn't pay too much for my stay. I would probably stay there again if I go to another concert or want to stay downtown just because it is convenient, I liked the rooms, the gym, the little pool, and because it is a nice hotel for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Going Far & Beyond the Call of Service”
Reviews.Author: matthew f
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the W San Diego for a two-day business conference and my experience far exceeded my expectations. The accommodations were great as I would have expected for a W, however, it was the service and attention that blew me away. There was an unexpected power outage that affected most of San Diego County. The staff was resilient and resourceful in accommodating our needs; making a very inconvenient experience not so inconvenient. Thank you again for all of your help. We really appreciate it and will always remember your warm hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service during a difficult situation / Great Management!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bruthhome
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W during the power outage in San Diego. The electrical power at the hotel and all of San Diego, went down at 3:00PM and did not return until the following morning. The staff at the hotel did an outstanding job! It started with an open buffet for all of the guests, a visit to each room by the manager to make sure that the hotel guests were ok and gave each guest a glow stick, a letter from the manager in the morning aplogizing for the inconvenience and offering up a breakfast buffet. The hotel manager and staff really went out of their way to make sure that all of the guests were comfortable in what was an unusual situation that was created by something outside of their control. Nice job!!!

Reviews.Title: “Club W!?”
Reviews.Author: Loupseul24
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this trip to visit the beach and see family and friends. We arrived late and noticed that the lobby/check-in had a live DJ set up. 20 minutes later when we headed back downstairs it was evident that this was a club- upon our return from the bar - it was a raging party. If you are looking to party, dress up, dance and pass out all in the comfort of your own hotel, this is the place. We were a bit too casual and felt out of place even walking to the elevator. If you are looking to sleep, the music over labor day weekend was loud. Other than pounding music, street traffic and screeching girls, the hotel wasn't bad. Rooms were clean, sheets were soft, breakfast was filling and it is in a central location. We aren't old or fuddy-duddies, but usually I am the one that feels bad about making noise, not the other way around. If you are young, hip, and looking for a fun night vibe book the W. If you looking for a quite place for your family, I am sure there are many wonderful options.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was so delightful... Manager Bri was darling.”
Reviews.Author: Foxdmca
Reviews.Content: Our stay was great and we were greeted with the friendliest staff. Being from Indiana, it was great speaking with manager Bri who was just darling with those dimples. We had a great trip...

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Mayoress
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay here with friends before my wedding. I booked a little later than the rest of my friends so my room rates were a lot higher than theirs which was a bit of a bummer. But, the hotel was so fun, the staff were amazing and the bed was fantastic. There was a fair bit of noise from the room next to mine, but the guests were being exceptionally loud, probably not something you'd have to deal with, just got unlucky. The location is pretty good, they have a nice rooftop bar and a cute pool area (get there early!) Dina who brought my breakfast was THE BEST! She was so sweet - Thanks W, Loved every minute and can't wait to be back.

Reviews.Title: “A touch above the rest”
Reviews.Author: Todd M
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved the beach bar and the fire pits created a great vibe for mingling. It was a touch expensive but for downtown it was priced with exceptional value. I would also like to add the bartender in the living room that took care of me during my stay, i believe his name was Patrick, made the best ginger mojito i've had and gave me great tips to see the city! My room didn't have a great view, but the overall W Hotel experience was on par if not better than other locations i've visited. ps. Get a bigger pool!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, great location, wonderful service, but disappointing amenities”
Reviews.Author: Jennyfir
Reviews.Content: I loved the rooms, the bedding is always comfortable, the service was great. The Bliss bath products are the best. There was always something going on every night, whether it was the live music or people at the bar. Location downtown was great and the ambiance and environment was wonderful. The SWIMMING POOL WAS TERRIBLE AKA NON-EXISTANT. My tub is bigger than the pool. There was some sand and beach chairs. It's not a good hotel to bring little kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tomfrfla
Reviews.Content: i have stayed at many W hotels around the country. The service was as expected in W hotels EXCELLENT! Great location for business and pleasure. i will surely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: EventPlanner2310
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the W with a corporate group of 50 ppl. I’m an Event Planner from Chicago and our dinner plans fell through… I was a little stressed because I wasn’t sure where to go, so I went to the Concierge desk... I had the pleasure to meet Joseph who could not have been more helpful. His courtesy and willingness to go above and beyond to help me was wonderful. I found the perfect spot for our dinner.Thanks again Joseph :)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the bar service”
Reviews.Author: goods114
Reviews.Content: The bartender at the livingroom bar his name is Patrick, he is overall my favorite bartender in San Diego not only is he friendly but he is always pleasant and he makes my bar experience that much better.

Reviews.Title: “Good example of the W Brand”
Reviews.Author: DavidDC
Reviews.Content: This is a very well designed and comfortable contemporary hotel. The lobby, which actually extends behind the bar, is an awesome place to work, relax or have a drink. The rooms are supremely comfortable, and very pretty, but not really anything to write home about. The restaurant is very good, and, thankfully, sticks with the contemporary theme, not lowering itself to the "buffet and cheerios" that some hip hotels still do. The location is good, but is in the CBD, and not dead in the tourist district, which I actually liked. The street car station is about two blocks away, and is two stops from the convention center and the tourist district (which is actually closer to walk to). The spa is small but very pleasant. The pool is TINY, but well designed. My only complaint was the valet staff who seemed a lot more interested in valet parking the stream of Escalades and chatting with each other than hailing taxis and helping with luggage. Small problem in an otherwise nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, perfect for some, wrong place for others”
Reviews.Author: Xiotzy
Reviews.Content: Traveled to San Diego for a business conference near the convention center. Its located 7 or 8 blocks from the convention center area, perhaps 5 or 6 blocks from the gaslamps, so its close enough for nice walks for food and entertainment. Hotel has music playing in the lobby area, is definitely catering to a young trendy population. First night at the hotel my room was right above the pool - a mistake if your tired and just want to get a good night of sleep. However, the hotel staff was very responsive, easily allowed me to switch rooms in the morning. Overall the hotel is well designed, rooms are very comfortable and modern. Would consider staying again, especially if staying as part of a group of friends or colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “WoW Escape”
Reviews.Author: ChiBri
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel... from the talent to the room.. our stay was truly a WoW one.. although we were only there for 1 night.. we made the most of it and from an experienced W traveler, W San Diego is at the top of our list... Christian who checked us in was superb.. very personable and started the trip off right.. the living room was a tranquil escape from the city and our room was both spotless and in true W fashion, very delightful.. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in San Diego..

Reviews.Title: “Awesomeness”
Reviews.Author: noknife4u
Reviews.Content: Ashley was amazing at service at the front desk which my stay amazing however room service needs a little work

Reviews.Title: “smell of fresh laundry”
Reviews.Author: Alena006
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed few days at this very elegantly and contemporary dressed hotel. It is only about $ 10 by taxi from San Diego airport, two blocks from city trolley, walking distance to city shopping plaza, to harbour cruises and to city bus tour stop, we can strongly recommend the city bus tour, a lot of fun , well organized, will take you to most important places around downtown. The staff in W hotel is a group of young professionals, who deliver smile and polite manners all the time. The food was fresh and tasty, maybe a bit expensive. We loved our room. Not only it was modern,clean and practical , but it smelled after fresh laundry every time we steeped in. We enjoyed the linens.The best part is the windows in rooms can be slightly open for fresh air, which most high riser hotels do not have.The only critical part I have is that one can see the bar and social areas furniture have seen many drinking parties. The nice fabric furniture has spots on it. But that is me, I do notice things like that. Regardless I can very recommend it and we would come back to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: Mary M
Reviews.Content: The intimacy of the smaller sized hotel was comfortable and relaxing. I liked the requirement of room key to use elevator above the lower floors! The staff was friendly and helpful, especially Joseph and James, concierges, and Patrick H., the bartender who gave us some good suggestions. The valet parking staff was friendly, too. We loved the decor of the hotel, especially of our room. Comfortable bed, cheerful room. Only drawbacks: free wi fi only in the lobby and 2nd floor was a shock; the bathroom needed more light and a light not connected to the noisy vent fan. The arrival area is awkward, you have to U turn to park for valet parking. Overall, a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: PdxJulie
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the W San Diego twice on business. I like the location - I have stayed in the Gaslamp district and find it to be too party-centric for me. The W has a nice, clean well-equipped gym with doors that open to the pool area. The pool is small but nice. I did not eat at the hotel so can't comment on the food. The room itself was a good size. The window seat was a nice touch. I will definitely stay there on future business trips to SD.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome time, awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: kld713
Reviews.Content: I booked a stay at the W for my husband's Birthday. The room was wonderful and so was the service. The hotel surprised us with yummy cake and champagne. We will definitely be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Hope to come back real soon.....”
Reviews.Author: Wendy Kay
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W San Diego for a busniess trip. Awesome hotel for a single to hang out. Nice and cozy rooms and the service was just great throughout the 3 days I was booked. Definitely will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Chat at The Bar”
Reviews.Author: evelina a
Reviews.Content: Make sure Patrick is your bartender when you go down to the lounge. I am staying here for 4 weeks and I am quite homesick now. Finally, I decide to go downstairs to the lounge for a beer and Patrick engages me in a very interesting conversation while giving me all kinds of insightful information into the local hot stops of San Diego and serving me good local beer. Yes, now I now I am staying at the W... it is all about the service!!! Cheers, Evelina.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully reliable and chic.”
Reviews.Author: taraloftis
Reviews.Content: I've now stayed at the W twice in 2 months. The first time there were a couple of issues with the room (it hadn't been cleaned on the first day when I was out, and when I moved to the new room, cleaning supplies had been left in the room), but nothing awful. I am currently staying at a hotel in nearby La Jolla that is pretty disappointing, and made me miss the W! First, I can count on the Starwood Preferred Guest upgrade when available. Second, this hotel in particular is home to the best french toast in the world! The Coconut-Cornflake French Toast is just amazing. It's worth coming to just for that! Ultimately, the rooms are modern and chic, but the service is reliable and phenomenal. W seems to understand that when business travelers (like myself) are away from home, it's important to have service that creates the comforts of home, when needed. The rooms, the food, the vibe, the service...all are outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “I love the wit of W”
Reviews.Author: SVLinda
Reviews.Content: Even though the hotel is closer to the business district than to the Convention Center that I was attending, in did enjoy my visit. The first thing I noticed was the changing of the floor mats in the elevator, from good morning to good evening. The rooms were wonderful, with a very comfy bed and a window bench seat. And all the signs had a twist of words with W.

Reviews.Title: “Hotels do JUDGE except for Ashley......”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen W
Reviews.Content: My family and I went on a family vacation which we only get once a year. Being a single mom I wanted a wonderful trip as anyone else but was on a strict budget so i went on priceline and got a a great deal for the "W"hotel in san Diego. Everyone was raving about this hotel. When we showed up we were looked at up and down and from the very beginning ignored and pushed aside. They never told me that the parking was $35 a day or parking on the street was bad in downtown, I had to give them $200 CASH to hold incase of hotel charges. I have never had to do that before, giving a credit card yes but not cash....like I said im on a buget. Then room service for blankets and towles never showed and was ignored as well as the room was nice but reaked of marijuana so they said "we will have our stylest ionize the room for you"...WHATEVER! They tried to give us a crdit for food $50 but when we used some of it for coffee and milk for the kids they charged us $48 for 2 days....WOW milk an coffee. But, when i went down to ask for a blanket the 2nd day I talked to ashley the front desk agent. I told her everything the enire ordeal and she was shocked. She fixed everything in an instant......she was so apologetic and sent us up blankets and coffee pot for our convience. Then she sent up milk and cookies for my kids (which were yum), and ,such a suprise when we got back up to our room. When we checked out the last day i thanked her so much and said that she was wonderful. She was the only one that was so kind and didnt treat us like we dont deservee to be there because we dont drive an 80,000.00 dollar car. So would I recommend the W? HHHMMMM only if your into trendy hotels and if Ashley will be helping you.

Reviews.Title: “haunted hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicole m
Reviews.Content: we were on the very top floor, last room. Door kept opening and making scary noises.. kept hearing people on the stairs but we were on the very last floor. elevators opening before we even pressed the button. our children were scared and couldn't sleep. no screens on the windows. and bad location alot of bums. no parking garage. had to move our car every 2 hours. worst trip ever.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Jeff D
Reviews.Content: The W San Diego is one of my favorite business hotels. They offer full service but have a classy, fresh boutique feel. The rooms are nicely appointed, the bathrooms are always clean, and the beds are amazingly comfortable. I have stayed there many times and have never been disappointed. The service is also top notch. The employees are courteous and professional. Ashley, in particular, is great. She always has a smile and she consistently makes a great effort to assure that my stay is comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service, great bed, free coffee + Bliss Spa Products”
Reviews.Author: Recessionista
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the Gaslamp district, a bit away from the Harbor, but it's close to the historical area and some great restaurants. I would highlight recommend the hotel for business travel. Some of the highlights are the impeccable service, great bed, free coffee + Bliss Spa Products. They also have car service to drive you if you need it from noon to 7 pm, which is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, trendy hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: Capayrancher
Reviews.Content: We selected the "W" by Priceline in the blind bid. We've stayed there before and thoroughly enjoyed our visit. It is an easy walk to Little Italy and a little further to Gaslamp District. We were able to enjoy a game at Petco Park on a Tuesday night. The staff was very gracious to us and we even enjoyed a courtesy ride to the airport supplied by Acura in an MDX with all the farkles. Not sure I could list a con other then the internet in the rooms is $12.95/day. That was easily handled by using the free wi-fi in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Too hip for me.”
Reviews.Author: bbgak
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for drinks on the roof. Rooms are small and breakfast is limited and hard for on the run. Would stay there again if I had too. Would avoid checking in on Sat night during nightclub though.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but a bit of a walk”
Reviews.Author: Hammy_Teare
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel but was a bit of a walk from the bars/restaurants/shopping. Not a huge issue and they did offer a car service. We liked walking in the day anyway so not an issue for us. Overall it was quite nice - great lounge, nice restaurant and a small roof top pool and bar. We did have a purse stolen in the bar that they could have handled better but I imagine that it was a strange event and they did their best to help us out once we talked to the right person.

Reviews.Title: “W, less than "Wow"”
Reviews.Author: UncleMeat
Reviews.Content: We have visited San Diego many times over the years and have stayed at several of the hotels. This was the first trip where I used a booking service, Hotwire, that made you book your room not knowing what hotel you were staying at until after you paid in advance. Although I was quite happy at the room rate we received, and initially at the hotel, there were some rough spots. As other reviews have said, the "W" is showing its age.. our room was well worn... and not the cleanest we have experienced. Our two biggest complaints are the noise.. the music from the "Beach" rooftop bar (on the second floor) was bothersome to us on the 9th floor with no windows open. Also there were sirens almost ever 15 minutes all through the night, there must be a fire station near by. The other deal breaker for us was the beds... they certainly were not the most comfortable we have experienced in other 4 star hotels. We were staying with our 15 year old daughter and required two beds, the only rooms at the "W" with 2 beds had double beds.. not queens. I have never stayed at hotel/motel above a Motel 6 that gave you double beds... especially in a 4 star hotel. The beds just are too small for two adults to sleep in. The service from the staff was a mixed bag, some very friendly and helpful and some bordering on rude and disinterested. The bartender at the Beach being the former, and the staff at the pool the later. Speaking of pool... it must hold the record for being the worlds smallest pool. On the hotels web page it states the pool is open 24 hours.. and there is a sign at the pool itself that says that as well... but when we checked in we were told the pool closed at sundown. The rooftop bar is small but nice... unfortunately when we tried to use it our first night there it was closed for a private function. Last year we stayed at the Se', another 4 star hotel in San Diego. Both the W and the Se' seem marketed at the same demographic. Both are modern upscale "boutique" style hotels. The Se' in every respect is a much nicer property. Our experience with the Se' exceeded all of our expectations, the "W"... not so much. Where the Se's rooms look modern and sophisticated the "W's" looks like a preschool classroom.... all bright primary colors and not much else. To sum up... the "W" is all style and little substance. And the style is looking a bit old.

Reviews.Title: “not what we were hoping”
Reviews.Author: davidkersey81
Reviews.Content: The room was a little less than we were expecting. At $200 a night we wanted a cleaner room with nicer amenities. The toilet clogged every time we used it and we had to flush at least 4 times after every use. The shower knob broke off in our hands the first night and we didn't want to have a repair man in our room that late after a night out, so we had to turn what was left of the knob by hand every time we showered. The bed linens were dirty and stained and the walls felt paper thin. with so many choices in san diego for hotels i think we will stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Guest Service and location”
Reviews.Author: travelbug671127
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel were amazing, friendly and always willing to help. From Amber at the front desk to Derek in the hotel restaurant who remembered me and my family's daily breakfast orders, to the concierge and valet service. The W's slogan of "Whatever, Whenever" is truly delivered at this hotel. The location of the hotel is convenient to everything and within walking distance to Seaport Village, Gaslamp Quarter, Little Italy and Petco Park if you want to catch a ball game.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic suprise”
Reviews.Author: labarkley
Reviews.Content: We had checked out of the Hard Rock ( it was horrid) and had to trawl around to find another Hotel with rooms available, we were just beginning to despair when we arrived here, they gave us a front corner room( only one on each floor) it was very light and very large, the furnishings were of a high quality and seemed new. There were lots of windows and we were high up so views were good even from bathroom, which was large well tiled and had a great shower. Toiletries were plentiful and delicious. Room service food was from a small menu but was very nice. The staff here are just the right balance of friendly and professional, they seem happy in their work and appear to like people. I lost a bear in the bed sheets which went to the laundry and they found it and brought it to me at midnight. The bar is in the lobby which means it is always quite busy and bubbly. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from the main town area and it is not in the best of areas, it seems to be surrounded by bail bondsmen, but there are restaurants nearby, there' a great brewpub and restaurant on the next corner.

Reviews.Title: “We will not be back”
Reviews.Author: glamormom
Reviews.Content: We booked the W for an almost 2 week stay after staying here 3 or 4 years ago and being very impressed. The property has aged quite a bit. Our room is small and the furniture is chipped, the bed skirt is dirty and there is mildew growing around the bath hardware. TP hasn't been replaced for 2 or 3 days. Room service was called 2 or 3 times for a 3 hour conference call and arrived finally a half hour late during the call after no promised call backs after the 2 calls to their "Whatever/Whenever" service. Upholstered furniture in the lobby area is filthy with dirt. Some staff have been quite friendly and helpful, but some are incompetent. The neighborhood has many homeless, which isn't the W's fault but an odd location to pick for an upscale hotel. It's also difficult to get to because of the way B street is set up. So many trips around the block to get to the hotel. Food is good but quite expensive. There are some nice touches like the wood blinds on the windows and the large flat screen television but it is difficult to use and blinks a huge red glow all night from a box on the back of the screen. Just so many annoyances, we are moving hotels to the Bayfront tomorrow. After having a bad experience at the restaurant at the W Hotel in Scottsdale, we are swearing off W hotels altogether.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, hip rooftop bar and lobby”
Reviews.Author: mtnwanderers
Reviews.Content: We spent a night here to celebrate a friend's birthday and it was quite fun. The sandy rooftop bar is a treat with great city views, although know that it is on the second floor rooftop rather than the top of the hotel so there are no ocean views. They could use more umbrellas for a hot day. A wonderful spot in the evening! Close to Little Italy and we easily walked to this area for dinner for excellent food. It is several blocks from the gaslamp district, it is walkable by day; would recommend a taxi by night. The room and lobby were hip and fun, and the lobby offers free wi-fi. I had breakfast on the outdoor patio in the morning and it was good. Free coffee available and plenty of comfortable seating areas in the lobby as well as an inside bar. Our double room had two double beds rather than two queen beds, so ask for queen size if you desire this. Beds were very comfortable! Only major disappointment was the pool. It is advertised as a rooftop pool, which we were excited about, but it is VERY small on the second floor roof and was filled with so many kids that swimming was out of the question. Also, know that there is a $35 valet parking fee; you could probably find cheaper parking nearby if you wanted. They do offer a shuttle service, but for some strange reason it does not begin until noon; I had to pay for a taxi to the airport even though I had been told there would be a free shuttle available.

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel downtown”
Reviews.Author: wandrlust
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel downtown close to airport. Rooms are cool with nice large shower and bliss products! Ate at the hotel restaurant a couple of times. The staff at the hotel and restaurant were very helpful. They even created a salad for me. The gym was nice too. The only thing I didn't know was the parking. It was valet only - $35/day! Not sure what the going rate in SD is but overall, I would highly recommend this hotel for both business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff, nice hotel in nice area!!”
Reviews.Author: Major1313
Reviews.Content: We pricelined the room and got it fir $100 night. The staff was amazing!! We were on our honeymoon and they answered all our questions. Left us champagne with chocolate covered strawberries in our room witha personal note. Extremely happy and highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “We love this place!”
Reviews.Author: CORinLA7
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had a fantastic week long visit at the W San Diego and this location definitely holds up to the other "W" standards. Customer service was top notch, they really know how to make you feel special, the hotel amenities are excellent and the second floor "beach" is a fun touch. Our room was on the eighteenth floor and had a fabulous view that we could enjoy from our window seat. I loved the Bliss products in the room as well as the chalkboard! The W is very conveniently located, we are looking forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Reunion with friends!”
Reviews.Author: sleeslee84
Reviews.Content: Absolutely a wonderful place for breakfast and bloody-marys! The rooms are clean and quite and the location is not too bad, it's close to a big shopping center and there are a few cafes near by. We stayed in a spectacular room, that has a nice view. The bartenders were very generous and nice! Our package included free parking and two drink vouchers so it was great! *i think from Orbitz* We stayed for two nights and it was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Love the W and already booked my trip on 08/18/11 to go back!”
Reviews.Author: vinny1003
Reviews.Content: Great stay - Awesome service...They really go out of their way to make your stay wonderful...I will not stay anywhere else but the W...Already booked my trip for 8/18 in SD and 9/23 in San Fran...You guys rock...

Reviews.Title: “Expected great "Not what I got!"”
Reviews.Author: Mml0126
Reviews.Content: I am a starwood preferred member so was looking forward to a great experience, did not get one! Room only average, fairly small and i was upgraded. Very expensive and my room had a Bug walking on the wall which grossed me out! Will not be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, relaxed atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: JBBelfast
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in a spectacular room and had a fantastic stay. The staff were all friendly and the room was on the 16th floor with a view of San Diego. There were lots of special things the hotel did such as free fresh coffee in the morning, apples and water in the lobby all day, free wi-fi in the living room and handwritten 'thank you' messages from our maid. The pool was smaller than expected and busy at the weekends, but the sand beach got the evening sun and was nice at the end of the day. The hotel is ideally located as it is a few blocks from the Gaslamp District, Seaport Village, the Santa Fe station and even within walking distance of Little Italy. The only negative about the hotel location is that homeless people were begging on Broadway but this can be found in most major cities, and there were other 4 & 5 star hotels in the area. Overall, we had a great stay and would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: youngatheart
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night and like the place. Our room has a great view, with a comfy window beach. Room is very clean and has a beachy feel decor. The big chalk board for writing our agenda for the day is a nice touch. What i love about the place is it's close to major attractions, the Seaport Village, the Little Italy. I wish they had the happy hour on the day we were there as we would have like to spend some time at the roof top beach bar...awesome place (we visited the next morning). The hotel does not have a lobby driveway for drop off.

Reviews.Title: “Expected fabulous, it was just ok...”
Reviews.Author: Arizonagirl12
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night, because we got a great rate on expedia we were put in a room on the 3rd floor facing a parking lot. Room was clean, beds were good. BIggest issue no parking!! We have an SUV they said would not fit in the garage, we found a lot a block from the hotel and had to get up at 6am to go and pay for the space, plus haul our luggage to the hotel. I will not stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jemal75
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel,excellent service. Nice room , best location

Reviews.Title: “A real pleasure”
Reviews.Author: nycubanpete
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to book the W Hotel chain after a miserable experience at the W Lake Shore in Chicago but was told that this hotel really delivered......and boy did it ever. While I won't stay at the W Lake Shore again, I will definitely stay at the W San Diego. Great room, great knowledgeable front desk staff and a real easy and smooth attitude. Perhaps they can train the agents at the W Lake Shore in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “San Diego's Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: StaceWills
Reviews.Content: I was in San Diego on a business trip and happened to stay at the W hotel because it was the most reasonably prices. To my surprise it was an amazing hotel, beautiful and the crew was very friendly starting with the manager who helped to make sure we checked in correctly. The rooms are spacious and perfect. Then to my surprise they also have a beach area lounge where you can grab a bit to eat. It truly is a hidden treasure and my new San Diego home.

Reviews.Title: “We truly enjoyed our experience and we will be back”
Reviews.Author: dzar64
Reviews.Content: From the manager, to the staff the placee was awesome. We actually had the manager speak to us for about 15 minutes. He asked us what we thought of the hotel and for our thoughts he bought us a drink....that has never happened to us and we do travel a great deal. Check the place out.. It's very cool.....

Reviews.Title: “Great change from your average hotel”
Reviews.Author: crankyangel102
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a romantic birthday gettaway and overall were satisfied with our stay. The spa and massage at received at the hotel was amazing, the oil and room smelt wonderful and it was very relaxing. The room was clean and the staff was very nice. The room service we ordered was delicious. The one thing that i wasnt too keen on was that at around 9 pm everynight the lobby turned into sort of a club scene with pounding music and the bar. But if you are into that sort of thing then you might like it.

Reviews.Title: “Issues . . . .”
Reviews.Author: TNJ08048
Reviews.Content: My stay was ok, the temperature control was good, the maid service was clean. My issues were the business center and the food. The business center is on the third floor called "Wired". There is no phone in the room to call for assistance. The printers charged my credit card for pages I did not receive, and you have to use your credit card to access the internet. There were no instructions on how to get the pages. I eventually had to call from my cell phone to the front desk, and it was then they instructed me to go back on line (using my credit card), go to printme.com, get an access number, and then it would print downstairs. I was assured that I would get refunded my charges on my credit card, but was not. The food was ok, but if you eat your beef well done, you have to make sure that it is cooked that way. I had a room service order of well done burger, and over 1/2 the burger was deep red. It took 45 minutes to receive my order, because room service said it would take 45 minutes to do the well done burger. I called room service (it is now 10 pm), and they said that they would send someone to redo the burger, but it would be another 45 mins to 1 hour. I told them I would eat it the way it was.

Reviews.Title: “First 3 Star W Hotel I ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: abomb526
Reviews.Content: Ok, so I read the reviews over & over but got a good deal w/ Delta so decided to stay here. I should have gone with TA and stayed at Coronado. First, when we arrived, there were employees standing around the valet area and none of them asked to help. We walked in and the lobby is pretty..."calm beachy theme" but not as elaborate as some other W's, check in was professional but very cold. The front desk rep declined to upgrade me even knowing we were on a b-day/anniversary trip. When we arrived to the room, it was very small but comfy. We decided to check out the beach bar & gym, both were nice and yes the pool is pretty small but still ok. When we came back to change for dinner, that was when things started to turn, the lobby turned into a LOUD nightclub (and there was really no one there). You can hear the techno music thru the entire hotel, it was blasting in my room and also the walls are so thin I could hear the other room's entire conversation as well so I asked for another one right away, kinda of annoying to change rooms. But I knew that the noise would get worse as the night progressed. We were sent to the 18th floor, still could hear the techno music echoing off the walls. If you are sensitive to noise, then you def. should NOT stay here! For dinner, we spoke to the concierge who really had no clue....actually anytime we spoke with him, he seemed to give us the "same suggestions"....most of the time, I researched on my BB and told him the spot and how to get there. I even had to mostly set up our trip to La Jolla, he had no clue about the area. I think he def. needs more training, he was a sweetie but really needed to delve more into his work. When we got back from dinner, we also realized we have not seen the housecleaner but figured it was the changing of the rooms, wrong, we had to actually call when the 2nd day she didn't show up. They wanted to send her up at 10:30pm but I just asked for more towels, in the 5 days we stayed here, we had housecleaning twice. The hotel is in the downtown area of a city, lots of city life so if you are looking for more of a beach experience, this is not for you, I def. will not.The area is ok & yes there are some "wishy washy" folks but they leave you alone and mostly we felt safe anywhere we walked and we walked everywhere. The location to the Gaslamp Quarter is great but better suited to visitors looking to party. We were looking more for the coast and beach areas, for that you should stay in La Jolla or Coronado and pay the extra, it would be well worth it just for the location. The area gets you where ever you need to go though, plenty of cabs, buses and ferrys to take you around but that adds costs so as I said, if you are not looking to party and are looking for a quiet trip, go elsewhere. On the last day, I had to give them feedback because I just was SO disappointed and we spoke with a few employees explaining all the above and how they should smile more, extend their help more. I even told one of them, they should speak to the W in Washington (service there is to die for) and ask how to improve things. I told them I felt like we were staying at a Holiday Inn rather than a W Hotel, the rooms, the service are not 5 STAR. BTW, there is a Holiday that faces the ocean and looked terrific, you may want to check it out. My friend stayed there, it was a few hundred dollars cheaper and she liked it, not love but liked it. If I could tell TA members anything, is do not stay here, listen to the reviews...they were all dead on.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: meowable
Reviews.Content: lovely entrance - fun bar to socialize - bedding is wonderful - nice addition of the coffee makers in room - cool showers

Reviews.Title: “W for WASTE - TIME and MOney”
Reviews.Author: Mu_L_11
Reviews.Content: We "briefly" stayed at W San Diego to celebrate my husband's 30 birthday. We had few friends visiting us in our room and we were just talking and getting ready for the bar. At 8 PM we got a visit from W staff that we were being too loud and since there were marathon runners staying in the hotel who needed to get up early, we should leave the room and talk somewhere else since their walls are paper thin. Before 10 we got three warnings from W staff who were EXTREMELY rude and hostile. The staff is unbelieveably unprofessional and snobby. We were shocked at the Jerry Springer treatment we got from a 5 star hotel staff. I wish I took all the bad reviews seriously. They ruined my husbands birthday. DO not let this happen to you.

Reviews.Title: “W = WHAT, I CANT HEAR YOU?”
Reviews.Author: MenOnVacation
Reviews.Content: When I arrived to the hotel there were 3 door attendants to card me but not a single front desk clerk. On this Saturday night, the lobby including the front desk area was blasted with extremely loud music -- so loud I could not even communicate with the security guards to ask where the clerk was. After wandering around trying to find someone to check me in, I saw a front desk clerk after about 5 minutes. He could not hear me and I could not hear him. I handed him my SPG Gold card and my credit card and he got the message. There was simply NO separation between the club and the lobby... NONE! I am actually a huge W fan, but this hotel misses the mark unfortunately. The club is not hip... it's just loud and annoying. The crowd was sparse but the music was glaringly loud nonetheless.... most of the people were outside on the sidewalk either smoking or escaping the blasting music where there could actually talk. The clerk later apologized for being away saying that he had been dealing with an emergency and sent an amenity to the room which I appreciated. Still, the set up in this lobby is really annoying. The room was also getting tired and worn down. The bed frame was cracked, the vanity was badly scuffed, and the cordless phone and 2 of the lights did not work. Im tempted to give in an even lower rating, but it's still much better than a Holiday Inn. Of course you expect better at the W prices. The real kicker that peeved me was the internet charge - $14.95 is bad enough for 1 day, right? But no, it was $14.95 times TWO for 2 devices. Are you freeking kidding me!?? What a rip off, and of course I assumed it was an error on my bill, but I had to argue with the supervisor to credit one of these charges on a $300 bill!

Reviews.Title: “A W experience”
Reviews.Author: axel16
Reviews.Content: Had a nice weekend there. Staff was nice. Very quiet. Excellent bed. Facing downtown quiet. So far my experience with the W is very consistent. I would go back. Room service for bfast took forever and food was ok nothing special

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: B_A_Morgan79
Reviews.Content: I had had good experiences in W Hotels until I went to New Orleans. After the stay in the W New Orleans, I vowed to never stay in another W hotel. However, because of Priceline's name your own price, I was foced into staying here. I could not have been hapier. We didn't bother with valet because there was always street parking. We got an amazing room and had absolutely no complaints. This trip has changed my mind on W Hotels and I would be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A great night for us. Expectation management is key.”
Reviews.Author: TomS_Coram_NY
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night over Memorial Day weekend. I was able to secure a military rate of $131, which was great. When we pulled up the valet whisked my car away and was very friendly. The girl at the front desk was also super friendly and helpful. The decor is obviously meant to be chic, and while some may say they're trying too hard, I think they're trying just hard enough and succeeding. The "living room" (lobby) was nicely laid out during the day, and was a fairly busy semi-club later that night with lighting effects and club music. Here is where one needs to begin managing expectations. Do not bring your 90 year old mother or 6 month old child to a hotel whose thing is being young and hip, and which comes with loud music and late night revelers. Use ear plugs if you're on a lower floor and are sensitive to noise. The room was spacious and fun. The clock had an iPod dock and the window had a nice bench one could lay on. The TV was flat and big and the wall had a chalk board my wife and I doodled on. The bathroom was nice enough, but (one almost meaningless gripe was that) the toilet paper holder was in a super annoying spot behind you. We hung out at the Beach joint for an hour or so before dinner and it was cool. It was fairly empty so we got a seat on the bench and enjoyed a few drinks before the sun dipped behind the buildings. We did not hit it up late night so this may be an unfair assessment, but I can see it being a drunk-girl-in-high-heels disaster as folks try to navigate through a crowd and around furniture pieces in several inches of sand. The hotel is not quite in the middle of Gaslamp. My wife and I are from New York and have no problem walking numerous blocks to get somewhere - one Manhattan block between avenues is like four SD blocks so it's not that big a deal, but here again, expect a walk, or call a cab. Overall we enjoyed our night. The rate was great, the locations was good enough, the room was fun, and the couple of folks we interacted with were very friendly. Also, I appreciate when managers respond to Trip Advisor posts, which the W seems to. Given an equal rate I might stay closer to the heart of Gaslamp, but the W definitely impressed and I would stay here again otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality and Service Excellence”
Reviews.Author: yogatim
Reviews.Content: Our business group had a meeting room, catered lunch and a block of rooms with the W in San Diego. Our meeting, meals and the Acura courtesy shuttle to our entertainment destination all ran FLAWLESSLY. Of all the Starwood hotels I dealt with in San Diego when planning this meeting, I found the W team the most responsive and flexible over the phone, via email and in person. That is why I went with the W.

Reviews.Title: “great but will likely need a cab”
Reviews.Author: kimmikens
Reviews.Content: my rating here is based off the other Ws. W Westwood gets 5 stars. W Hollywood gets 5 stars. W Midtown Atlanta gets 4 stars... yada yada yada... W San Diego gets 4 stars. heres why: location. its not great. you cant walk in heels to the gaslamp quarter, restaurants, or coffee shops. you CAN walk to some places... but its just not the most ideal location for a W. reminds me a bit of W Silicon Valley. great rooms. great bathtubs. decent showers. awesome mirrors. cool staff. good lobby events.

Reviews.Title: “terrible,terrible,terrible stay”
Reviews.Author: msmorgan15
Reviews.Content: My husband I own a hotel, a much smaller one, but our expectations are still high. I took my husband to SD to show him where I grew up and I figured I would splurge on the room a little. For a Tues/Wed night stay we payed $600 dollars. Sure the location is great and the lobby and bar were open and okay. The pool is the size of a hot tub, way to small for a San Diego Hotel. The Beach (bar on the roof) looked messy and unkept furniture looked dirty. Pretty much all of the amenities that were supposed to be so great were kind of lackluster. It drizzled and everything closed up and when the sun was out the next day it was still all closed. Room was just okay, no bathtub which sucked and really not a lot of wow. W is supposed to be more cutting edge and I was excited to see that, but I have stayed in much nicer rooms at a more reasonable rate. Won't do it again... beware this is not the same as it looks online etc...

Reviews.Title: “New W concept suddenly feels very old.”
Reviews.Author: charlessouthey
Reviews.Content: $32 parking, gym equipment that doesn't work, tvs not programmed to show more than 5 channels, pool the size of my bed, wake up calls that never happen. Let's just say that I was eager to visit the W but will never visit again. The W used to be cool and hip; now it feels like your visiting someone who still thinks it's the 60s.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than The Vandome in Paris, France.”
Reviews.Author: Roni41
Reviews.Content: My Hubby and I celebrated our third anniversary with the W and had a wonderful experience!! Ulrika, at the front desk, was helpful in every way and never stopped smiling. The hotel's manager, Suzie, was completely accommodating and has the most pleasant demeanor. Between the two of them, I could not have asked for better service in making arrangements, paying the bill and getting advice for where to spend a fantastic evening in the beautiful city of San Diego. (Speaking of San Diego, it's very entertaining Gas Lamp district only a five minute walk from the W so no need for a taxi.) When I made the reservation, I mentioned our special occasion to Suzie and let her and the staff choose the room. The room was perfect. It was a clean and spacious suite with the most beautiful and spotless bathroom, it was on the tenth floor located just above the noise of the city without being above the view, and the bed slept like a dream. They knew just how to plan for a perfect overnight getaway! We were even surprised with chocolate covered strawberries and champagne waiting for us with a kind card. We felt like there was extra time taken to make our special day a very special day. Our visit was spectacular! The W itself has a rooftop bar that offered live music on the night we stayed. It had great service and the music was good. If out side drinks and dinning are not your style, there is a very equipped bar in the lobby and a restaurant within the hotel. It also offers a beautiful pool and spaces for conventions or larger meetings. There is a spa for massages and facials that we are going to try when we return to the W in the future. And, yes, we will return for another stay that is, hopefully, longer than our last stay. All in all, our stay was better than the time we spent at the Vandome in Paris. My hubby and I thank the W for making our anniversary so special.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: lspepe
