Reviews.Content: Upon arrival found the front desk personel NOT helpful although they kept asking if they could help.It was after 4Pm and it took 30 minutes to secure our room keys and have luggage delivered.I had my 94 year old mother who needed to rest !The lady assisting me checking in was inept! She took my drivers license and credit card and left them sitting on the desk and walked away for at least 10 minutes checking on????When she returned I asked to have my card back only to be told she still needed them. I found the room to have no shower cap or shampoo. The TV remote didn't work and there were no instructions on how to work it. There was no check out time displayed and then when I checked my charges upon arrival home I had charges for $183.32 that weren't mine! VERY annoying. The lobby of the hotel was so noisy you couldn't carry on a conversation. Overall I was disappointed and think your Hotel should do better . This is a nice area and could be a nice place to stay if some changes are made.

Reviews.Title: “a little tired....Ikea like rooms, very ho hum”
Reviews.Author: Willyum
Reviews.Content: pleasant staff, nice lobby, great 2nd floor terrace bar, nice restaurant.....but very mediocre rooms.....cheep cheep furniture, and unimaginative decor.... No tubs.....only showers.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the beach bar, but hated the room service”
Reviews.Author: fishermay
Reviews.Content: I had never stayed at a W hotel, and it really was a different experience. There's constant music playing everywhere you go... 24 hours a day. I don't mind music, but this music started to grate on me. There's no question that the weekend's are party time in the hotel. It seems a lot of young local kids frequent the Beach bar. I did enjoy all the activity. Overall it was a good experience with the exception of room service. We tried it twice thinking that the 1st night may have been just a bad night, but the food was just as bad the 2nd time. We didn't order room service again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern but Unimpressive”
Reviews.Author: antd1958
Reviews.Content: I'm a big fan of W Hotel but San Diego fell short. The room was not a basic room, but it was still small. I did enjoy the window seat and the view in the morning, but felt overall that there needed to be more space. I think valet parking was something ridiculous, like $30, so we parked at the parking lot next door which was $5. Didnt really make much sense to me. It seems crazy that the five star hotels I've stayed at in Vegas were cheaper, had bigger rooms, and free parking. The lobby was unimpressive and small. There was a cool lounge with sand on the roof, which I guess was kind of cool but the dirty martini was terrible. I wouldn't stay at the W Hotel San Diego again.

Reviews.Title: “It seems it's always Love/Hate at the W”
Reviews.Author: kmantexas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel quite a bit and stay at lots of hotels. We appreciate a contemporary aesthetic, but too often at the W it's poorly executed. Some things were extremely inconvenient and not up to the standards of even a 2-star property. And for whatever reason the W tends to nickel and dime us for basic services that in our opinion should be considered part of the stay. It's one of the things my wife and I joke about--what charge could they dream up to hit us with this time? The room itself was not "Wonderful". The bathroom was nice, but the furniture looked like they bought an old hotel and just painted all the old furniture white. C'mon, guys, you're supposedly a 4-star hotel. However, the most annoying thing about this hotel is the lack of a coffee pot in the room. They have coffee, but you have to get dressed, go downstairs to the lobby, and get it yourself. Either that, or you have to order a $20 pot delivered to your room. This is the first hotel I've ever been to that did not have a coffee pot in-room. From the lowliest Holiday Inn to all the way up to the Hotel Setai you can get that. I'm still baffled by this decision. Service is sometimes delivered well, and friendly people on the staff do exist, but about half the time it seems the staff is too bothered to do anything for you. I had to check with the front desk several times regarding a FedEx package I was receiving there. When I finally received it they charged me $18 on my final bill for the privilege of them handing it to me. Seriously? We just died laughing because it was too predictable and completely W-ridiculous. These are the types of things that are extremely annoying that other hotels would never dream of charging for. Also there was no one to help us with a cab at the valet station as we were leaving. I had to go in search of anyone--no concierge, no front desk, no bellman. They were just here--where did they all go? Pros - Nice looking lobby. Interesting "beach"/lounge area on the 2nd floor. Cool aesthetic. Cons - Spotty service, NO COFFEE POT IN THE ROOMS, a ridiculously small pool, no hot tub, low quality cheap-motel-dorm-like furniture, not up to the standards of other Starwood properties While I think Starwood still has some great hotels, the W San Diego isn't one of them. Since this is the 3rd bad experience in a row we've had at a W hotel, I believe we're done with them.

Reviews.Title: “A Birthday Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Lzem
Reviews.Content: I surprised my husband with a long weekend trip from cold Michigan to Warm SUNNY CA for his 34th birthday. We were both so excited to be out of the cold and just a chance to leisurely see and do as we pleased;And that's what we did! The hotel was nice. I honestly can't go on and on about it or it's amenities because we really only used it to sleep at night. BUT... the sleep was great. Because we were on Michigan time, our first night we accidentally fell asleep by 630pm. It was a night of complete and total uninterrupted sleep and the black out curtains were a nice touch. We were on the 14th floor and didn't have any noise from the Beach bar or hall ways. In the day sometimes you could hear through the walls but it was never actually disturbing. The lighting in the room was a little on the dim side which wasn't the best for getting ready. House Keeping came everyday and always refreshed our toiletries with the Bliss products. We LOVED those. Although one day we're pretty sure they folded up our dirty wet towels from the floor and put them back on the shelf. One great thing I can say....the Acura service.... SO convenient. We used it twice and it really saves time from walking and money from cab fare. Definitely utilize that amenity! LOCATION: I've read a lot of mixed reviews about the location. Honestly I thought it was in a great spot. Yes, there are quite a few bail bonds lining the street and you're only blocks away from a jail/prison but we NEVER EVER felt unsafe. I also read there are a ton of bums. Yes there were a handful here and there but it wasn't like you had to step over them to get to your destination. You mind your business they mind theirs. We basically walked to most places. Seaport Village is a 10minute walk (Coronado island ferry, Top of the market fish market, little shops and restaurants, museum etc) Little Italy-10/15 min walk GasLamp- We took the Acura there and a Pedicab back after the bar. Pedicab guy originally told us 40$ but a friend got him down to 20$. It was a 10min drive by car. Old Town was a 12-15$ cab ride We took the bus to the San Diego zoo. $2.25 a person one way. Not bad at all. (side note, I'm not a usual public bus taker...and the atmosphere is what you expect a public bus in a major city to be)But it's SUPER CHEAP and a 30 minute ride. There wasn't much as far as breakfast places. We ate twice at Grand Central and once in Little Italy at a Trattoria. It was Amazing. I think it was one of the only places open for breakfast in Little Italy. I do have one complaint. We did order room serivce one morning. My order was not difficult by any means but it was comletely screwed up. I double of things that I only asked for 1 of and 1 of what I ordered 2 of and one whole entree was missing, and I was charged for the double items I didn't order! When I realized it, I called and let them know I was not trying to be difficult,the food we actually did get was good but just didn't want to pay for the extra stuff. The woman I spoke with said "No problem, I'll let my manager know and have it taken care of". I said "Thanks" and forgot about it. The day of check out we received a reciept with all the items still on it stating I would be charged that amount. When we checked out I once again had to bring it to their attention. His reaction was polite, and slyly asked me "What do I think would be fair to do about the situation" In the end he took a portion of the charge off the bill but at that point I almost feel it should have been completely comped. My husband didn't even get his breakfast!! But we aren't complainers and just shared what we did have and I don't like making any kind of scene so I just went with what was happening. All in all. Good service, pretty clean, nice people and a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously?”
Reviews.Author: Catorce10
Reviews.Content: So at 10pm Thursday thru Saturday the lobby turns into a club. This small detail would have been helpful to know before making reservations. Seriously? If night time sleep is in your agenda at all this is not the place for you. However, if you plan on drinking your face off with minimal risk of a DUI when returning to your room where you will surely rock down the 12 dollar oreos before passing out- this very well may be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great place from which to explore San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: AdamGilbride
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in a few W hotels, and this was one of the best yet. Much better value than most (we paid $179/night as opposed to $279/night at the Westwood W) but the experience was just the same. The beach terrace with real sand was nice, and we got a good room upgrade. The chalk board in the room was great! This was our first time visiting San Diego and the location was great. All the waterfront front attractions were within easy walking distance. I love the Acura experience at W Hotels. We didn't actually make use of it this time because we had our own car but the guy on the desk was so friendly and helpful, telling us where to go and what to look out for. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “practically perfect”
Reviews.Author: danamichelle89
Reviews.Content: my boyfriend and i stayed there for a night for our anniversary in december. it was rainy, so the bar on the roof was closed cause of the sand n all, which wasnt a big deal but they ended up giving us an upgrade to a higher room floor for free and they gave us a free bottle of champaign when they found out we were celebrating the 5 years. it was on a weekday so it was pretty quite but it was a great time, a great room and great service.

Reviews.Title: “W San Diego - nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: keithki
Reviews.Content: I'm SPG Platinum and almost always stay at W properties. The W San Diego is one of my favorites. Nice property, great staff, and good location makes for an enjoyable stay. I've stayed at this property 6-7 times in the last two years and I always get an upgrade or a nice standard room. You can't go wrong in choosing this property for your next visit.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment! Don't waste your money!!”
Reviews.Author: OCgirl92833
Reviews.Content: I was pleased to find such a reasonable rate for the W San Diego for a recent short trip during my daughter’s spring break. However, once I arrived at the hotel I realized why the rates were so reasonable. The immediate area surrounding the hotel was less than desirable (a county jail and huge homeless population right on the next block) and the hotel was located further out of the gaslamp district than expected eliminating the ability to walk anywhere. Yet they charge $32 a night for parking. No wonder the hotel offers a complimentary Acura MDX to use if guests are travelling within 10 miles of the hotel. The valet and bell staff were exceptional. They provided top class service and addressed us by name on a daily basis. However, the front desk staff made a huge mistake upon check-in. The staff member gave us keys to the wrong room, which was already occupied by another guest. Luckily that guest was not in the room and the bellhop had accompanied us to the room with our luggage and quickly made a phone call to the front desk and took us to the correct room and got us new keycards. We were on the 4th floor and we could hear the noise from the street all day/night. Did I mention there is a bus stop/station right next to the hotel? The room itself was on the small side and the bathroom was a complete joke. The bathroom was clearly designed for aesthetics and not for functionality. There was no bathtub and no shower door which made bathing a toddler a real challenge. The lack of a shower door made keeping the bathroom floor dry difficult and the wet floor became a safety hazard. The toilet paper holder was located so far back that it was difficult to use. The window seat was so high that only a guest who was 7 feet tall could use it without a stepstool. The television picture quality was so poor and the remote barely functional. The pool and the surrounding area were so small. There were only 5 chairs for the entire pool area and the pool itself is more like the size of a large hot tub. We had a difficult time getting a chair to put our things at 4PM which I would assume is not a "peak time". There was no place to put trash or dirty towels so the pool area was a complete mess. Trash like cigarette butts and napkins were flying into the pool. For such a small hotel, the elevators took forever. There was sign apologizing for the delay and explaining that it was temporary since the elevators were being worked on, but the elevators remained slow for our entire 3 day stay. What a disappointment for the W brand.

Reviews.Title: “If you like the W brand, skip this one”
Reviews.Author: jenbet
Reviews.Content: At first I was embarrassed to have gotten the room for the price I did, now I see why and feel I over paid. All my regular hotels were booked so I tried this one. Convenient to the trolley and walking to downtown. Yes you pass the jail, but in general SD is not that unsafe. Room was clean but run down. Carpet dirty and stained (I didn't even want to walk barefoot on it), the bathroom was nothing special. Had to pay for everything - for the price of hotel you think they could give you something... even at the Comfort in you get water and ummm.. a coffee maker in your room. The iPod dock did not charge the iPod and was broken so I could not set the alarm. The batteries in the TV remote were dead. The service though, with the exception of the rude front desk staff, was good. Really? At 4am when you are just sitting there and you see a guest struggling with bags you can't be bothered to open the door?? I was there on family business and had to use the business center. Charged $6 per 15 minutes (so I had to pay to use the internet twice in order to print). Charged for faxes but there was no directions on how to use the fax (face up? face down?) and no confirmation of whether the fax went through. It didn't (and I was charged anyway). Parking: the W charges $35 a night. Not outrageous or unexpected for a downtown hotel with limited surrounding parking. HOWEVER, this hotel could make it better for their guests by charging less because there are numerous lots across the street and within a 2 block radius that charge anywhere from $15-$30 overnight in addition to the free street parking after 6pm. I paid for the first night because my family member could not walk far, but the 2nd and third nights I found free street parking just outside the door. In general, it was not a bad stay. But from what I expect of a W brand I don't recommend this site. Where it is not a regular practice, I could have stayed at the Motel 6 and been just as happy... the beds may not be as nice but at least they have free internet, free parking, and give you coffee in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Average property - but on the small size”
Reviews.Author: enilk3
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a decent location - about a 10min, $15cab ride from the airport. It was a 15min walk to the Gaslamp area and about a 5min walk from the waterfront. I am a Starwood Platinum but did not receive an upgraded room. The room I got was tiny. It basically just fit a king-size bed so I would not recommend families staying here who need more space. The pool area is also the smallest I have ever seen. The pool is maybe 15 feet long and only has 4 pool chairs. Overall the hotel was a lot less "jazzy" then other W properties I have stayed at. The Westin Hotel around the corner offers a lot more space and a better value.

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel San Diego, rude, false bogus smoking charge”
Reviews.Author: crashjosh
Reviews.Content: I stay over a hundred nights a year at hotels throughout the world and have never felt the need to write a review until after my stay at the W San Diego. Until now I have remained mostly loyal to the SPG brand but am seriously reconsidering the brand after my W stay. A few days after a 1 night stay I saw my credit card was charged an extra $200 over the reserved rate. When I called the hotel the front desk said they would look into it. According to the reservation, $200 is charged if a guest smokes in the room but I asked how this could apply to me since I don’t smoke. Then the girl said yes, that is the charge, you smoked in your room. First she didn’t know why I was charged but after I mentioned the latter the computer in front of her apparently said there was a smoking charge. I then spoke to a manager named Bernard, who besides being extremely rude, asked me if I perhaps remembered smoking in the room even after I told him at the beginning of the conversation I don’t smoke and this charge is impossible. At the end of the conversation Bernard refused to refund the false charge. Bernard may have lost SPG my business, I refuse to be called a liar and furthermore hate those, like Bernard and the W San Diego, that lie, cheat, and steal. Do yourself a favor and stay away from the W. If you want to stick with Starwood, the Westin is 1 block away and doesn’t have the rude and nasty staff the W does (who lie, cheat, and steal).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Downtown”
Reviews.Author: prg210
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to San Diego, and although Downtown San Diego is quiet compared to the New York that I am used, I really enjoyed the location of the hotel. It is a short walk to the trolley which takes you to Old Town and other popular destinations in minutes. The staff here was wonderful, and the rooms, although on the smaller side, are very comfortable. The housekeeper noticed we had a third person and made up the window-side couch to accomodate us. It was very thoughtful and it was great that we did not have to ask for this. It's little things like this that can make a satisfied guest.

Reviews.Title: “Enthusiasm wins the day”
Reviews.Author: SunnytheTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights with 2 young children, and the staff at the W distinguished itself with its enthusiasm. We stayed in a Cool Corner Room, and the space was just right, with a nice tub and refreshing shower. The room was totally clean, and the sleep at night was actually better than home. I think our two children have become W "babies"!

Reviews.Title: “Paper thin walls”
Reviews.Author: Spahh!girl
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel, very beautiful...but when we suffer a sleepless night, this is not good. Everything was great in our requested room away from the elevators #424 until 2:00 a.m. when the guests in the adjacent room returned to their room. Every single word and music that was turned on completely disrupted our sleep from then on. How could we call security when we didn't even know which room it was coming from? Last thing we wanted to do was to get out of bed to conduct an investigation down the hall. Sadly, we can never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One great night then two awful nights”
Reviews.Author: lukelb1231
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W on business and it was like staying at two different hotels. Wednesday night had probably the best nights sleep at a hotel, the bed is huge, very comfortable, the blinds/curtains create a completely blackened out room, only with a small night light by the bed for a little light = perfect for sleeping on a business trip. Staff at the desk were so polite, Philip the guy from Germany was so helpful. Thursday return to room after breakfast and room had been cleaned, well barely, sink still full of the green slime from the hand soap they provide. Thursday night was kept up by people in the neighboring room but didn't complain to reception as they went quiet around 2 am. Friday returned from the business meeting and toilet was blocked so had to phone reception to get that sorted out, not sure what the maid had put down there but it took the guy about 5 minutes to fix it. Friday night was like a nightmare, came back to the room after enjoying the DJ on the roof top with friend. Music was being played really loud from the room next door. Called security and they quietened down. About 1 hour later the people were talking really loud still, having a small party in my room. After 5 calls to reception they got me a different room, but the guy who came up acted like I was an inconvenience to him. Overall had one amazing night but two terrible nights. Wouldn't recommend this place if you need to be up early for business meetings! However the desk staff were so friendly and helpful especially Philip. One more thing, they charge per computer you connect to the internet $15 each for an iPhone and a laptop gets expensive! The breakfast though expensive at the hotel is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “The staff and rooms were very accomodating with a touch of class!”
Reviews.Author: danaaz10
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a "sweet" suite which included connecting rooms with a parlor or living room arrangement in between the bedrooms. This was an excellant arrangement for me and my guests who were there to celebrate a 40th birthday. The staff was gracious and helpful both on the phone and in person. They even allowed us a late checkout at 2pm - wonderful stay! Thank you all:)

Reviews.Title: “Simply fantastic service, customer interactions and staff friendliness”
Reviews.Author: lmheim1
Reviews.Content: I have been a road warrior for 20 years, staying at least 100 nights a year in 4 star hotels. I am pretty jaded about travel in general and it takes something major for me to raise an eyebrow. I spent a week here, having been at other W hotels before, so I kind of knew what to expect, but I was very surprised in a positive way. If you don't know about W Hotels, they have a strong hipster, eurocool vibe/decor, with "house music" pumping in the lobby and elevators at all hours. Granted, I am a bit too old for the hipster clubbing type scene, but it is kind of neat to stay at a hotel that isn't your standard look-feel hotel. But it isn't the bricks and mortar that motivated me to write this. Instead, EVERY single staff member I had contact with was happy, friendly and genuine. The front desk staff were great and absolutely NOT condescending as they sometimes can be at upper end hotels. The wait staff bent over backwards to respond to requests - and did so with HUGE smiles and happy banter. Even one of the maintenance guys I ran into in the lobby men's room called me by name (I guess he saw my nametag) and asked how I was doing. Overall, I was so impressed with the staff I sent an email to the W CEO and the property GM (with whom I had already chatted during my stay) complimenting them on their friendliness and customer service. I can't recommend the W San Diego highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: Victor_Manuel
Reviews.Content: Sorry it's to late for the review, but I am learning who to use this site, we took our family for a vacation last September, we had the opportunity to book this great hotel, My wife and kids love it, my wife ask me to take her once again but without the kids. Great staff, great service, had a great time

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly”
Reviews.Author: sarinasydney
Reviews.Content: This hotel, from the restaurant, to the bar, to the room was heavenly. The staff were amazing and I could not recommend this hotel more. Travelled all over the world and this hotel would be up there with my favourites.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ErichDavis
Reviews.Content: Not only was it the typical W experience (which is always good), I left my iPod at the pool, it was turned in, and they were able to send it to me. THAT wouldn't happen at most hotels!! Way to go the extra mile for a good customer. THANKS!

Reviews.Title: “Funky”
Reviews.Author: Flubberghusted
Reviews.Content: I'm a fan of the W's and whilst this one wasnt as good as say the former Sydney one. It still was a very good stay. I love their detail. The elevator carpets would great you according to the day. The beach rooftop bar was very trendy and the gym was impressive with the latest equipment. Room was more on the smaller side but the window seat, bean bag, chalkboard and bed were all very good. Bathroom showerglass had a hole you can turn the shower on first so you dont get the first blast of cold water. That was a nice touch but the half screen like other reviews did cause spillage. For the size, it gets a slight mark down but other than that, it was quite consistent with the W standard which never fails to impress. For those blasting the W's, you either have ridiculous high, unreasonable standards or you're just a headcase. Go to a caravan park and then tell me that these hotels are bad.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing stay at an amazing hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TamerG
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my parents to stay at while visiting me for my birthday. After spending the night night there they could not stop talking about how wonderful there stay was. The room was extremley clean with great attention to detail in every part. The bed was simply amazing and they didn't want to get off it in the morning and when I went to pick them up I found out exactly why. They also loved how close it was to downtown without being in the epicenter. Overall this is the best hotel I have been to in downtown San Diego

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: RAKlein
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel after a week at a health resort in Tecate, Mexico. We arrived via taxi and were amazed that two bellmen/valets watched as we collected our luggage from the trunk (the cabby said that that was the norm for this hotel) ... neither offering to help. The hotel was interesting as a product, however the room was small, the elevators were dark (for effect), soundproofing was so-so, and the bed was not as comfortable as those normally found at Westins or Sheratons. I used points for the room, so the price was right, but I wouldn't have been pleased had we payed the going rate. The hotel is worth the experience for a night (I am not sure how it compares with other W Hotels, but I would now be shy about trying others).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: takis_rek
Reviews.Content: the location is not the best in town but the hotel itself rewards you. super reception and lobby and the room was great with a fantastic bed. the bathroom could be a bit more modern. the hotel staff was very polite and especially the concierge did whatever was possible to get me through the difficulties with dinner reservations. the cost per night was high and i didnt like the fact that i had to pay for the internet connection in the room. For the breakfast i have no opinion since i dont take breakfast. definetely my choice next time i am there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay at the W!”
Reviews.Author: MJ0527
Reviews.Content: I was down in Rancho Bernardo during the month of January for work and I decided to stay at the W Hotel in downtown every week. The hotel is situated close to Little Italy, so there are many restaurants nearby. However, it's not very close to the gaslamp district, so if you're looking to go to gaslamp, you will likely need a cab. Also, when driving to the W hotel, you pass a couple of "not soo good" areas of San Diego. So, the hotel isn't in the best area, but it's safe. From dropping off your car at the valet, to checking in, to getting to your room - the W is amazing. If you stay there for more than a few days, the staff will get to know your name. The lounge area downstairs looks amazing and I always see people eating breakfast and having meetings in the morning and folks hanging out getting drinks in the evening. Also, their outdoor bar on the 3rd floor is amazing. It's a nice change that you won't find at other hotels in San Diego. The outdoor bar also has heated sand, so it really is unique. The rooms are typical W rooms - the bathrooms have walk-in showers, great bathroom amenities, and excellent beds! I didn't eat the restaurant in the hotel, but I've heard from colleagues that it's good.

Reviews.Title: “This was a very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: LA996
Reviews.Content: I had to travel to San Diego for business Mon-Thu, and found that the W was one of the best priced hotels in downtown. I called them directly to get the best rate. Mon-Wed nights are pretty quiet. The staff was very friendly helping me with directions and recommending restaurants. The room was very nicely decorated, clean and quiet. I enjoyed the high seating bench where I could relax next to the window, although there's not much view to see with all the tall buidlings around. I opted for not having housekeeping clean my room, as you get extra points and I prefer not to have anyone in my room anyway. However I did notice that they still come into your room each day to check the mini-bar. I stopped by the small pool area once, but it was closed for a private party. The location is in walking distance to Little Italy restaurants and Horton Plaza, but a bit of a hike to the Gas Lamp district. The wi-fi and parking are fairly expensive, but overall everything else was great.

Reviews.Title: “Not like the other W's”
Reviews.Author: cardio-2
Reviews.Content: I have to echo the other reviews for this hotel. While the staff was congenial there are certainly drawbacks to this W as compared to others, e.g. Dallas. Trendy and dark the hotel tries to be a Hard Rock, which is not the goal of the W guest. The room, after an upgrade to a corner room, was nice. The bed was comfortable. 14.95 for wireless seems unacceptable in these days when the Doubletree offers it free. It failed on the second day and staff were kind enough to remove the charge. Two stroke pool and 2 chairs in the available sun (nearby buildings obstruct sun most of the day) limit outdoor delights. A "beach", one level above the pool was closed for a private party as was the pool 2/3 days. 10 minute walk to the vibrant gas lamp area, a car is available for courtesy transport to (not from) but only by reservation. Overall....OK and if you get into deep trouble the bail bond guy is just across the corner.

Reviews.Title: “So very very disapointing.”
Reviews.Author: channer3
Reviews.Content: I'm mid way through a 6 night stay in San Diego. I chose to come here for a little ret post a birthday in Vegas. The hotel is nice, room is nice, bed is super comfy. The pool is aboput two strokes in length - enough if you just want to dip. The location is between 3 parking lots and nowhere near the gaslamp district as I had assumed. The hotel offered me 500 points on my SPG card for opting not to have daily room cleaned daily and to simply ask when I needed the service. Yesterday and today I requested the room be cleaned on both nights came home to an uncleaned room! It's great to have a "whatever, whenever" button on on the phone if the person who answers it can do "whatever, whenever" instead of just putting you through to a choice (room service) I could have have pressed on the telephone if they had a button called "eat" Look it's not awful - I feel very comfortable. But if you would rather a selection of restaurants at your hotel entrance rather than a trio of parking lots and a quartet of homeless chaps - try the Hard Rock Hotel! PS - the internet speed is so ridiculously slow that it is impossible to see flash content on the web!

Reviews.Title: “W Standards Not Met”
Reviews.Author: stan_e_w
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the layout of the room. Great color schemes and comfortable bed/pillows. The valet parking service was exceptional with friendly, courteous, and helpful valets. However, the hotel didn't really meet my standards for what a W experience should be ~Half a shower door = water spewing out everywhere ~First night asked for room slippers and the front desk said they ran out of them for the night. Second day someone informed me that they don't provide any and that I can purchase some online. That's fine, but I was told two different things by two different people ~I could not always find someone at the front desk to answer my questions. ~Asked for late check out and the front desk was not very friendly ~I was quoted one price over the phone and got a bill that was different.

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: wenjor
Reviews.Content: This is the second "W" hotel I have stayed at. A big Plus is the conscientious and friendly staff. However I don't consider that the hotels deliver on value for what you pay. I would think such a trendy spot would include free wi-fi throughout, rather than charging for it in the rooms. All the goodies in the rooms come with a steep fee. I was here for a conference, and the general session room was awkward, the exihibit space was inconvenient to the conference. The conference meals were mixed: breakfast was awful, sit-down lunch was blah, lunch buffet was good, reception was great (except for the OUTRAGEOUS price for beverages - $10 for a glass of NON CALIFORNIA wine?!?). Another big minus for me is the club music pounding in the elevators at all times. Maybe I'm just too old for this chain.

Reviews.Title: “My first stay at a W.”
Reviews.Author: gstepp
Reviews.Content: Stayed from 1/24-1/26. Abosolutely loved the room and the hotel style. A good comparison that i heard was "virgin Atlantic" cool. I would agree. I did not like the shower. With only a half shower door, there was some water that got out, and a feeling of being vulnerable. Front desk staff was nice but i never really saw anyone else other than the door men. The room is pricey and probably would be very pickey about when i would stay there again due to the cost. But you can't beat the atmosphere and the pillows!

Reviews.Title: “DISAPPOINTED”
Reviews.Author: canica14
Reviews.Content: Did not meet my expectations of a W Hotel. Run down property, in a marginal location. Several problems with the room, problems with the shower that spills water everywhere. lights did not work properly. One good review: food at the RICE restaurant was excellent

Reviews.Title: “Reliable, not excellent”
Reviews.Author: Natale12
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W. Needed to be close to courts. Hotel was adequate but location did not seem desireable. Fine for the purpose but would not chode it for pleasure visit to San Diego. Natale Law Offices

Reviews.Title: “Boots Retail USA”
Reviews.Author: Timmij80
Reviews.Content: Hi- From the service at the front desk Philip and Patrick at the bar on second level things were GREAT! The last day my bag broke on my suitcase and I was needing to get to the airport and the guy (hispanic) I believe ran around looking for duck tape and recommended a place to quickly get a new suitcase. He mentioned his name but with everyone in such a hurry to get to the airport I missed it! I'd recommend this hotel to say in for the service and the attentive nature of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Service, Great Location, Unparallelled Coolness”
Reviews.Author: NicolesDayDreamin
Reviews.Content: I am blown away by the excellent service and the quality of this hotel. I booked this hotel through Priceline, and they were the only 4-star hotel under $100 in the Gaslamp area of San Diego. For the price, I feel like my value was incredible. Upon first arriving we were checked in promptly, and were given a room on the 11th floor. The decor was beautiful, the hotel is clean and well-kept. The staff was incredibly accommodating and was eager to assist, unlike most hotels where they make you feel like you're a chore. The 2nd night we were there I kindly requested to move to a higher floor and the manager immediately helped us change rooms to the 17th floor with a VIEW! That is the best customer service any guest can ask for: no arguing, just immediately moving us and accommodating us! Any time I called down to the front desk they were very friendly and accommodating, for example when I needed new coffee or towels, the staff would be there in a matter of minutes. I wish more hotels would learn from this hotel's service example, because never once did I feel a lack of service. In addition, this hotel is modern and COOL. I love the looks of the rooms, the bed is incredibly comfortable, not like a sandpapery rock pocket Flintstone bed. The Beach Bar on the 2nd floor is incredibly cool, it has sand on the floor that gets raked daily, fire pits and heaters to keep you warm, and they even do a happy hour. This place rocks, it is so much better than a Hilton or Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Xebec_Lady
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying at the W, which has a unique, modern style. Loved the room decor, including the chalk board and window seat :) Employees were very friendly. Loved the free ride with Acura--worth listening to the commercial. I used this service twice. Close enough to walk to the convention center (10-15 min) and Little Italy (5-10 min.). Not many dining choices in the immediate neighborhood. The downside: no coffee pot in the room! So, I had to go out for my morning caffeine. Also, the water pressure in the shower was weak (but a very nice bathroom). I got a great deal on the internet and it was well worth it, and then some!

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Vacation”
Reviews.Author: clark124
Reviews.Content: The stay was very nice for myself and my family. My three year old daughter informed me that this was her favorite hotel. I think it was due to the people being so friendly and the decor being really modern. The staff and the hotel guests are a different type of patron (younger, liberal,and modern), so we really enjoyed it. The hotel "beach" was closed due to the rain and if we could have been able to hang out in the sand and burn a fire at night, it would have been even more fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, nice hotel, a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: mnmmom23
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the W. The staff was super friendly, helpful, knowledgeable and accommodating. At one point we thought a bag of our dirty clothes was missing and they had people digging through trash to look for it! (we felt horrible when we later found the bag in our room) The ONLY downsides were that the rooms were a little small, walls were paper thin, and the hotel was almost TOO trendy/stylish for our family with three young, energetic boys. AND the vale parking is $33/night! There is a parking garage 1 block away that charges $10/night.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: ralard
Reviews.Content: The place was full of crazy people and drunks during the 2011 NY's eve, but the staff were amazing, all pro, all calm, and all working hard, even the manager, Stefan, was taking food to the rooms at one point, this is no doubt the best place out of home where it just feels like home...

Reviews.Title: “"W' is for Weak Beds”
Reviews.Author: chrimair
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great, I am a platinum Starwoods member and have stayed at many. However, the beds in my room this time were extremely soft and I therefore did not sleep very well at all. I had to speak to the concierge upon checkout because a movie was billed to my room twice. He was very kind and removed the movies charges in their entirety. He also advised that next time they would swap the beds out until they suited me. Overall not a good stay this time but the kind customer service upon checkout will likely induce me swing back around at least once more for a last chance.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: GrabNPassport
Reviews.Content: I really felt the Whatever, Whenever love from the W San Diego and its entire staff. The check-in was speedy and friendly. From the time we entered until our departure, we were welcomed by warm smiles, always eager to assist. We travel a lot, and will definitely stay on future visits!

Reviews.Title: “Nice style”
Reviews.Author: BixUS
Reviews.Content: Good but not overwhelming food. Service polite and friendly as might be expected. Meeting room comfortable. Bed was quite comfortable - no trouble falling asleep....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SWCSydney
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel if you are looking for somewhere stylish and central. The only downside was the noise of sirens that seemed to go all night. Not the hotels issue but annoying regardless. I really like everything about this hotel. The beds are incredibly comfortable. I rarely get a good night sleep when away but slept very well all week.

Reviews.Title: “Style over substance”
Reviews.Author: VivaRobVegas
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to go to San Diego and enjoy the W, but unfortunately I was a little underwhelmed. I have experienced other W hotels before, but I felt this one lacked the soul & character others have displayed. Firstly the location is a little isolated - if you are going to spend most of your nights out in the heart of the Gaslamp quarter, be prepared for a 15 minute walk. There is also a correctional facility across the street and several car park lots that seem to be home to more street people than vehicles. The room I booked was classified as a 'Spectacular Room', and other than the bed and the pillows, it probably didn't live up to its moniker. The room was adequately sized although quite well appointed, but the walls are paper thin and you will hear your neighbours. On the plus side, the staff are extremely helpful and friendly, and 'The Beach', their outdoor bar area, was just fantastic and a perfect place to put the feet up & enjoy a nightcap. I would stay there again, but only if the room rate made it better value than its competitors.

Reviews.Title: “Very Fun, Very Nice, Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: steaknife
Reviews.Content: I had a blast at the W. The beach bar was awesome as well as the room. Great location downtown and just what you would expect from the staff of any other W. People are friendly and helpful and will do pretty much anything for you. I need to make another trip 30 minutes into the city sometime soon.

Reviews.Title: “overfurnished undersized rooms, $15 for Internet, annoying music in lobby”
Reviews.Author: NotUsuallyPicky
Reviews.Content: It would have been one star, given the price of this place and the value delivered, but they are pet-friendly so I made it two. I come here on business and the folks I work for have some sort of deal with the W, but the rate is still over $200/night for a ridiculously small room stuffed with furniture. The experience starts with walking into the lobby at 11 pm and hearing dance club music turned up fairly loud. The hip young crowd consists of exactly two people working the front desk and no guests. So the lobby is totally empty, but the music is cranked up as though it were a happening scene. I grope my way through the dim lobby to the elevators where I have to use my room key to activate the machine. Then, like the boring business traveler that I am, I want to set up my computer. There is nowhere to plug in a laptop charger on the desk. Internet costs $15/day. The average Hilton Garden Inn or Hampton Inn is way more user-friendly. You get a room that is twice as big, for half as much money, and enjoy free Internet.

Reviews.Title: “Too weird - not worth the SPG points I gave up to stay here”
Reviews.Author: Freq_Traveler_FromCA
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at a W Hotel. I've stayed at many many Starwood properties before. The rooms were small, the furniture was very Ikea-like (cheap, dinged-up, plain) and the rooms were very noisy from street traffic, sirens, and hall traffic. There were no special amenities for guests (e.g. concierge suite, compl breakfast or anything memorable) other than a quirky room and dark lobby. For 12,000 SPG points a night - we could have stayed at St Regis or other Luxury collection hotels or saved points and stayed weekend away at a beautiful Westin. This was so not worth the points. I appreciate the "quirkness" of the property (intimacy kits and iPod docking stations in the room) - but the presentation was just not there. For that many SPG points - or their ADR's north of $250 / night, free wi-fi would be nice. The parking was $32 / night and it's outdoor parking. For that much - you think they could find a nice garage to keep your car? Gym and pool are small. So not worth the ADR or the points equivalent to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it can't wait to do it again”
Reviews.Author: tlsawyer
Reviews.Content: From arrival to check out the hotel and staff was great ,Melissa Humble was great and very knowledgeable about the on goings in San Diego ,Thank you Melissa , we loved all the W had to offer

Reviews.Title: “Unusually Bad W Hotel”
Reviews.Author: billyar
Reviews.Content: I usually enjoy my stays at the W brand; but not this one. As a top-tier frequent guest at Starwood properties I go all the way back to the first W properties in NYC. The W San Diego is easily the worst of the many in which I have stayed. Things started off badly when I arrived and no one was at the valet station (there is no self parking.) I hate paying 35 a night to be inconvenienced. It got worse at the front desk where I had to fight for an upgrade; I had to take a low floor/handicapped room to get a larger room. I booked the room last minute myself but my platinum reservation agent let me know that the hotel had plenty of rooms in all categories for my stay that night so an upgrade should be no problem. The desk clerk falsely claimed that nothing else was available. Warning to SPG members this hotel will not treat you well. I unpacked and started to take a shower. I quickly noticed that the handicapped shower floor was not angled properly causing the water to start to flood into the bathroom. What a pain. I knew this was not good and called the front desk for a room change. I found out that the hotel had been aware of the problem for years and usually asked to guests to make a 'towel dam" on the floor to control the water. This place is a mess. In order to get a non-flooding room I had to take a downgrade to a standard no water view room. Gee thanks. The decor is odd for a W property. The rooms are white laminate (chipped and painted over) with a chalkboard with no chalk or erasers. Probably too many guests were writing This Place Sucks on the blackboard. I have a feeling W rightly abandoned this decor as I have not seen it elsewhere. The pool, pool area, and the fitness room are microscopic. As if that were not bad enough the entire pool area was taken over for a business meeting. It was really bizarre to be sweating on a machine while a business conference is in session inches away. I cant imagine trying to swim with the tablecloths nearly dipping in the water of the tiny pool. It is so wrong for any hotel to usurp the fitness area and pool area for private parties. The location is off putting as welI. It is next to the high-rise jail and is surrounded by the usual bail bond places and their customers. It seems most of the rooms have crappy views. My first room was of a parking lot and bus transit area. The second room view was not much better. The hotel seemed deserted and had none of the usual W vibe. The restaurants were both empty at breakfast and dinner. I did not try them. This hotel is the worst in the W chain and by far the worst of all the Starwood options in San Diego area. Avoid it, as you can find much better nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience at an awesome hotel! Great staff and comfortable room!”
Reviews.Author: gogo2travel
Reviews.Content: From the arrival experience to the smooth departure we enjoyed our entire stay. The concierge took great care of all our requests and the Welcome Desk was really pleasant. The room is really nice and we will definetely stay here next time we are in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “ideal location, ambience and staff really make the W the place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: lonestarAustin_Texas
Reviews.Content: After staying at the W many times over the past year, I realized the top-notch staff and the overall quality of the hotel deserved to be praised on TripAdvisor. The goal at the W is to wow their guests, and they really deliver. Starting when I walk in the front door to the friendly smile and greeting of the personable Melissa at reception (who always remembers my name, even after months since my last stay!), to the friendly bartenders in the lobby bar and the Rice restaurant waitstaff, everything is top notch. The rooms are nice also. All in all a quality hotel experience, stay after stay. I also like the convenient location between the Gaslamp district and Little Italy - plenty of great dining options nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Ashley Shepherd, Welcome Desk Agent, sets the bar for exceptional customer service.”
Reviews.Author: mariajh23
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel however I did experience some problems-such as a plugged up bathroom sink, someone trying to enter my room early one morning even though I had the "do not disturb" sign etc. And so when I hinted to the front desk agent that everything was not as I expected from a W hotel, Ashley jumped into action. She took care of my problems, apologized and then sent a bottle of wine & some chocolates to my room. After that day she made it a point to see that everything was perfect during my 1 week stay..and it was--all thanks to her. So thank you Ashley--you have set the bar as far as exceptional customer service--and I will always be grateful to you.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel, nice people”
Reviews.Author: Saga_F
Reviews.Content: We spent the last 4 nights of our USA tour in W San Diego. The hotel is located in the centre of San Diego quite close to Little Italy and Gaslamp Quarter. The location is not the best though. Next time we might choose a hotel near harbor area (e.g. Hilton) with nice views. Check in was handled in a second and the concierge presented himself right away which was a nice touch (also gave his business card right away and told to contact if any questions). In W San Diego we also got an immediate introduction of the Acura one way complimentary transfer which we didn’t get at W Times Square. We arrived by car and parked the car ourselves since the price W San Diego charges for their parking is ridiculous (triple price). The room was nice but we were very disappointed with the bathroom. It looked a bit old-fashioned and ordinary which is an absolute no-no in a W hotel (W Times Square had a nice, trendy bathroom). Bathroom would have needed a thorough cleaning (hairspray usually ends up on a lamp or other surfaces and those were not cleaned during our stay). What annoyed us was the fact that the cleaning ladies came into our room at 9am every single day. We would have kind of understood it if it was midweek but we checked in on Friday and checked out on Tuesday so most of the days were weekend (and yes, we would prefer to sleep a bit longer during weekends..and yes, we did use the “do not disturb" sign). W San Diego doesn’t have a free WiFi in the rooms which is a big flaw (same thing applied to W Times Square). We know that there is a free internet in the lounge area (Living Room) but it is not the same since you always have to bring your laptop down and find a place to sit. We loved the “day bed” next to the window and the coloring of the room was fresh. Bed was very comfortable. The bar/Living Room area was very nice and service good. We also enjoyed the pool area (which is very small though) and had it for ourselves on Monday. Prices in the bar were quite ok but the minibar and snacks had a pretty steep price. Would we choose this hotel next time? It didn’t give us a WOW factor although almost everything worked fine. Don’t get me wrong, the hotel is trendy and service good so definitely worth for a try. Maybe I’ll try another hotel (with a nice seaview) and then notice that W San Diego was better but I’m willing to take the risk. Big plus goes for the nice service-minded people who work in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Pricy - spend your money elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: Hulu
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at W in New Orleans and at Miami Beach this was a great dissapointment. Cramped and tiny all the way - from our very small room and bathroom to the minimalistic pool (smaller than a Queen bed). The gym is another laugh! Location is not the best, at least 10 min walk from Gas Lamp area (where you want to be). Unfortunately quite a few of the local homless had found their slots around the hotel as well. Beds are fantastic as always on W, and they have a cool beachbar on level 2.Also had one of the best steaks on my USA trip served by roomservice. Friendly and serviceminded staff!

Reviews.Title: “Overwhelmingly disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: RedRockBlonde
Reviews.Content: After repeated stays at other properties, I have come to expect unrivalled excellence from Starwood with few disappointments. This W, unfortunately, does not live up to these standards. The bathroom floor was dirty and covered with hair, and the glass bathroom door was smudged and caked with unknown whitish globs. The housekeeping staff was alerted immediately and did literally scour the area on hands knees, offering apologies. Complimentary water as promised was not available, and the bellhop brought same upon request. Looking behind the bed for an outlet to charge my Android, I was faced with dust, dirt and grime. The carpet was also soiled and stained. A change of room was offered with the caveat that it would probably be noisy as it abutted the outdoor "beach". Ergo, we decided to stay put. Upon checking out, a valet was not available and had to be summoned. This was indisputedly an unsatisfactory stay and sits far below the standards of the Starwood brand. As an elite vacation owner coupled with the fact I was staying with invited guests not familiar with the Starwood brand, I was plainly embarrassed. Shame on Starwood!

Reviews.Title: “Very Hip San Diego Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MichaelMatthews
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here as this was ground zero for her best friend's wedding in early October. The entire wedding party had rooms in the hotel so there was lots of back and fourth between different rooms on different floors. The view is fantastic. Not much of a pool. The furniture and look of the lobby is something right out California's past and future. Neat old super-8 surf films are constantly showing on screens above. Check your hotel room key card pouch because printed on the back in small letters is a notice that USA TODAY will be charged to you if you don't tell the front desk right away. Since we were staying on the weekend we didn't even get the paper, but I think we got charged anyway. Staying here your just a few blocks from the promenade and from Little Italy. However, you still have a bit of a walk, so bring some comfortable shoes. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Oh, and on Saturday nights you'll hear club music playing since there are two clubs in the building that get quite busy. I think you can ask for ear plugs from the front desk. The parking situation could be better. You have to pay a lot for valet since parking on the street is metered and out of this world.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff that made us feel welcome -- even with an eight-month old child!”
Reviews.Author: sosteric
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently for business, usually staying at Westin on W's. We booked the W using Starwood Points, with the idea that we would enjoy the pool and see some of the sights (Zoo/etc) in San Diego as part of our first family trip since the birth of our first child. While I think we were one of only a few families at the W (if not the only one) during our stay, the Staff were extremely helpful and accomodating of our unique needs. Without even having to ask, we were given a room on the back side of the hotel away from where the pool was located because there was a DJ playing around the pool on Saturday evening. A clean and sturdy crib was delievered promptly on request. The staff were very helpful with tips as to the sights that we might enjoy with an eight-month old. Despite being a hotel for a "hip"/younger crowd, we were made to feel very welcome. On top of that, the hotel was very clean, and the room (a corner) was well-decorated and spacious, with very nice views. My wife was able to arrange a last-minute massage on our first night, which she thought was very good. On Saturday night, however, the massage appointments were all booked but the Spa helped arrange nearby massages for both my wife and I -- something that they did not need to do. I would definitely stay again when in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spot”
Reviews.Author: atw2000
Reviews.Content: The W San Diego is my home when travelling to downtown. Its location is ideal for work, and convenient to anything else you'd want to. The rooms are wonderful, clean, well appointed, and a joy to stay in. I really loved the shower design, one of my favorites. The workout facility is a tad small, but well kept and perfect for travelling. The Beach Bar is a nice spot, and breakfast downstairs in the morning is great. The staff are all wonderful, too, but Melissa Humble stands out as one of the most helpful and outgoing staffers at any hotel I have ever stayed in. Ask for her, she'll always take good care of you.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated, but still ok.”
Reviews.Author: sarahbear760
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my brother's wedding. We found the room to be clean and modern looking, but the decor looked worn and a bit cheap. The walls were thin as we could hear people in the next room. The bathroom shower was stopped up as well. We got a free stay by using our Starwoods points, but little things like the above made us question their high rates. We did need a frig for our infant's food and found the housekeeping staff friendly and prompt. Valet service was fast and friendly too.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to par...”
Reviews.Author: crouellette
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in several W hotels across the country and it is by far my favorite hotel to stay in. This location is below par to the others. Th windows at my window seat to my 17th floor room are very dirty. The service at check in was what I would expect in a Hampton Inn. It was not over the top as the W in San Francisco or W Buckhead. I ordered some things to be brought up at 7:00 in the morning and it took almost half an hour. When staying at the W you expect a certain level of service, thats why you pay to play and when it falls short very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home in San Diego.”
Reviews.Author: january4
Reviews.Content: There's no place like the W in San Diego. For business or pleasure, I look forward to staying in downtown at this hip, slick and cool hotel. The rooms have all the important amenities - quality flat screen TVs, MP3 players, bathrobes and chalkboards! Room service is quick and delicious. And, most important of all -- EVERYONE who works in the hotel is friendly and courteous!! From the Wheels guys, to the Front Desk staff, to the Room Service attendants to the Whatever, Whenever phone attendants - these people are just plain happy to help. My favorite staffer is Melissa Humble. She makes sure I feel like a VIP from the moment I arrive, taking care of all my needs and requests. I always look forward to seeing her during my stay. Looking forward to my next W fix!

Reviews.Title: “Ashley was amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: meganelise
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel!!!! The room was spacious and roomy!! The customer service that was given by Ashley at the front desk at the Downtown W in San Diego was above superior. She gave us information regarding the hotel as well as the many attractions that they have in San Diego.. Your hotel is very lucky to have such a valued employee. Thank you again for a fabulous stay!!! :D

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, could use a serious cleaning”
Reviews.Author: Scooper80
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a conference in SD. I loved the decor and feel of the hotel, but my room was super dirty. The carpets had seen MUCH better days and were in need of either replacing or serious cleaning. Smaller rooms, decent views of the area, great Bliss products in the bathroom. Would I stay here again? Possibly, if the price was right....seriously over-priced for a small room and dirty carpet.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: modesttraveller30s
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in the heart of San Diego. Rooms were clean and well-decorated. Service was very attentive. There is a great outdoor bar called "The Beach" where there is actual sand! It's a good place if you are looking for a young crowd. The staff are very attentive to customers of differing needs and preferences. The only thing that wasn't so great was the shower; perhaps the one in our room was faulty but we couldn't get good water pressure. Apart from that, it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Consitently great service over 15+ stays in the past year”
Reviews.Author: ackdog
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here many times in the past few years and twice a month for the past year While spacious rooms, reasonable prices and the geneal layout of the hotel have always been a an attraction, the service in the past year has notched up from a previous fairly average to excellent, From great personal service at check in, especially the ever attentive Ms Melissa Humble to great service in the restaurant, the W has become a very pleasant home-from-home. Little things like complimentary newspapers and fresh coffee from 6 am in the morning make for a good start every morning. A couple of years ago the restaurant (Rice) was at best unremarkable, but has now greatly improved with new chiefs and a clear mission to have a decent well priced menu without being to extensive. The wine list is not extensive but has been well chosen, Overall I can highly recommend fthe San Diego W for the business or leirsure travellers. Haven't been there on many weekends but Fridayand Saturdays nights may be a little hectic for those looking for peace and quiet

Reviews.Title: “A WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: Mariahouser
Reviews.Content: We visited San Diego and W hotel came highly recommended. I know why.. cause its wonderful! The service, staff, the modern and clean look.. I mean all the way around its just gorgeous! We checked in at the front desk with Mellisa Humble and she was just so knowledgeable and so sweet! The next night we decided to explore San Diego and went up to the concierge desk.. Joseph Valdez! What a professional concierge! He was very knowledgeable and he knew exactly what to recommend . He went out of his way to make sure we were well taken care of. A big thanks to Joseph at the concierge desk! Overall a wonderful experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Great time and great service!”
Reviews.Author: jenesseOC
Reviews.Content: From the first phone call to book my reservation until we departed, the level of service was professional and friendly. The room (penthouse level) was very clean and had nice modern decor. We truly enjoyed relaxing on the window bench overlooking the city below and felt like we were taken care of in every way... the concierge was quite helpful during our stay. We also had dinner in the W restaurant and thought the food was very tasty. Thank you W staff for a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: slwilkessr
Reviews.Content: Looking for a trendy hotel that''s centrally located to major attractions San Diego has to offer, the W Hotel fits the bill. I work in San Diego quite often, and have stayed in a number of hotel, however, its something about the W Hotel that draws me back. The hospitality at the reception desk is very professional and accommodating. The rooms are very clean and comfortable, and the amentities are top of the line. I've enjoyed breakfast in the restaurant as well as relaxing with a cocktail at the trendy Beach Bar. To be truthful though, I feel the one thing that really keeps me coming back is the level of genuine professionalism I received from Melissa Humble, the lady is a GEM, and a definite asset to your organization.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service from the Front Desk on up”
Reviews.Author: ivolabar1
Reviews.Content: The W San Diego is the best choice for the business traveler in San Diego. The staff, especially Melissa H. at the front desk, goes out of their way to accomodate business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great reception Cheers Melissa!!!”
Reviews.Author: lon8on
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very friendly and helpful staff. Outsanding service from Melissa on the front desk, great welcome and explained everything available and things to do in the area. Definately visit again and reconmend other W hotels they are great.

Reviews.Title: “Melissa Humble, Amazing Hostess!”
Reviews.Author: vbset4
Reviews.Content: As a Starwood Platinum Guest, I'm used to great service, but this place is awesome! Melissa always has a smile on her face and the hotel is nice too. Valet guys don't bang up the Lexus either, bonus points for that. Melissa says I can get a free shoe shine, which I really need, those kicks are really beat up. The bar scene is dead, location not the best. Cool corner suites are sweet. Whatever Wherever Whenever. Cheers, -Erik

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with even better service”
Reviews.Author: aandm_kumar
Reviews.Content: Thouroughly enjoyed our stay at the W. Josh Goldberg and his staff took excellent care of us. After a night out, nothing beats Josh making sure we got our sexy fries order in before the kitchen closed in the wee hours.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the wonderful service!”
Reviews.Author: Purple099
Reviews.Content: The staff were very attentive and friendly. We had a fabulous experience and truly enjoyed our stay and the personal care and attention provided. The rooms and meeting space were comfortable and clean....loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: b4260878
Reviews.Content: The people here are great, Especially Melissa Humble. She was very kind, courteous and helpful throughout my stay. The room was comfortable and the view was wonderful. I would not hesitate to recommend W San Diego based on just this one stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: sbd1911
Reviews.Content: Once again, we had a wonderful stay at the W San Diego. A must for those seeking high quality individualized treatment. Josh Goldberg, the front desk manager, exemplifies the high standards maintained at the W brand boutique hotels

Reviews.Title: “Not for me - ear plugs are a must at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: BetsyBPhoenix
Reviews.Content: The Good: the hotel is clean and Melissa at the front desk was accomodating. We paid through priceline but she honored my starwood preferred gold member status and upgraded our room to a partial view of the bay. The maid service is exceptional. The bad: (1) elevator access. You always have to put your card in the reader slot in the elevator to get to your floor which makes for a cumbersome experience when your hands are full as ours often were. (2) No in-room cofffee which may seem trivial to some but a lifeline for me. The W offers coffee downstairs next to the lobby but they only had 1 pot and it was frequently empty which made for a very frustrating experience. (3) The "club" atmosphere with trance music being blasted in the lobby in the late afternoons and into the evenings was really annoying and made for a very loud hotel experience (I slept with ear plugs). (4) The rooms while clean and decorated elaborately in the same Blue/IKEA/funk complete with a chalk board and chalk, are small with limited shelf/drawer space and there is NO bathtub - shower only (and shower has no door). (5) There is no privacy in bathroom due to the apparently Asian inspired sliding bathroom door that really only blocks the opening to the bathroom, it actually does not close off the bathroom. (6) NO jacuzzi and a very, very small pool. (7) The gym was nice actually (with a variety of equipment) but with slatted doors it was open to the outside and an exhaust smell would come into the gym making it as though you were working out on the street next to a running diesel truck. (8) Location: next to a rather seedy section of down town, it was a good hike to the gas lamp district (Little Italy was closer) through vagrants and scary looking people and, with trains running through the night blaring their whistles, again, ear plugs are a must. (9) No onsite parking - you must use valet and at a whopping $32 per day, it really adds up. Good side- you can come and go as you like with no additional fee but the valets wanted tips each time they got your car for you. (10) the non front desk staff was rude and absolutely lacked elevator ettiquete. Other than the front desk who's sole job it is to greet and be courtious to guests, the rest of the staff we encountered were rude. As an example, one staff member actually brushed me out of the way so that she could get onto the elevator. I yielded to her and actually apologized, she however completely ignored me, pushed her way past me and jumped onto the elevator. We received similar treatment from other personnel. I gave it an average rating as you could definitely do worse and as an alleged 4 star hotel, it IS nice but it is just not my style with the loud club music, the rude staff and in short, the focus on a narrow niche market really missed its mark with me. Unless I am suckered into this hotel again through priceline or I get it for free, I will never stay at a W again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay as always”
Reviews.Author: lark911
Reviews.Content: I don't get to SD as much as some other business destinations but when I do I am very happy to stay at the W. Great location, comfortable yet stylish (or maybe it's stylish yet comfortable) rooms and outstanding service make this one of my favoite hotels anywhere - and I travel alot. Melissa at front desk made sure I had everything I needed and more. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: mistywilliams
Reviews.Content: Okay, so I can not express how wonderful my stay was. The Hotel was beautiful and fun. The resturants are amazing and I can't even being to express how wonderful the staff was. Ashley the young woman who helped us at the front desk was not only friendly but so kind and helpful. I have not been to a hotel in years that has put that much effort into there service.. I highly recommend The W Hotel in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: BigCZen
Reviews.Content: The W Hotel is a great brand of Starwood and the W Hotel in downtown San Diego is one of the best they have. It was featured on the travel show with Samantha Brown. The W in San Diego has modern and trendy decor but the best part about the hotel is the service. Great people who will go out of their way to help you and make sure your stay is wonderful. Take a trip up to the "Beach" which is an outside bar upstairs from the lobby with a sitting area that has sand on the floor to simulate the beach it's just a fabulous surprise. Another plus is the great shopping and restaurants at the Gas Lamp district all walking distance from the W Hotel. Hidden tip is they have a courtesy Acura experience shuttle service were they will take you in an Acura luxury SUV anywhere in a 10 mile radius from the hotel and it's free. The lobby is spacious with free wi-fi, great to catch up with emails, have a drink and people watch. In the evenings they have special events like concerts and mixers, great place to meet people. If you tired of the same ole old hotel experience the W Hotel in San Diego is the best place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: wrightbt
Reviews.Content: Before checking into the W San Diego after a long day of traveling and I had some issues with my reservation. After talking with someone over the phone in reservations who couldn't help I got to the hotel and found that the rep, Melissa Humble was of great help. She corrected my rate to the business rate and was just really pleasant. I normally don't write compliments but I'm a sucker for good customer service. I marked it down for cleanliness due to finding hair in my sheets - not good. If it wasn't for that it would have gotten a higher score.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Staff”
Reviews.Author: southbaygirl
Reviews.Content: I stay at The W San Diego every time I travel to San Diego, which is about 4 nights per month. The main reason I return to The W SD is the incredible staff-- in particular, Melissa Humble. She is exceptionally professional, friendly and is always aware of my arrival. I travel 2 nights per week tevery week to different cities, but the staff at the W SD is the best. It makes all the difference that they anticipate my needs and keep my trips operating smoothly. The hotel also has 2 great bars, and a great atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch staff and stellar comfort”
Reviews.Author: SDJules
Reviews.Content: My client had an event here and the staff was beyond incredible! Everyone from the Valets (who helped bring in TONS of boxes), Robbie at the Concierge Desk and Billy in the Food & Bev Department were overwhelmingly accommodating. The bed was so nice to climb into after a LONG day/night! The sheets are super soft (high thread count), the pillows were soft and the mattress was not to soft and not a slab of granite either...it was Goldielocks' "just right". They are in a pretty good location for enjoying some of Downtown San Diego's more popular clubs and there are tons of places to eat in the area as well.

Reviews.Title: “The W is a great trendy/modern place to stay in downtown SD”
Reviews.Author: st8cc8
Reviews.Content: The W is a great place to stay. It has modern/trendy decor in the common areas and in the rooms. The beds are comfortable and the flat screen TVs are a nice touch. It is oddly dark in a lot of areas (e.g. hallways, elevator). It didn't bother me, but it could be a problem for people (e.g. elderly). Pros - Restaurant has pretty good food. - Its a great location in downtown SD, and you can walk to anywhere. - Staff is friendly, and responsive. - If you're looking for a modern/trendy/upscale type hotel to stay at, look no further. It has a hip feel to it and usually a younger party type crowd staying there. Cons - 14.95 a night for wireless? Its absurd. At 200+ a night for a room, it should be included. It is annoying being nickel and dimed like that, but it seems to be standard for the industry at a lot of places. - The hotel can be noisy when its busy, and is dark. Overall the crowd seems to be on the younger side. I wouldn't necessarily recommend it for my grandparents, for instance, especially if they were traveling alone.

Reviews.Title: “Great ComicCon stay at the W”
Reviews.Author: soskinator
Reviews.Content: The hotel was extremely fun to stay at and very accommodating. Melissa Humble and her female co-worker at the front desk really made my life easier by immediately taking care of my business requests. Appreciate the help girls!

Reviews.Title: “First time in San Diego - Was great!”
Reviews.Author: QforQ
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in San Diego, and I was in town on business for San Diego Comic Con. When we first arrived, we had to get a rollout bed for the room for a colleague of mine. Melissa Humble at the front desk was a great help and very courteous, and was able to get a rollout bed for us in no time. We were very thankful! She even had some great nightlife suggestions for us to check out after we dropped our bags off in our room. I'm definitely looking forward to my next trip to San Diego, and I'll make sure to book my rooms at the W from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: tstrubel
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at hotels all around the world, and the W San Diego always provides the highest level of service. From check-in, to room requests, to advice on the best restaurants, they never fail to delight. The front desk staff, especially Melissa, do a really terrific job of ensuring their guests' needs are always met!

Reviews.Title: “I absolutely love the hotel and area...”
Reviews.Author: xmantexan
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love the hotel and area. Walking distance to great restaurants hotel work-out room is great. Breach vibe on roof top is outstanding. Staff at front desk is great and the service Mellisa Humble provided at check-in and throughout my stay was exceptional. Thanks for making my visit to San Diego a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: RickBroussard
Reviews.Content: I've been travelling from Houston to San Diego for business for the past 4 years. The W is my home away from home. Melissa Humble is great at setting my colleagues and me up with a simple call or e-mail. She takes care of everything else and greets us by name on arrival. The rooms are always clean and comfortable and any problems (such as a bad A/C once) are corrected immediately. One little feature I particularly enjoy is the Accura car service. I have taken advantage of a ride in a new Accura several times when leaving for the Airport. (Thanks Honda and W)

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in Downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: kcsCA
Reviews.Content: As a frequent business traveler I stay in a wide variety of boutique and luxury hotels. My new favorite is the W in San Diego. The personalized service is top-notch. I am a big believer in providing exceptional customer service because it makes the difference. I do it in my business and love it when I am on the receiving end! Melissa Humble, Welcome Desk Agent, has gone out of her way to make sure my stays are hassle-free and everything is up to par. I have instructed my business colleagues to now stay at the W as well. If we have free time there are a lot of fun activities on property from the Beach Bar to the Lobby Bar. I will probably rack up 10+ stays in this property in 2010.

Reviews.Title: “VERY COOL”
Reviews.Author: khalilthetraveler
Reviews.Content: First off, Service was great. Soon as I got in Melissa Humble took care of everything quickly and efficiently. Her customer service was hands down the best experience I've ever had checking into a hotel. My room was clean and very cool and the bed was awesome.
