Ordered room service once and the food was good and priced well. Location is not the best for a traveler -- a walk back late at night from the gaslamp area or convention center can be desolate.

Reviews.Title: “The W gets a WOW”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter2thow
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W in downtown San Diego at the beginning of the month. The place was immaculate and our room was off the hook! If you go you need to talk to a guy that works there named Greg Brebner. He told us all the cool places to go at night, best places for happy hour, and seemed like he was there whenever we needed anything. The restaurant has some incredible cuisine as well. The pool is fun, seemed very private, and the outdoor bar The Beach was a great place to sit by the fire and enjoy a cocktail.

Reviews.Title: “fun modern hotel, good service”
Reviews.Author: ivydturtle
Reviews.Content: pros: great design, very good customer service, loved the room, comfortable bed, _great_ Bliss products, nice gym cons: wimpy travel size dryer, no tea in the room (only coffee), could not turn off music in gym

Reviews.Title: “Great fun, great service.”
Reviews.Author: BSDSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed staying at the W Hotel in San Diego several times over the last several months for business. The service was especially good -- attentive, helpful, and friendly. Melissa Humble, the front desk person in the evenings, stands out on the "excellent service" front.

Reviews.Title: “It's true; you really do want to go where everybody knows your name!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer05
Reviews.Content: I travel for work every week. and, because of that, I get the opportunity to stay at some pretty nice hotels. Even better...hotels of my choice! I am sure that I am not out of the ordinary, but when I choose a hotel I consider several things: a super comfortable bed, a room that is clean and up-to-date (renovated or current furnishings), nice amenities (gym, pool, lobby), and excellent customer service. So, for anyone who has been to the W San Diego, it should come as no suprise that I always choose the W San Diego as my home away from home. The W San Diego is consistently excellent every time that I stay there. I always have a great room with a comfortable bed, the amenities are modern and chic ( I love the lobby vibe, fresh candles, board games...),and the customer service is first rate all the time. For example, when walked in to the lobby last week, Melissa Humble, the front desk associate, warmly greeted me by name. She noticed earlier in the day that I was checking in that afternoon so she had set aside a beautiful upgraded room. This is not an uncommon occurence at the W. Each and every time I am personally greeted and they always go above and beyond. It is my first choice regardless if I am in town for business or pleasure. I would highly recommend it to anyone staying in the San Diego area!

Reviews.Title: “Very, Very Cool”
Reviews.Author: vinodavid
Reviews.Content: Good right from the start. A lovely young lady named Melissa Humble assisted me at the front desk, secured me an upgrade, and got me on my way on short order. The rooms are classic "W", very modern and trendy. The outdoor bar is crazy cool, great views, sand, yes sand, and lots of pretty people. Cool pool also with great views. I love this spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the W”
Reviews.Author: djduane1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the W in San Diego as we were attending the NAR convention. We were greeted by Mellissa H who was so pleasant and saw my consternation over the possiblity of NOT having a coffee maker in our room. As we are Starwood Preferred Group Gold members, she upgraded us to a Penthouse room with a great view and gave us in-room complimentary coffee and tea service, free wi-fi, and some other perks! Thanks to Melissa, my whole attitude quickly improved and we had a great time while we were there. Melissa is a real tribute to the service oriented W chain and we really appreciate all she did for us!

Reviews.Title: “One of the most relaxing and pampered stays ever!”
Reviews.Author: Boots1970
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by the always friendly staff. Melissa Humble was one of the first and she insisted on giving us great choices for restaurants when we asked about places to eat . We took her suggestions the next two nights and she was right on! The rooms are exceptionally comfortable and inviting. The shower was super refreshing,along with the cozy robes. It was a special treat to stay-my daughter set it up for my birthday and Ross,at the welcome desk, heard me say that and sent up chocolates and champagne-W is for WOW!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: itsjl
Reviews.Content: The staff was extremely helpful and very accommodating. The room was quite comfy and the hotel restaurant and bar were top notch. Melissa Humble, the W representative at the front desk, was a pleasure and helped get me set up with a great room. Would definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: shelleynjack
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the W Hotel. We were in town for a wedding and the hotel was in a great location. Fresh water with cucumber was avalable when you walk in and was a wonderful treat.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem in the heart of San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Randy37
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at the W last week. The hotel staff was spectacular, extremely efficient, friendly. Melissa Humble, the registration clerk was incredible. She was most friendly, cheerful, and provided me with just the right room for when my wife joined me later in the week. It makes life that much more enjoyable when traveling away from home, which is why I would definately stay here again on my next visit to San Diego. The bellman, and the free car service to restaurants was wonderful, and the staff always went the extra mile, I was most impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Hob nobbing with the beautiful people”
Reviews.Author: KeenEye
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely one of the hippest that I've stayed at. When we arrived, there were dancers on round stages set up near the front desk, and all of the staff were wearing ear-pieces to communicate with each other. I thought that perhaps we had entered a night club, but no, it was just happy hour... and everyone was certainly happy. We checked in and were escorted to our room by a very suave young man who wrote out a few things on a chalkboard in our room (such as the number for room service) and pointed out the amenities. A trance-like dance CD was already playing in the room, and he was very knowledgeable when we asked a few questions. Mirrors were everywhere, and an "intimacy kit" was lying near the bed. Yes, it *is* what you're thinking. We were given a wristband to enter any of the lounges on the premises, and when we hesitated to stand in line later that evening, we were immediately spotted and escorted to the front of the line and let in. Wearing our t-shirts and slippers, we didn't know that we were entering the coolest bar in San Diego. The 2nd floor Beach Bar is covered in sand, and it was hysterical to watch such gorgeous people wearing stilettos trying to walk gracefully while ankle-deep in the sand. We found a bench towards the cabanas and enjoyed people-watching for awhile. The entire experience was unlike any hotel I've ever stayed at. We decided that we weren't cool enough to stay there, though, and switched over to the Westgate instead. I would, however, recommend this hotel to those that enjoy nightlife and sophisticated, modern hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, needs a spring cleaning and touch up”
Reviews.Author: dgart
Reviews.Content: All staff were great! I needed a car for a day. They arranged for me to be picked up and taken to a car rental place nearby - no charge. I brought the car back the next day, handed them the key, and was done - so very easy and convenient!! All other interactions with the staff were very positive,pleasant, and easy. My only complaint is that they really need to do a deep cleaning - especially on the carpets. Our room's carpet was stained and discolored from not being cleaned. You could see where the foot traffic occurred. While everything else seemed clean enough, this made a negative impression on me. Also, the computer room is very isolated, which I didn't really like. Bring your lap top - this was $7 for 15 minutes! Carpet there needed to be cleaned as well. We don't usually eat dinner in the hotels we stay in, but one night we were really tired and did eat in the restaurant. It was very good, but a bit pricey - esp the glass of wine. Still, I would recommend it. Service was great. Overall, the hotel was fine. Good location, comfortable bed, nice bathroom, great service.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely WOWed!!!”
Reviews.Author: jeff_D_37
Reviews.Content: First of all, I have to say that **Melissa Humble is Best in the West**!!! I am a regular traveler to San Diego for business and now exclusively stay at the W San Diego because of their outstanding service and amenities! During my last stay, I was completely surprised with an unbelievable upgrade to the Extreme WOW suite on the top floor. The room was incredible and enormous! Melissa really went above and beyond by providing me with a truly unforgettable experience! l really enjoy every night spent at the W San Diego and will keep coming back. Thanks again Melissa!

Reviews.Title: “Over Rated”
Reviews.Author: the_d_duo
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in a number of hotels in the W chain, and were disappointed. The hotel is well located, but the decor is a little tired and I must say the service was not up to par. Although it was fine - it just always seemed that they were understaffed or had too much to do. The lobby bar is very nice - but I would pop by for the bar and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great service”
Reviews.Author: dixiesugar
Reviews.Content: I love W hotels, and the one in San Diego is another example of why. When we arrived our room (a suite) wasn't ready. The front desk clerk, Melissa Humble, walked us to the bar and made sure the drinks and snacks were complimentary until the room was ready. Melissa, and every staff member, asked about our stay and offered suggestions for everything - daytrips, restaurants, etc. It was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: HRLMD
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the W San Diego during a recent business trip. I have stayed at other W hotels in the past and always look forward to stay again but when it comes to San Diego, W lives up to the name with superb service and a 100% customer service driven atmosphere. Melissa at the welcome desk got an "A". You made us feel at home right away. What a nice young lady. Beautiful hotel, bar and fantastic bedroom with the most comfortable beds and linens. Complimentary transportation by Acura is a plus. Everything from arrival to departure was pleasant. This is not the first time I stay at W and will not be the last one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Gerat service from check-in to check-out!”
Reviews.Author: Rocky555
Reviews.Content: Right from the time Melissa helped us check in to the time we checked on three days later, it was a great all around experience. The bar at the beach, the fitness club, the ultra-chic lobby. Loved every minute of it, made better by excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, food, cleanliness and staff....everything I look for in a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: desertheat22
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the W San Diego for business and look forward to going back. A great location just a short walk (or courtesy vehicle) from restaurants, clubs and shopping. The food in the restaurant is fantastic as was room service. The room was kept very clean but I couldn't take a shower without getting the bathroom floor wet. The half shower door may be trendy but not real practical. In the evening the lobby lounge is always popular and you have to check out the "beach on the roof". Melissa and Josh at the front desk were very accommodating and really do have a "whatever/whenever" attitude.

Reviews.Title: “W San Diego Staff Rock!”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaV
Reviews.Content: I work in hotels and I have never before mentioned staff by name when checking out, nor have I ever logged onto Trip Advisor to write a review. On arriving at the W San Diego, we were met by Kacey who was was welcoming, polite, entertaining...she is a true asset to the W team. We dined in Rice and had a lovely server called Kimberley who made our experience even better. I really enjoyed my stay at the W, everyone was happy, smiley and helpful. even though we drove 5 hours there and back we felt refreshed. Thank you San Diego Team!

Reviews.Title: “MBA Conference”
Reviews.Author: MBAAtlanta
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very eclectic. It was a surprise. The music could be loud at times so if you are wanting to meet clients in the lobby - you will have to expect the music to be loud. The food is ok. If you ask for medium rare - you will get medium to well. Breakfast was really good but pricey. The location is not convienent to the convention center as you will need a rental car, taxi or the hotel has a car that can take you one-way but it is on a first-come first-serve basis. The staff is very friendly and they went over the top to help out with all meeting needs. The cleaning staff is excellent and very attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Top class service at a great hotel...they don't miss a beat!”
Reviews.Author: brklyn2la
Reviews.Content: I brought my boyfriend here for his 30th birthday and I wanted to do something special for him. Kacy Cooper and the rest of the staff decorated the room with everything that I wanted and boyfriend was so suprised. They made me look like "the best girlfriend ever"...lol. The staff is extremely friendly and has Whatever you need, Whenever you need. They truly mean that!

Reviews.Title: “warm and welcoming W Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NonGeekTechTraveler
Reviews.Content: just completed yet another wonderful stay at the W Hotel in San Diego. this stay was particularly memorable because of the exceptionally friendly and supportive staff at check-in and throughout my stay. somewhat disheveled from my travels, i was quickly decompressed as Melissa Humble greeted me, by name, as i entered the cool yet warm hotel lobby. and was presented with an upgrade to a suite (and in the morning was given complimentary coffee and OJ (since the room wasn't on my typically preferred high floor). Yes, treated like a rockstar! thank you Melissa, and the rest of the W staff.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Trendy-Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: travelhound60
Reviews.Content: Always very pleased with the W Hotels and the W experience of "Whatever, Whenever". Excellent customer service by all the staff. Beautiful rooms. Great outdoor bar on 2nd floor designed like a beach-with sand and heat lamps. Not in the Gas Lamp District, but only a few blocks away. Highly recommended. They upgraded us to a higher floor with no additional charge.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping ripped me off”
Reviews.Author: TheMayor73
Reviews.Content: I have been staying here since they opened at least once a year. I checked out this morning and realized I left my Maui Kim Sunglasses and a bottle of wine (gift) in my room. I called from the airport...and what a surprise "nothing left in your room." Well the hell with this. I have 2 more trips to San Diegon with clients/associates in the next six months. We'll stay somewhere else. Oddly enough they offered to replace the wine but not the Maui Jims. So they admit theft, just on a lesser scale.. I am the highest level Starwood and Platinum AmEx. I plan to share the good news.

Reviews.Title: “"W"elcoming and "W"onderful!”
Reviews.Author: papasandnic
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel! We wish we could have stayed longer. The W in San Diego went above and beyond for us. My husband and I were celebrating our 1 year wedding anniversary and decided to stay at the W. A wonderful chocolate cake with strawberries and a bottle of champagne accompanied with a "Happy Anniversary" note welcomed us in our room when we checked in. The concierge was always helpful and gave us great food recommendations. We had our anniversary dinner at Rice and was very very happy. We brought in a special bottle of champagne and they waived the corkage fee for us. The W in San Diego definitely delivered world class service and we would love to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Anniversary Ever... okay, it's only our first but still!”
Reviews.Author: 3spagals
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the most amazing and relaxing 24 hours at the W. My husband and I were married here (on the rooftop "beach") a year ago. I could write a whole separate 5 star review for that experience too!! We checked in and were upgraded to our same huge corner room that we had on our wedding night... so special! They had left an ice bucket of champagne and fresh strawberries in our room for our arrival. The room was huge and immaculate and filled with all of the cute clever little things that the W is famous for. Next we enjoyed the most amazing couples massage in our own private room that the spa had set up for us... with more complimentary champagne! We were having such a Wonderful time at the W that we didn't even want to leave for dinner so we ate downstairs at the restaurant "Rice". The service, decor and food were all outstanding. They even feature lots of gluten-free items on the menu for my gluten intolerant hubby! MORE free champagne was offered but this point we had to politely decline and they brought us a complimentary dessert instead. I can't say enough great things about this place. I was sad to leave, but will be back for sure... hopefully I don't have to wait until our 2nd anniversary! :)

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding, friendly staff; wish I could stay longer”
Reviews.Author: Seat11C
Reviews.Content: I'm a big Starwood fan and the W brand has taken their service lo a higher level. The W San Diego really delivers on the higher service without being stuffy or fake. I have stayed at all of the name brand hotels within walking distance of the convention and this is by far the best. Melissa at the front desk deserves special, honorable mention for going above and beyond in providing friendly, personable service!

Reviews.Title: “Sexy style and luxury... and pricey drinks!”
Reviews.Author: stacygirl_2000
Reviews.Content: I LOVE the W. Every one I've been to has been awesome, but this one was extra cool. They have awesome down beach-ball-shaped pillows on the beds, window benches, an awesome (and sorta reasonably priced) mini-bar, and they change the floor mats in the elevators 3 times a day so that they say "good morning", "good afternoon" and "good evening"... The roof bar "The Beach" is also amazing! Heating lamps, sand, comfy chairs, fire pits, and a $13 drink called the Porn Star that is worth every penny. And even though the drink IS pink... the guys in our group still loved them. And they are straight. If you want an amazing stay for a special occasion or just because, go here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place for Teens/Young Adults!!”
Reviews.Author: annishabell
Reviews.Content: I traveled to San Diego for the first time during the summer of 2009 with my church youth group. The W Hotel is the coolest place for Teens and Young Adults. The lobby has a contemporary style and has Techno music blasting all day long. There is a restaurant there called Rice that serves cool stuff. I had the pleasure of tasting Sexy Fries! They were really good. The pool is small, but there is a beach on the rooftop in which you can order anything off the menu as well. The hotel is awesome overall! I strongly recommend everyone to stay there at least once!!

Reviews.Title: “VERY pleased!”
Reviews.Author: sembugsa
Reviews.Content: This hotel met my every need. The service was great. Staff were very friendly. Stopped what they were doing happily to help me. The room was clean, chic, and comfortable. The bed was fabulous. Very comfortable! the lobby was very nice. The restaurant Rice was fab as well. Very trendy. Would very much recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully Wowed!”
Reviews.Author: theefroggster
Reviews.Content: My stay was fabulous! Thank you first to Gaby for helping me with the date changes etc for my original reservation. At check in, Melissa was just terrific. She made sure I had everything I needed. Melissa also was successful in getting me one extra night so I didn't have to change hotels during my visit to San Diego. Big "thank you" to her! My friends and I stayed for a week. We loved the hotel vibe and the proximity to shopping and great food! The W is an easy walk to the Gas Lamp District, Little Italy and Seaport Village. We loved ending the evenings at the Beach Bar or in the Living room. Room service was prompt and efficient! All the staff we ran into were friendly. Some of the staff members that helped make our stay exceptional were Kimberly and Ben at Rice....and Devon, Jeremy, Steven, Richard (Dickie) and Chris in the bars. Great people, fun times and fantastic conversation! We had an excelent time.Great hotel! Definitely recommend you check it out for yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Intimate, casual and chic with fantastic service to boot.”
Reviews.Author: Tusker500
Reviews.Content: What really made our trip memorable was the incredible service at the W San Diego. Melissa Humble at the welcome desk went out of her way to ensure my wife and I had everything we needed and more. She set us up with some freebies in the room (free internet, free clothes pressing, free local and 800 calls), several great restaurant recommendations as well as a round of drinks at the bar before we left for dinner. The strong service orientation extended to the bartender and valet/concierge. Everyone seemed to be on the same page and really made the experience enjoyable. We will go back to the W San Diego. Thanks Melissa!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel, and with great service”
Reviews.Author: KristinT01
Reviews.Content: We went down to San Diego for a wedding and wanted to stay downtown. The atmosphere of the hotel is very classy with great personal attention to each guest from the staff. The front desk manager who helped us, Kacy, was so friendly and helpful with anything we needed while getting ready to go to our event. Great location in the downtown area with transportation options to get you to the gaslamp area. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and place to hang out”
Reviews.Author: ravipatel1975
Reviews.Content: Good location in gaslamp district. Nightlife and downtown attractions readily accesible. Rooms are average, wish they were a little larger. Melissa Humble at reception was extremely helpful and knowledgable. Would stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in every way”
Reviews.Author: nate1879
Reviews.Content: Every single member of the staff was extraordinary. The hotel was in a convenient, if not mildly sketchy location, but easy to walk around. The room was comfortable, the bed comfortable, and the weather...although not part of the hotel, was great. I recommend this hotel, as always with W Hotels, to younger travelers. The bar poured great Martinis and the room service was prompt. By the second of four days in the hotel, everyone was greeting me by name...well, calling me Tennessee, which was funny and appropriate. I was craving junk food one evening, and they sent someone to Wendy's for me. They went all out to make my staff memorable. Likes: Everything Dislikes: I suppose $219 a night was a bit much Overall: The jetsetters will enjoy the place, the grandparents will have to remove their hearing aides.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Angeltau
Reviews.Content: IIf you are looking for a place to stay in San Diego look no more! The W is located near Little Italy a few blocks away from Extraordinary Dessert. Great Sunday brunch -Yum! The cab ride to the Gas Lamp bars and restaurants was only $5 so this should not deter you from staying here. The staff here is amazing. I needed to make last minute changes to my reservation and they accommodated my request without hesitation. Gabrielle Fisch was available by email to make sure that my stay was pleasant and to accommodate any request. I felt like I was staying at a beach cottage with all the amenities of a 5 star hotel. The night life is fun they have a couple of lounges and a DJ playing at night. I saw a group of girls celebrating a bachelorette party and they seemed to be having so much fun that I'm hoping to one day have my bachelorette party here. This was a perfect get-a-way from the busy city life of Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “"W"ow San Diego”
Reviews.Author: sestar78
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend night at W San Diego (9/26). Upon arrival, we were upgraded to a nice cool corner room (425sq). However, was told by the agent that our room was not ready (2:25pm) just yet unless we want a regular room which is ready for check in. Told him we wanted to wait in the living room (lobby) since its almost 3pm. He informed us that it might take longer than that and he told us that the guarantee check in time is at 3:30pm. He suggested to come back at 3:30pm or leave our phone number. He would call when the room is ready. Decided to leave my number. 45 mins passed and still no call. I decided to call the hotel and asked if our room is ready. Another front desk agent answered my call. After checking, she stated our room is ready. She apologized for not calling us because they had taken incorrect phone number. We headed back to hotel, checked in and claimed our luggage. Went straight to our room. Oops, the housekeeping still in the room stocking the mini bar. It was a little awkward. I absolutely loved the room. The view was great, awesome size bathroom with soaking tub and separate shower. The feather bed was very comfy. Went to the pool, although it is on the small side but its enjoyable. The only down side of the room is that when we were checking our room and noticed one of the decor piece(flower vase) in bathroom is full of trash and hair. We didnt bother to call housekeeping to remove or clean it. We used a towel and covered it. The location of the property is great. We used the complimentary ride to little Italy for dinner. Overall, the hotel meet my expectation. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel staff is the best!”
Reviews.Author: lolaWichita_Kansas
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the W Hotel in San Diego for a family weekend getaway. The staff at the hotel were fantastic! Every single encounter we had with a staff person was positive. They were all professional, cheerful and helpful. They really understand hospitality! In addition, the hotel has a fun vibe and very cool decor. We loved it. The kids loved it. Food was good, cocktails were yummy and we'd go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Whatever - Whenever”
Reviews.Author: Mscalifox
Reviews.Content: The level of service, willingness to serve and hospitality in this hotel is superb. To top this, the hotel is amazingly beautiful and well-kept. If you want the time of your life stay at the W Hotel. 100% recommended especially for the younger crowd that enjoys partying!!!

Reviews.Title: “This W has incredible service and was a great experience”
Reviews.Author: WDarlin844
Reviews.Content: From checkin to checkout we were greeted by friendly smiling staff that were always helpful and this includes everyone from front desk , valet and cleaning staff . The rooms were clean and beds very comfortable. The workout room is great, the lobby area has free coffee and newspapers. The pool is nice but limited-only about 6 lounge chairs. A glass of wine was a little pricy at the lobby bar. I read other reviews saying the gaslamp district is not close. Its certainly walkable if your not lazy. Little Italy with all its great food is walking distance also. If you want to go to the Zoo or travel to the airport, you can take the city bus for only $2.25 each way or buy a day pass for unlimited travel for $5.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel; decent location”
Reviews.Author: LAXregular
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at the W San Diego and it was a nice surprise. The staff was very welcoming and made us feel right at home. We wish that there was a better pool to relax by. There was the 'beach' but this had limited lounge seating and was not as relaxing as we hoped. It was about a 10 minute walk from the Gas Lamp district. Wished it was a few blocks closer, but it was not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “W is for Wow”
Reviews.Author: SoCalMel09
Reviews.Content: What a great experience start to finish! Valet/Bell Staff greeting was prompt, friendly, and efficient upon arrival with more of the same throughout our weekend stay. Check-in...a breeze with wonderful service with plenty of smiles, warmth and great tips on where to go for food and fun. The room was awesome! A two-room suite with peek-a-boo views of the marina, plus downtown San Diego skyline and at night...the twinkling lights are amazing while nestled in one of the cozy window seats. A quick and easy stroll took us to yummy dining in Little Italy and when we were too lazy to walk, a complimentary Acura shuttle service whisked us away in style. Saturday afternoon at Beach-the rooftop bar with sand under my toes, a dj spinning tunes, and drink specials galore was the quintessential SoCal experience. Overall...the W San Diego wowed me! I'll definitely return and think you should too!

Reviews.Title: “W Worked”
Reviews.Author: TexasBrowns
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights with family of four, including two teens. Picked W as thought teens would like the vibe and price was half of Hard Rock Hotel. They did like but hotel access geared toward 21+in the evening (ex. beach club). Double beds were very comfortable but tight floor plan for four with luggage. Window seat became the overflow bed. Not impressed with breakfast at Rice - $10 for bland bowl of oatmeal and slow service. Reasonable walk to LIttle Italy, USS Midway and Maritime Museum but also to Police/Fire Stations (no opening the window - noisy all night) and Courthouse/Jail. Mile plus walk to core Gaslamp District though trolley would have shortened. Can see why the location helped force investment group to default on mortgage in June.

Reviews.Title: “"W" is for Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Juan_in_CSL
Reviews.Content: Having had the pleasure to be a guest at the W in San Francisco and W in Mexico City, of the three I can honestly say that the W in San Diego Rocks! I travel to San Diego at least 6-8 times a year. I have stayed in other comparable properties in downtown San Diego and whenever I can find a room at the W San Diego I book it. I know that the service and quality will always be to up the same excellent standards. To start off the location is excellent. The W San Diego is on a quiet street. You are close to the marina, downtown and little italy, my favorite spot. So wherever you have to go walking, its not too far away. And if you happen to be driving its just so much easier to get in and out of downtown traffic than the other hotels iaround the Gaslamp Quarter and Petco Park. The downtown area is so vibrant at night and can be very crowded to get around by car. As a native San Diegan, I had stayed in other hotels in downtown and the W San Diego I have always considered my home in San Diego. I enjoy coming back to San Diego and I always seem to have a wonderful time in when I am back. The W San Diego plays a great part in making this happen. Thank you W San Diego staff for always making my stays so pleasant and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “baby moon in corner room”
Reviews.Author: KJSONIT
Reviews.Content: had a wonderfully relaxing stay in a corner room at the W. Everyone was great, almost. It's Whatever, Whenever, unless Hector answers your call. We had to call back several times anytime we called to ask for anything from him, but everything else was great. The room service food didn't look great on the menu, but was totally delish! FOR SURE get the Churros and chocolate sauce. Yummy!

Reviews.Title: “Don't be swayed by any negative reviews -- the W is a relaxing homebase”
Reviews.Author: chethummel
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice spot to call home while you explore San Diego (what a great town!). Weekday happy-hour bar prices are extremely reasonable. The Fitness center was small, but never overcrowded, and the equipment is high-quality. The pool is a bit of a joke, but the water is every bit as wet as the stuff they have at the Hyatt. And as far as decibel level goes, maybe the place turns into party-town on weekends, but weekdays had a very mellow vibe with a nice soundtrack. There's no need to get pinched at the valet parking costs. If you're gonna park your car and never leave, $20 lots are superclose. If you're gonna be gone all day sitghseeing, plentiful street parking is free from 6pm to 8am and about a buck an hour after that – with a 2 hour maximum. I think I spent $6 on parking the four days I was there. Bring quarters. You can easily walk to the gaslamp for cocktails or little itally for a quality pie. Sea World and beaches are about 5/10 mins away. And while it's true that the rooms are on the small side, my family of four fit fine -- with no complaints from anyone. The kids were evidently too busy playing Wii or charging their iPods. For the price I paid on Hotwire, this place was a bonafide steal. I'd pay double. Kudos to the W staff.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary, good service, but not my scene...”
Reviews.Author: beachcomberlady
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the W on an anniversary trip this summer. It was contemporary, and unique; however, the bar scene wasn't quite our style. We got a good deal off of Priceline, and found parking down the block cheaper than the valet parking, so I can't complain. I asked the staff for a quiet room, since the music was extremely loud upon entering the hotel...our room was on the 9th floor and very quiet! All in all, the W was not my idea of a 4 star hotel (compared to the Hyatt Manchester Grande that we got on Priceline the year before for the same price!)

Reviews.Title: “one word describes it all...."amazing"”
Reviews.Author: forreststrom
Reviews.Content: I couldn't even find the entrance at first even as i approached the front door. It was like nothing i've ever seen before. I thought it was a club at first but when i didn't see any people inside i figured it was it . The music was nice and the atmosphere felt cool. There was a lot of younger people (20'30's ) just relaxing in the lobby having conversation over some drinks . I've never really seen a lobby with so much action before, it was really cool to see. The nightlife there was great and it was only a wednesday.. The room was amazingly cozzy and reminded me a lot of europe. I'm not exactly sure why but it felt great. Oh and the bed was most comfortable bed i've ever slept on. WOW.. Room service was on time , and the min bar was stacked for us to enjoy . and After our night out at the clubs it was perfect to come home to the BEACH BAR located on the roof to continue the party.. The bartenders were really on it all night.. This beach bar alone made it all worth while . Relaxing on the roof with your drink , listening to some pretty Cool music while gazing at the beautiful San Diego skyline .. iT was AMAZING .. i couldn't have asked for a cooler more relaxing stay ..

Reviews.Title: “very nice...”
Reviews.Author: Baldgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Hotel and was very pleased and impressed upon arrival....very hip, very stylish... we almost felt a little old for the crowd we saw. The staff was very nice and helpful, explaining the different rooms, bars, and hang out areas located in the hotel. The location of the hotel makes the valet parking not the most desirable, as it is located on the corner of a two way and adjacent one way street; however, we didn't have to wait long and they accommodated us immediately. The valet parking at $32 per night was quite steep, but it is located in the heart of downtown. We stayed in the Cool Corner room and yes, it was quite cool... Overall a really nice stay for a not so far get away location.

Reviews.Title: “Stolen Luggage/ Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: ratfink100
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that the room I stayed in was top notch and very comfortable/clean. Upon arriving the staff was extremely helpful and cheerful. The disaster started once my family and I were trying to leave. Because our train did not leave until 4pm, we checked out of our room at 12pm and left them with the baggage department at the hotel so that we could enjoy San Diego for the afternoon and then come back to pick them up before our train departed. We handed our three bags to a staff member and received three tags. When we returned at 315 to collect our bags, we handed the three tags to the staff member who returned with only two bags. Naturally, the missing bag was the one with my work laptop. Despite numerous efforts of the staff members to locate the lost bag they could not find it. I myself went into the poorly organized luggage room and could not locate it. We spent half an hour trying to find the lost luggage and had to leave so that we could catch our train. What is particularly interesting about this situation is that there was a gentlemen in front of me who was going through the exact same problem and had to leave as well to catch the 4pm train. He was missing a bag with his laptop as well. I gave the hotel my information and left on the train. That night I called the hotel to see if there was an update and was advised to file a police report. For the first three days the management staff was excellent about updating me with news on this situation but then they seriously dropped the ball after that. It has been a week since this incident has happened and I have not heard from management in three days on how they plan to fix this. Think about how losing your business laptop would effect your work and consider this before you decide to stay in a hotel that has a theft issue.

Reviews.Title: “W is not hospitable or comfortable for the money you pay”
Reviews.Author: Klimt007
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W for a family business trip. We were put in a very small room but for some reason called a "wonderful" room on the 9th floor. The Hallway floor stank something awful at night. The hall smelled like a sewage pipe had just busted and spilled on the hallway. During the day I tried to take my 8 year old to the small pool and there appeared to be a “Private event” going on so we weren’t able to use the pool. We then went up to the “beach” which is actually a lounge area and try to read a book on the sand, there was also a private event going on up there. A yoga party was going on though we weren’t asked to leave, the uber cool yoga participants were looking at me and my child as though we had just fallen from outer of space. They had takes over every inch of the lounge and so we had not choice but to leave. I called the front desk to inquire and they simply told me that they had some private events going on that day. Simple as that, no apology nothing. I reminded the W that we were paying guests, at full rate and their reply simply was “the events will be over by …” rude and callous. When we returned to our hotel at night (Friday) we were stopped by a large burly bouncer and asked to produce a key in order to enter. Now, I remind you that we had a little 8 year old child with us. Nonetheless, the bouncer treated us as though we were trying to crash an exclusive red carpet event. Not to mention that we couldn't go to sleep that night due to the banging club scente going on in the lobby, lound and clear all the way on the 9th flooor. Unbelievable. Not staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel, but too cool for us”
Reviews.Author: VKT
Reviews.Content: Whether or not you enjoy the W will come down to your personal style. We can see that some people would absolutely LOVE this place. We were not two of those people, but we got an excellent priceline name your own price, which made it worth it to us. More detail: we are a couple, aged 49 and 40, professional, not stuffy, but neither of us drinks or parties much. (If you like the idea of drinking so much you end up spending $800 a night on a bar tab with a couple of friends, this is the place for you! Each of the three mornings we ate in the restaurant, EACH of the parties around us talked of nothing else but their drinking, how to get more drinks, where to go for drinks, how much they spent on drinks, what their favorite drink is, etc.) If you like Very Loud music--club music--you will love the beach and the bar at night. We wore earplugs and still it was louder than Burning Man. (If you have been there, you know what we mean.) Others there seemed to be enjoying it, though. We thought the design of the hotel was impressive--more my husband's style than mine (it is very modern and masculine--that is, hard surfaces, chrome, glass, monochromatic with a splash of blue). I felt uncomfortable walking across the lobby--it just feels empty, and I don't mean that literally--and, as others have mentioned, Very Uncomfortable in the elevators. They are very dim, chrome, claustrophobic, and you need to insert a key in order for them to work, so you are standing there with the door closed waiting to do that in this strange metal container. We liked our room; yes, we also got water all over the floor in the bathroom while taking a shower no matter what we did, and thought it strange that there was no bathtub. But again, it seems the W was built for masculine men and women who probably don't like to take baths. :0) The soaps, etc., were replenished (Bliss) and we loved them. We had a great housekeeper. The room was spotless. Anything above the 4th floor and on the opposite side of the hotel from the beach is quiet; our room was quiet with windows that open a little for air. We thought Rice had really good food, and enjoyed the happy hour 1/2 price food in the bar during the weekday afternoons (the cheese plate was excellent, as were the fries). The playful names of dishes on the menu were a nice touch. The gym and pool are ridiculously small, though, for a 4 star hotel. I've stayed in some hotels where the hot tub is as big as this pool. None of this is the current management's fault--most of our complaints are really design issues, but they do have a big impact when you are staying somewhere for several nights on vacation. The location was great for us--walking distance to the ferry, Gaslamp, Little Italy, and a few minutes' drive to Balboa Park. Service was excellent, with the exception of one bartender who was a little bit condescending, but otherwise, everyone else was polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better!”
Reviews.Author: CH_Traveller_9
Reviews.Content: Seeing some of the reviews, i can not imagine that we stayied in the same hotel. We got a good online deal and our experience couldn't have been better. The staff was very friendly and helpful and i'm sure they would have done everything to make it up to us if something wasn't perfect. The room was modern, fresh and very clean. The setting was nice and inovative. The bed was very comfortable and we felt like home. The rooms were made every day and we were provided with plenty of towles, soaps, etc. If you use the same soap bar for 4 days to shower and wash your hands without complaining directly to the staff but come and complain on tripadvisor, i think the problem lies not with the hotel. Anyway the location of the hotel was great and i would stay immediately there again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotel experiences ever”
Reviews.Author: ATL_Pool_Girl
Reviews.Content: For the money, this should have been a near-perfect experience. It was very, very far from perfect. I encountered many maintainence and cleanliness issues during my 4-night stay at the W. The staff put on a show of caring about these issues, but I did not feel that they were being genuine. Here's what they did right... - The hotel is very hip and trendy. They obviously put a lot of thought and effort into the decor. But, they will need to renovate every few years to keep up with the super-trendiness. - The location is good. You are within walking distance of pretty much everything in downtown San Diego. The only time I used a cab was to get to and from the airport. Apparently, they have a car service??? I was not made aware of this during my stay. - Room service was friendly and prompt, but a little on the pricey side. But, hey, it's room service. It's a luxury. Here's what they did wrong... - I had a huge issue with the cleanliness of my room (too disgusting to mention here) during my first night. I can deal with a lot of things, but this was truly gross. I asked to be moved to a different room, but they said they were full. They promised to change the bedding and sanitize the room. They also promised to add 5000 Starwood points to my account. When I returned to my room later in the day, the bedding had indeed been changed, the carpet seemed to have been cleaned, and there was a bottle of wine with an apology note on my desk. But, as of today, they still have not added the points to my account. This whole ordeal made me take a closer look at everything in my room and I noticed a lot of things that were wrong. - The cordless phone and one of my bedside lamps did not work. I told management about it and they were fixed. - The backsplash on the bathroom sink remained dirty for my entire stay. - One of the slats on the window blinds was broken. - I had a rug in the bathroom for the first day. This was taken away and not replaced for the rest of my stay. - I had to ask for washcloths on the second day. There were none left by the maid. - There was one bar of soap that I transferred between the sink and the shower for my entire stay. - Cigarette burns on the carpet of a non-smoking room. - The toilet would run intermittently throughout the day and night. - There is no door on the shower. The setup looks cool, but it's not practical. I had to wipe a puddle of water off the floor after every shower. - I was overcharged for a beer I ordered with my room service meal. - There is no newspaper. I actually enjoy reading the USA Today that most hotels provide free of charge. - There was a moldy smell in the hallway. It must have been in my room too. I didn't notice it while I was there, but my clothes all smelled like it when I got home and unpacked. - The pool and gym are teeny-tiny. - The side of my nightstand had some kind of grime crusted on one corner. I realize that some of my complaints are nit-picky, and most of these are things that I would normally overlook. But... When you're paying what amounts to be a car payment for each night, every detail should be attended to. Granted, most of these issues probably could have been handled with a phone call to the front desk. But, frankly, I just didn't want to deal with the elitist attitude I got from some of the FOH staff. I am in the service industry (restaurants, not hotels) and I would not have tolerated any of this from my staff. Of course, the initial blame should land upon the staff who fail to do their jobs correctly. But, ultimately, it is management's fault for letting things go. I've read some of the other reviews on this site and it seems that mine was not an isolated incident.

Reviews.Title: “Would have been good...”
Reviews.Author: NYTravelingAddict
Reviews.Content: Well, we were turned away when we tried to check in because they said they were full. Funny, seeing as how we were charged in full already. Long story short, we were incredulous but they made it up to us the next day when we came back for the rest of our stay. We had an amazing, clean, large room and enjoyed the time that we did spend at the W. I have to say though, that I'm not likely to stay at any W hotel again based on our initial experience. This was the first, and last time for me.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great”
Reviews.Author: aperry79
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the day after I got engaged and was expecting an amazing experience after staying at the W in LA the night before. It was not that good. They said they were upgrading our room which did not seem like any kind of an upgrade. I wanted to get a manicure to match my new shiny ring and the spa experience was TERRIBLE! A $40 manicure which should have been $10. The whole experience was about 15-20 minutes and was not even a manicure station. I felt like my friend was giving me one in a tiny room at my house. I spoke to the manager and he gave me some tealights to compensate??? Not sure how that helped. After sending a review to the GM he reimbursed me which was nice but it shouldn't be that hard. The drinks were over priced for what you got. Breakfast was not even that great, not much to choose from on the menu. I got toast.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience of my life - awful service”
Reviews.Author: vegas_star
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights on the night that I got engaged and the staff at this W hotel ruined our special evening!!!!!!!!!!!! We were given an attractive room on the 1st/2nd floor. It was incredibly noisy and we could hear the bar downstairs, it also didn't have a safe in the room . I called to reception to ask to be moved and they said there were no rooms available. Disappointed, we accepted it and went on to try and enjoy our stay. I went for a shower in the bathroom and the water was boiling hot, I couldn't stand in it. They called an engineer. We waitied in the hotel room for an hour for the engineer to arrive. They fix it and I went back to my shower. A few minutes later the shower dial falls off the wall and I can't turn the water off...the water returns to boiling hot temperatures and I am scaleded with shampoo still in my hair. At this point, my fiance to be and I go to reception...close to tears at just how awful the experience has been so far. They credit my room with $50 for food (which covered the overpriced breakfast) and say an engineer will be up again. This is not how we want to spend the rest of our day, waiting for engineers! It is only when I get so upset that I am in tears (with my soaking wet hair dripping in reception) that the manager offers to move rooms, why should it have to get to this point for them to correct their faults! The service is just so bad. They move us to a SMALLER room. I am just so glad to have moved that I accept it. Meanwhile my fiance is devastated because he picked the W as a supposedly nice hotel for our engagement night. The day so far has been terrible. As far as Im concerned $50 credit is no where near enough compensation for such poor customer service and terrible room quality! They should have provided a refund. AVOID THIS HOTEL AT ALL COSTS. It may look TRENDY downstairs but the ROOMS aren't all that special and are FALLING APART!

Reviews.Title: “Top notch”
Reviews.Author: mauriciok
Reviews.Content: I was afraid to stay at W with 2 babies, when I arrived at front desk, the wonderful lady and front desk manager, listened to my request of more space for my family since rooms are usually a little smaller. They accomodated my request way beyond any means expected. The service from this hotel top notch whether it is the valet, porters, the front desk or the operators. stay here you will never regret it. I stayed at the US GRant and the Manchester Hyatt and this would probably be my first choice

Reviews.Title: “W hotel is Good”
Reviews.Author: Nolababe
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the W hotel San Diego for a leiesurely weekend getaway, and the valet parking fellow was extremely friendly and warm. Check in was smooth, although our original room on the 18th floor with the ocean view had a door issue, so they gave us a different room with a city view instead (a downgrade in my opinion). We found the rooms to be very nice and the bed's to be very comfy. Our problem was that although there was the basic shampoo, conditioner, soap and lotion, there were no shower caps, and no q tips, however, they very swiftly provided these things for us. Also, there was a coffee maker with coffee in the room , there was no cream and no sugar and no tea bags. Since we drink tea, we called for tea bags, and very shortly later a lady brought tea bags, with ceramic cups and boiled water and honey and it was the tea works, all complimentary! This was great and it really impressed us. They let us check at at 1 pm instead of noon, which was really nice. Check out was speedy and the valet fellow was a different guy, who was also super friendly and charming. Overall, we had a good stay. The W staff is realy friendly and helpful. The only con to this hotel is that it is a good 10 minute walk to the heart of the Gaslamp district.

Reviews.Title: “Great service.”
Reviews.Author: DavidandKim
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W for 2 nights before moving to another hotel for a convention. The service was excellent. We decided at the last minute we wanted to rent a car and the conceirge arranged one and it was delivered within 20 minutes and was only $55.00 for the day. They were extremely helpful. We went to the Gaslamp district for dinner and it is a short walk. We are active people though-it is maybe 5-6 blocks. If you are looking to hang out in the gaslamp district, you may want to pick a hotel that is a little closer. We were only there for 2 nights and didn't use the pool or the exercise room. We ran from the hotel and the front desk mapped out a good route for us. We did come back on Friday night and it was like a club in the lobby, loud music and dancing. It is a very good place for the younger crowd.

Reviews.Title: “The service is there, but the decor needs some attention”
Reviews.Author: CSwan
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at W Hotels in NYC and SF, and the San Diego W is on par with staff friendliness, overall vibe and comfort, but the decor in the rooms needs some attention (at least in the room in which I stayed). The desk was chipped and in need of a new coat of paint. It actually looked like a high school wood shop project and should probably just be scrapped for something a little sleeker and more in line with the rest of the W furniture. Carpeting needs replacing as it looked a little worn. Other than those two items, I enjoyed my stay. Excellent bed. Cool bar on the a mezzanine roof area. It's called Beach and covered in sand. The hotel is downtown in a decent location, but if you are walking around at night, you may come across some interesting characters as it is two blocks from the county jail. I'd stay there again, because I enjoy the overall experience at W hotels, but the San Diego W needs a little more attention Starwood.

Reviews.Title: “Was very happy with my stay at the W”
Reviews.Author: jaime4692
Reviews.Content: I checked into the W early and no problems getting my room at 11 a.m. The check-in lady was very nice and it all went smoothly. My room was very comfortable. Great bed, nice bathroom and everything was clean and modern. The W tries (and succeeds) at making everything cool and they really are able to pull it off well. Before I had arrived, I was a little skeptical wondering if I was going into an 'IKEA' type of a place. Not at all! Had breakfast at Rice and again the service was great and the food was wonderful. Looked around at the pool and spa on the second floor and thought they were both beautiful. Took advantage of their complimentary Acura SUV service which gave me a ride to the Gas Lamp district where we had great Thai food at a restaurant called Rama. The concierge had arraned that! All in all, a definite good place and I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “While many of the reviews were negative we liked the W”
Reviews.Author: george91206
Reviews.Content: Considering that the W had mixed reviews we were reluctant to stay, but since we were using Starwood points and only staying one night, how bad could it be? We were surprised: the staff was friendly, the location was good, and the room was clean and well maintained. The room was not large, but it was bigger then my first apartment. The view was not great. The gym needs help, just tredmills and free weights. They could remove a couple of the tredmills and replace them with universal machines. When we left the front desk staff offered us coffee for the road. A nice touch. We had a good time and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Probablt wouldn't stay here again - especially with family”
Reviews.Author: sgh4ra
Reviews.Content: Traveled to SD for my teenaged daughters to participate in sports tournaments. Stayed at the hotel from Saturday morning to Sunday. Unlike the other reviews - I must say that the staff was overly friendly. Everyone introduced themself by name and genuinely seemed to want to make me happy. The desk clerk even recommended a great choice in restaurant for us on Saturday night. My criticism of the hotel is as follows: 1. The lighting (lobby, elevator, room) is dim everywhere; 2. The hotel room was small, the bathroom was really not up to the standard of a nice hotel, and the room was showing signs of wear (chipped paint, spots on walls and carpet, dirty room service menu); 3. The walls to the hotel were very thin and you could here everything from the next door room, thankfully we were on a corner and had only one shared wall; 4. The hotel turns into a nightclub, at least on Saturday, and besides having to walk back through the lobby with men ogling my rather pretty (in my humble opinion) teenager girls, the thump thump thump of the blaring music kept us up late into the night - and our room was on the 13th floor. FINALLY, 5. The room had a overly strong fragrance that I couldn't figure out -- it wasn't unpleasant, just like too much air freshener. We even opened the windows to try and dissipate the smell. Only later did I put two and two together -- when I came out of the elevator on my way to the room and ran smack dab into a woman with her bulldog. I would never have stayed here had I known that the property allows pets and the thought that I was in a room in which someone had their dog was disconcerting.

Reviews.Title: “Had a reservation. They didn't have room for me.”
Reviews.Author: edwo2
Reviews.Content: I travelled across the country for my first vacation with my young son. Made reservations well ahead of time and when I got there, they informed me there was not a room available. And yes, they did have my reservation.

Reviews.Title: “rooms average, and extreamly rude staff”
Reviews.Author: craigory456
Reviews.Content: i thought the hotel was a nice place when i walked through the door a fashion show was going on and i thought how cool is this it has a real club theme going on in the lobby the only problem w that is every time i came to my hotel to go to my room i payed for i would here can i see you room key by the same people who had just asked me not even a few hrs before and i dont expect every person i meet to remember me but i just felt like i was really being hassled by the staff, oh and the guy at the bar asked me to see my id ( im 23 so im cool with being carded) but when i pulled it out he saw my passport card and was like give me both ids i saw that you had two and i know how you kids are you have one id for the bar and one for everything else and in my eyes that is just rude for him to assume that im trying to use a fake id- final thoughts: dont stay here if you want a nice room the room is extremely average i have stayed at a days inn in flagstaff and it was very similar except it was only $40 so rude staff and ok rooms, not worth it and im not trying to be rude but i just dont want anyone to feel like i did

Reviews.Title: “over-rated - plenty of better places in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: aussielivingintheUSA
Reviews.Content: As a Starwood Platinum Member I normally love W Hotels. This time was not the case. I was not a big fan the first time I stayed here 6 months ago but thought I would give it one more try - a mistake. This hotel is a) not central b) extremely small c) has rude and minimal staff. Valet Parking is $32 and we waited 15 mins just to park. There is not enough staff (waited 25mins for our bags, waited 15 mins to check in). The hotel is also not at all central - I would stay at a lot of other hotels over the W in San Diego - The new Marriott in Gas Lamp, The Ivy or US Grant. Dont pay the top dollars W ask - you will get nothing in return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in an amazing city...”
Reviews.Author: RandT3
Reviews.Content: I was fortunate enough to get a great rate from Starwood for this property during my trip to San Diego for an industry conference. I've always enjoyed the W brand, and this hotel certainly did not dissappoint. The property was a short walk to the convention center and Gas Lamp district. Cabs were readily available, and an abundance of cheap parking lots surrounded the hotel. This saved us the $30+ per night in valet fees for our rental car. The lobby is very modern and chic, but the internet was average at best. Worse still, the rooms only offered wired internet. Why do hotels still insist on charging for internet!?!?!?!?!? I know it is a huge revenue stream, but c'mon, it's robbery! Believe it or not, the wi-fi I stole from the rooftop "Beach" bar was better than anything else I had encountered in the property. It was, however, a nice touch for the managers to roll out the Wii system for happy hour in the lobby. We did breakfast in the restaurant a few times and suffered through very slow service. The food was excellent, and our server tried his best, but the wait killed the experience. On our last night, we came back to the hotel and attended a party hosted by some of our colleagues. The W staff was attentive and entertaining, and they did a great job transforming the venue into a very upscale night club. Overall, the W is a great brand that caters to a young, affluent crowd. I book my stays there knowing that I can expect excellent service in a dynamic and chic setting. I look forward to coming back to this property as soon as I can.

Reviews.Title: “Too cool for school”
Reviews.Author: salbolt
Reviews.Content: The W San Diego was the first W Hotel I ever stayed at, and although it is a very well designed hotel I didn't feel entirely welcome or comfortable during my stay. I booked on a government rate and was interrogated at check-in despite having government ID. Maybe this led to the feeling that I didn't quite belong in this hotel. My room was very nicely furnished, although showing a little bit of wear. The location is great if you are arriving by Amtrak and taking the trolley car to get around. Otherwise, I would have preferred to have stayed closer to the Gaslamp Quarter. Next time I'm in San Diego I will probably try the Hotel Solamar in the Gaslamp Quarter, which looks like it is well designed, but hopefully with less attitude than the W.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the W”
Reviews.Author: Flightsocks
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W for 2 nights in September 08. Very friendly staff (and all very good looking!). The lobby and bar area in the lobby are cool and trendy - comfy areas for relaxing. The beach bar on the roof was probably the coolest bar in town but needs a bit of a freshen up. The seating is looking a bit worn. But still a nice setting for a drink. We stayed in a double queen room. As usual the starwood heavenly beds are really comfy. The room was trendy and the bathroom has Bliss products. The room was a bit cramped - not much room to manouvre around the beds but fine for good sleep. The area is within walking distance to the gaslamp district and ferries and train station. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Vibe!”
Reviews.Author: reb1980
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W for our anniversary trip and aboslutely loved it. It was my first time staying there so I wasn't sure what to expect. Our room had a great modern design and color scheme to it. During our stay, they were offering a discount on all there spa packages. We took advantage of this and booked a couple's massage. The only drawback is that there is no actual spa. They use a converted hotel room to do the massage. The couple's massage was wonderful and the hotel even provided a complimentary bottel of champagne afterwards. The location of this hotel is great. It is within walking distance from the Gas Lamp district, although at night I would recomend taking a taxi. For those of you planning your flight, check out prices through LAX. We booked round trip through Los Angelos instead of San Diego and saved about $500 all together. We spent about $150 on a car rental for the week and just drove to San Diego. We didn't mind the driving and took the Pacific Coast Highway back to LA at the end of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: NYPhotogirl
Reviews.Content: We moved to the W Hotel after our stay at the Ivy went sour after one night - it was a great hotel but FAR too noisy at night. The W did not disappoint. The staff was courteous, friendly and very helpful. In particular, Hector the concierge was fantastic. He made us feel like rock stars and had terrific recommendations for everything. The room was very nice, well-stocked and clean. The bed linens were super-soft and comfortable. The hotel is well-located and it's restaurants serve delicious food. The "Wherever/Whenever" service is a big bonus and we made sure to utilize it whenever necessary. If I have any complaint it's that the walls of the hotel room were a little thin (we clearly heard our neighbors talking), but at night we were able to sleep perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Disorganised”
Reviews.Author: worldtraeller
Reviews.Content: The general feel of the hotel is 'fun and hip' with a lot of colour and dark lighting to create a night-club feel to it. The quality is typical of higher end Starwood hotels. The rooms were very good and included an iPod music system which I always appreciate. The shower is one of those impractical designs where the water ends up all over the bathroom floor; it looks trendy but what a dumb idea. The restaurant is excellent and there is a night-club in the building which had very classy clientele and appeared to be very popular. I arrived at the check-in area which shares space with a bar with very loud music (on a Friday night). The check-in took about 40 minutes. The staff seemed to take an enormous amount of time with each guest as they chatted away while other people were standing in line. Rooms were not ready even at 6pm. There were a few disgruntled travelers waiting for a room and becoming short with the staff. The loud music also made it very difficult to communicate with the reception staff. It was very important that I had 4pm late-checkout the next day and I was told it was no problem because there were plenty of rooms. However, the next day, I was disturbed no less than 5 times via door knocks and phone calls as to why I hadn't checked out. Check-out took about 20 minutes because the receptionist could not work out how to add a mini-bar charge to the bill. Eventually she disappeared into the back-office and 10 minutes later another appeared and I had to start all over again; the first one decided it was simply too hard and gave up! The second receptionist apologised and said #1 should never have been at the front-desk because she was not trained. The hotel has a 'hip' and 'anything is ok' attitude but they really should just hide their beads and get the job done rather than trying to live up to a 'fun' brand. Even the 'concierge' couldn't seem to arrange a taxi, and instead stood on the corner trying to wave one over. I ended up doing it myself. If you are after a fun, laid back style of premium hotel and have time to spare, it's a good choice. If you are looking for a slick, efficient hotel, there are better choices.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with some drawbacks...”
Reviews.Author: mjogg11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W San Diego from Nov. 14-16. Overall I was happy with my experience there. The lobby, or living room, is a little small, but nicely decorated with a young, cool feel to it. The rooms are small also, but are decorated in a unique way. The bed was very comfortable. The shower is a little strange. Like other W hotels I have stayed at there is a half glass wall instead of a shower curtain. This can lead to a messy situation. Also, there was a frosted glass window in the sliding bathroom door. A bit uncomfortable for people who might not want their opaque shape seen as they use the bathroom. The gym was really small. I believe there were 3 treadmills, 3 ellipticals, a few free weights, and some yoga mats. The pool was beautiful and entirely outside on the second floor. The beach bar was probably the best. The bar sits outside on the 2nd floor and has heated sand and various comfortable seats and benches to sit on. Overall, I liked this hotel. Yes, it is a little different but once you get used to the W style it is quite entertaining.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the W”
Reviews.Author: TMW30338
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed staying at The W Hotel in San Diego. The staff was extremely helpful, courteous, and professional. Efficient check-in. Utterly gracious conciege staff. The rooms were small but very clean and well appointed. The location of the hotel suited us as well.

Reviews.Title: “There Was...More To Be Desired”
Reviews.Author: david_e22
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at "W's before, and I will continue to stay at them, but, this "W" is super small. I liked the decor of the rooms, although a bit small, I guess I can't complain for $89 a night. The "Rice" resturant was really good. Although, they don't serve any kind of rice. Which, seemed a bit odd. But, whatev! Overall, IIt was a good stay

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: g1wzwnd
Reviews.Content: After staying in W New York, I had some expectations of the W in San Diego. The location is good but not perfect so you have a few blocks to walk to get to the Gas Lamp District. No problem here since the city is safe and you have the "bike" taxis that can take you there. The parking sucks at $28 a day but if you are not lazy drive to Broadway, turn right and go towards the water where parking is $18 for 24 hours but if you can afford the W you should be able to pay for valet. Internet is not free and this part sucks badly. Just like in the NY W nobody wants to clean the room service trays sitting outside doors. Now the good stuff, the staff is friendly and available, the rooms are nice but on the small side, the bed, pillows and covers are perfect and if you like to shower you will take 3 showers a day like I did. Plasma TV with plenty of premium channels and good toiletries. The pool is very, very small and the bar on the second floor is great to hang out and enjoy the outdoors. Enjoy your stay

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful decor, modern, and very young crowd”
Reviews.Author: bilpac7
Reviews.Content: We arrived late but were pleasantly surprised on how nice the room is, with a large flat screen TV, IPOD dock right next to bed, window seat was very nice, nice bathroom but water from shower sprayed all over floor in bathroom since there is no shower curtain because that would not be "cool" enough. We walked up to the Beach which is the sand covered bar for a nightcap, spent 19 dollars on two drinks, and enjoyed the firepits and comfy seating. The staff was very helpful in lobby being that is was still hoppin at midnight on a Wednesday. View was nothing to brag about at all but an overall good hotel in a good part of town with a good staff. Starbucks downstairs in lobby was a plus come morning time as well. I would definetly recommend this hotel, especially the 20-30 y/o crowd but elderly couples may find a bit brash. Very nice place though!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Very fun place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: mhshlb
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a weekend and it was a great experience. Friendly, helpful staff and clean rooms. This hotel is very cool and has a young hip vibe. The rooms are on the small side but well worth it as they are decorated nicely and very clean. The beach bar upstairs is a fun place to hang out at night. The location is within walking distance to lots of downtown nightlife (or if you don't want to walk you can catch a trolley just a few blocks away). I had a great time and am planning to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Worth it if you get a good rate”
Reviews.Author: Ben_melb
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with fun room design and lots of little gimmicks inside. The beach bar is great to hang out in and the gym was not bad. The location is so-so, it's not really near anything - didn't even appear to be near many office buildings, just surrounded by carparks. We got a good deal on a corporate rate plan and it was definitely worth it for that price $285 plus tax. But I would not pay their full price or the expedia type prices ($500-$650!?). What sets a 5 star hotel apart from a good 4 star hotel is supposed to be the service. While the service here was adequate, I was not blown away. Valet attendants and receptionists could be loud and distracted. Service was far too matter-of-fact for my taste, I expect it to feel personal in a hotel of this calibre. The bed was amazing. I fell asleep in seconds and didn't wake up all night every night, which is very unusual for me. I am still blown away by the comfort of this bed and the whole design of the room inside was really nice with fun colours, lots of pillows/cushions, big bathroom, big TV and fun things like a big blackboard and chalk to write on! Pool was out of order when we were there, so I can't comment. But it seemed small and just surrounded by walls, from what we saw. At a time when boutique 4 star hotels are offering everything the W has with more personalised service, cheaper prices and organic locations it is hard to recommend this hotel. But it was fun and a great nights sleep and at this price probably cheaper than any boutique option.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: ReviewLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the W San Diego over the 4th of July weekend. After reading the reviews, I was a little concerned about the quality of the hotel and whether or not my husband and I (who are in our mid 30s) would find the demographic of the hotel relaxing. The reviews mentioned that the hotel is noisy, catered to people in their 20s, that the service was poor and that the rooms are small. We were pleasantly surprised by our stay and had a great time. My husband and I stayed at the W Hotel in the Maldives for our honeymoon so we were hoping for the same customer service. Although the hotels are completely different, the service we received in San Diego was great. We stayed in a Cool Corner room and were very happy with the size of the room and the amazing natural light that filled our room and bathroom throughout the day. The Acura service was great and we never had a problem finding a ride to travel around town. The roof top bar was great in the evening but also relaxing during the day while lounging in their cabanas. We also loved the lobby bar at night and didn't find the music loud at all (as mentioned in other reviews). My husband and I want to thank Andrea and Gabrielle in guest services for making this such a memorable stay and for reminding us what a great hotel the W is (whether you are on your own island or in a city).

Reviews.Title: “Only For Young People”
Reviews.Author: scwretired
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in downtown San Diego and that's the best part - location. Where do I start - The Pool was closed, Internet cost extra except in the lobby. No coffee available anywhere in the hotel except in the restaurant. No chair to sit in the room - a window seat way to high to use. The shower was designed so that the enitre bath and toilet got wet when showering. The elevators are so dark inside you can't see when they even open. The lounge was filled with 20 somethings - it's really a party hotel - anyone over 35 should probablly avoid. I will say the staff was very nice - The room was attractive but not condusive to spending any time in. If you're paying over $150 it's too much. For the price of the hotel internet and coffee should be complimentary. Also parking was $28 per night. SCWRetired

Reviews.Title: “stylish luxury”
Reviews.Author: DeskJobDaydreamer
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel for comfortable rooms, a bit of luxury, and excellent customer service. This hotel is hip, cool, and offers excellent service. The basic rooms offer a sitting area, gorgeous modern decor, and beautiful bathrooms. The suites offer even more space and are mainly on the corner (windows on two sides). The gym is small, but was never crowded when I went in. The hotel will arrange free transportation to many locations downtown. They are remodeling (Spring 2008), so call ahead to check on amenities (pool, restaurant, etc.) if this is a concern. The clientelle were mainly young business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “No W vibe, Not W standard”
Reviews.Author: ndtpunk71
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a decent location. The lobby and check-in just didn't give off the W vibe. The room was the same. It was nicely decorated, but too small and just did not feel the hip W vibe. Nice outdoor lounge with comfy sofas. The sand is not comfy for the ladies (heels). The pool sucks; it's smaller than most home pools. I've been to the W in LA and SF and this one just doesn't have the same vibe. It doesn't feel like a W. The staff was friendly. However, the waitress at the lounge is rude and needs to go. At first, we thought she was anti-asian but then we saw that it was just plain rudeness. I would have mentioned this to mgt but just didnt have the energy to even bother. Would not stay there again. For the price, there are better hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Over It”
Reviews.Author: lulu383
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W Hotel three years and enjoyed it, but this visit was extremely disappointing. Instead of cool and cutting-edge, it now feels dated and in need of refreshing. To start with the positive, all of the staff have been courteous and professional. It's unfortunate that their politeness is not enough to make this hotel a worthwhile place to stay. The hotel did not honor my request of a high-floor room far from the elevator (even though it was made both through my travel agent at the time of booking and AGAIN with a same-day call the morning of check-in). Instead, I was placed on the fourth floor in the room ADJACENT to the elevator, low enough that I could hear the constant music playing in the lobby. When I complained, I was told the only other available room in the whole hotel was a smoking room. Normally, this wouldn't bother me, but when I was dispatched to this room, I was appalled. The room smelled as though 50 people had been chain-smoking in their all night long. There were burns on the carpet and duvet, in addition to chipped paint on the desk and black scuff marks all over the wall. The room was so filthy I wouldn't have taken off my shoes, never mind slept in the bed. Another call, this time to the manager.
